All venues that see a high volume of traffic can result in the service being a little jaded and that also applies to Schlenkerla. I got the impression the majority are well meaning but they certainly seem to tire as the day goes along.
As a pub I would recommend this all day long – it is one of the finest pubs I’ve ever been to and I wince with regret that we haven’t developed Star Trek type transporters so I can visit every week.

name: U Černého vola
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Their own label beer replacing the new defunct Kozel 12 (on tap), Pilsner Urquell and - our choice - dark Kozel. Limited selection of Czech and Austrian wine and Eastern European favoured liqueurs.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Medieval, cro-magnon. Chunky wooden tables, crests of royal houses on the walls, a forbidden stammtisch table for locals.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Unpretentious, authentic, communal

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Standing room by the bar, very simple food options

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very good for the area

description: Another gem of a pub, U Cerneho Vola (the Black Ox) is increasingly isolated as it shares streets with touristy, overpriced restaurants and souvenir shops close to Prague’s castle,
Walking through the door offers you immediate refuge from the hustle and bustle and you are greeted by the kind of down to earth, no-nonsense pub you wouldn’t think would exist where it is.
You could always spend your time in a bland place with a style not particular to anywhere, but why bother when you can still have a great time and go to a true Czech pub, which is what this.
The pub operates a similar tapster/server duo to U Hrocha, a reliable system - tapster on beer duty while an amiable enough server trots around doing the necessary interaction. The understated pride with which they carry out their jobs is sometimes overlooked but it is worth acknowledging and all adds to the overall feel of the place.
The venue is largely set up for communal bench seating, which fills up quite quickly around lunch hours, and bar a lull in the afternoon, becomes fairly busy from early evening onwards. The only sounds to enjoy are that of the conversation and surrounding pub noises, the clink of glasses, the occasional plate of pub grub (fried cheese, smoked sausage etc) emerging from the kitchen.
There are some stained glass windows and medieval insignia above the dark wooden bench seats, but otherwise it’s the usual curved pivnice type walls inside. This is pub going stripped back to its core and none the poorer for it.
When the tourists disappear from Castle Hill, the locals emerge and seek out U Cerneho Vola for a few jars, transforming the venue’s atmosphere into a vibrant destination. Getting a seat is essential but be aware they are in high demand. Don’t be shy – if it means sitting shoulder to shoulder with a stranger, so be it. You never know what might be in store.
Additionally, Max Bahnson has advised that U Cerneho Vola are run essentially non-for-profit and a huge portion of the money they make goes towards social projects. While this might not be foremost in your mind as to where to go, it’s good to know in the background a pub has its heart in the right place, especially if the gruff Czech service ever puts your nose out of joint!

name: Roncsbár
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Corporate beer options, limited craft range, mixers and basic cocktails.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Junkyard aesthetic with ruined plane and vehicles, clutter and off-beat decor.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Excitable, friendly

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food vans, outdoor space, TV, live music and other live events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area (very good)

description: https://europeanbarguide.wordpress.com/2019/02/05/roncsbar-debrecen/

While ruin bars may be synonymous with Budapest, other cities in Hungary quickly taken inspiration from the design and ethos – it was inevitable they would create their own version. Gázfröccs in Sopron and Csillag EzPresszó in Győr both prove that the bar has been raised. Roncsbár in Hungary’s 2nd city Debrecen, is the most convincing example yet that it’s worth leaving Hungary’s megacity to explore the nightlife in the provinces.

While I love an old boozer, such as Wichmann’s in Budapest, it must be said the standards of décor, atmosphere and amenities in Hungarian pubs have shot up dramatically since Szimpla et al arrived on the scene. Roncsbár (Roncs, meaning Wreck) immediately showed that its up to the task.

Established 2013, Roncs is both a cosy pub, a concert hall, a garden terrace and a arty streetfood courtyard, delivering the alluring appeal we love about ruin bars – a combination of rooms to explore as well as cosy areas to congregate. Unlike unsuccessful attempts to export these to the West, it doesn’t feel the least bit corporate, even when you add bouncers and plastic cups (we’ll get to that in a minute).
There is no shortage of ways to spend your evening here, whether that be for a quiet drink, for food, for music and partying, or games. What’s better, the bar is designed in such a way that it never feels like those people are clashing with each other.

While not as enormous as the likes of the Fogas Ház ‘party complex’ or the ruined mansion of Szimpla, there is a fair expanse of space, and just like those it’s exciting to walk through it all for the first time.

Entering via the front door of the pub, you could be fooled for thinking that’s all there is. It is very pleasant – nothing negative to report – the area is focused on drinks and socialising rather than food – fine by me. You’ll find exposed brick and slightly ramshackle wooden tables. The ceiling appears to be studded with cymbals from drum kits (or was I wrong?). There’s a lively atmosphere and if that was it, then Roncsbár would probably warrant inclusion on our website as an 8/10 pub.

But after you’ve taken in the indoors, have a wander around and look for a side door – this will take you into the entrance way for the ruin-pub aspect proper. The design suddenly explodes into an eclectic whirlwind of bric-a-brac and, if you pay attention, some finely-crafted artwork. The cherry on top of the cake is, in this case, a wrecked (get it?!) aeroplane which looks like it has been hung, interior contents an all, to the inside of the roof.

What’s better, is this is heated in the icy winter and well-ventilated, keeping the place comfortable at all times.

Carry on past the stalls to find a courtyard seating area which will appeal to anyone wanting to watch some sport (big screen, of course) and a terrace garden area – closed on my visit due to the snowy weather – but definitely a further area to spread out in spring and summer. Barbecue? Yes please.

Drinks are about on standard with most Hungarian bars, however their website boasts they have their own-label beer from Rendelkezik (Reindeer?) which I must admit I didn’t see. It’s still possible to get a standard lager for a fair price and nothing here, be it beer, wine or spirits will offend most local or foreign wallets. If you’re outside you will be made to drink it in a plastic cup – on the upside no-one has to worry about broken glass.

Service can be a bit rushed and impersonal in that way all popular places end up being, but that isn’t a reason to mark this place down.

Unlike Budapest, there really is only one place like this in Debrecen, certainly making it stand out. There will always be one or two people of a contrary or conservative nature who take a dislike to these bars. You can’t please all of the people all of the time, but Roncsbár comes pretty damn close.

I love being able to dip in and out of events that are happening, be able to get some fresh air, or have a sit down, and still be in the same place, and still have something interesting to look at.

Please note that Debrecen has a very lively, albeit dispersed nightlife and there are several pubs of a very different style that are also worth visiting. Please see HERE.

There are only a few bars that have earned our 10/10 score, and so congratulations goes to Roncsbár. Long live the Wreck!

name: Le Pot au Lait
description:
EBG Rating:: 10
Choice/Quality of Drinks: Accommodating range of tap and bottled Belgian classics, mixers, shots and basic cocktails
Style/Décor: Surrealist with animal and plant themes, animist in nature. Bizarre, distinctive and unique. Spacious.
Atmosphere/Character: Friendly, excitable.
Amenities/Events: Courtyard space, basic food, occasional live events.
Value For Money: Good considering the importance of the venue.
description: Wonderful ruin-bar a-like concept. Partly outdoors, partly partly outdoors, and rooms indoors. Fabulous no-expense spared décor you will never tire of looking at. Friendly young atmosphere. A 10/10 venue.

name: Ye Olde Cheshire Cheese
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Sam Smiths beers and branded drinks. A full compliment of English pub options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Alleyway setting. Historic preserved venue with a mix of Gothic/Victorian/Georgian features across several floors. Simple seating. Some candle-lit space. Cavernous downstairs.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Important-feeling. Cosy and convivial in places, no more so than the main bar room, still one of the best interior bar rooms in the entire country.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Luncheon room, snacks, limited outdoor space

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
No longer the bargain of old, Sam Smiths drinks are now fully in line with central London.
description: A legendary historic pub but one that remains so, rather than simply having been so. The character of the venue has not been extinguished, you will find an early Georgian style tavern with ante rooms and 2 basements. A roaring fire by the bar, tiles, and crosshatch window panels. Full of quirks and original character, and despite being run by Sam Smiths and attracting a touristy crowd, the quality endures. Very few places like this remain in Europe. (Added 2020)

name: Museumsstüberl
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: As much a going concern as a pub than the museum upstairs, this multi-floor venue offers a back-in-time experience of a medieval era kneipe. The ausschenk area is particularly atmospheric with its stammtisch of regulars and a handsome bar. Beers are Munich standard, as are prices. Make sure to have a wander around as there is much to see.

name: Būsi trečias
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A strong all-rounder. Shady wooden pub, albeit a modern refit, you can find sport on TV, board games and candlelit lounging in a place that manages to cover several bases well without alienating anyone but without being utterly boring either. Offering their own beers too. We enjoyed it. (Added 2019)

name: Base Camp
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: A bottle shop with terrace, small area for drinking by the bar, and smoky backroom. The choice is terrific, it's decent value, and later in the evening the atmosphere in the room really takes off.

name: Free Trade Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: Great drinks and atmosphere.
Good decor and layout.
Neighbourhood corner pub with a bohemian feel mixing traditional North East pub qualities with a young flair. A local institution and very well deserved. (Added 2020)

name: Crown Posada
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Narrow historic pub which has retained its original features. Stained glass, wooden partitioned, leather seats. It's a communal sort of place, so be prepared for some banter. No less than a city institution that everyone has some story involving. (Added 2020)

name: Bräustüberl Tegernsee
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️

description: Huge bierhalle with similarly large biergarten overlooking both Tegernsee lake but the towers of the monastery. Inside you'll find typical Bavarian fare - curved ceilings, dark wood, large communal tables. Service is quick and friendly, and the beers great value. Overall a reliable recommendation.

name: Pusser's
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️
description: A distinctive venue which tries to marry high-end cocktails with the sort of rough-and-ready spit n sawdust pub surrounds you would expect in old New York or Ireland. Overall it works, and becomes a really nice dive bar to enjoy a cocktail. Pusser's is so named after the eponymous rum brand. Drinks are exorbitantly expensive, however of decent quality and served with a touch of class. If it wasn't for the cost, you'd be lining up every week for this place.

name: Le Clou
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A boazn, perhaps one of the few remaining in the altstadt district, Le Clou is a small kneipe, one room with a bar running along it. Service and patrons are down to earth and friendly, if sometimes in your face with it. There is no doubt this is the place to go if you are exhausted by the bierhallen and just want to have fun.

name: Landhaus
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: 'Eck kneipe' corner pub with some interesting verdant decor, the place is small and cosy, but with a patio out on the street. Service is good and no nonsense, while the beer is excellently kept and well poured. For the area it is down to earth and fairly priced, a respite from the enormous beer halls if you fancy something more casual.

name: Giesinger Bräustüberl
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: The effective brewery tap of Giesinger, it certainly qualifies as distinctive. While the layout is modern there are some thoughtful touches like a stage arrangement in the entrance yard, a balcony area and sandpit instead of a beer garden (it's a big one too). Set in a 19th century building by the river, there is enough here of a quirky nature to offset some corporate elements here and there. Service is friendly and efficient.

name: Neruda Kultur Café
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: One of the few unpretentious and non-bland venues to socialise around Augsburg. Decor is offbeat, brooding and red with music, art and theatre abounding. Left leaning, you'll find instruments available to jam with, music performances and a lively community scene. Very well reviewed. It's a real classic.

name: Damenhof Augsburg
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: A cocktail bar in a truly unique venue built by the Fugger's as part of a social program, the Damenhof was at one point a bathhouse, and this makes use of its opulent and frankly spectacular courtyard, which even now features a central pool. The place is stylishly lit, and the cocktails are of high quality (and price). Beer is available too. Whatever your poison is, it's worth coming to see and enjoy the surroundings.

name: Sixenbräu-Stüble
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: A gaststatte specialising in Swabian food, this is nevertheless a pub with its dedicated bar area that's very easy on the eye, homely and well decorated pub rooms. There is enough space to appear for a drink or for food which for us is enough to add to our guide.

name: Bayrish Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A split personality pub, which seems to want to have its cake and eat it - half Irish, half Bayrisch. Whatever they were going for, the good news is it succeeds either because of or in spite of that. The building gives a natural shape to the pub with two rooms to the left and right of the entrance. While open plan there is a deal of privacy in the partition and a true social scene. It feels like the market town pub anywhere, and does a damn good job of it. Decor is pleasingly not plastic-paddy - there is of course the odd Guinness mirror here and there, but also plenty of other things to look at. We can easily recommend this place.

name: Gaststätte Guckloch
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A true pub - a drinks focused Gaststatte within Rothenburg city walls. This place looks handsome from the outside, but there's a bit of grit inside. By locals, for locals, this is a town kneipe that's not really bothered in putting on Sunday-best for the tourists, and all the better for it. With a gamesroom in the back and terrace opposite, along with a schanke, you are well catered for here. After a few visits the service also markedly improved.

name: Altfraenkische Weinstube
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very local offerings of wine, with limited beer and back bar selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Old style tavern or inn with plants, nik naks and rustic ornaments. Very homely and comfortable. Climbing ivy outside. Local's table by the bar, lamp lights.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beautiful atmosphere created by the genteel and wonderfully put together building and rooms.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited outdoor seating, cooked meals, hotel.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably priced, considering everything.

description: This characterful Bavarian inn and winehouse is run by an older gent who has the honour of 'Patron of the Inns', an award given to those who preserve the traditional format. Everything from the climbing ivy outside to the taxidermy and bric-a-brac inside gives the feeling of authenticity, true identity not faked or impersonated. The man of the house is a real character and you are his guest, he is not your servant.

name: Stadtlockal Forchheim
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: After a couple of visits I am happy to include this on our guide. The excellent selection of Franconian beer at fair prices is a good start. Their house beer 'Mauerscheisser' is simply stunning. The terrace outside is very scenic and pleasant. Indoors there is distinctive decor and a dedicated pub bar area, although the place is also cafe/restaurant focused it clearly also functions as a pub.

name: Brauereigaststätte Kneitinger
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A huge venue, but nevertheless a versatile one. A German beer hall which is blessed to have high quality beer available - especially the bock and dunkel - but also interesting surroundings with an airy atrium entrance hall with side rooms leading off it, the best of which is first on the left, the Gaststatte room. We can easily recommend this place.

name: Piratenhöhle
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Local favourite - rock music in a cavern. It feels like you're in the bowels of a ship to be honest. Great fun, plenty of local life to be had and reasonable drinks options. A late drink here would be a good idea.

name: Klosterschenke Weltenburg
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: How do you rate a pub that's on the site of a monastery with such a spectacular chapel and gorge-side setting? Same as any other I guess. This beer hall is gigantic and in high demand in summer. Most people reach it via boat from Kelheim, and then join the queue. It would normally be unreasonable to include the surroundings of a pub as part of a review, but here you can't help it. Sat drinking their Asam-Bock overlooking the river and surroundings is quite simply a one-off and must-visit in any beer voyager's life.

name: Auerbräu
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: It may be worth the walk to this place, the 'real Regensburg' perhaps. Certainly this beer hall has a more relaxed authentic vibe than some in the city centre, along with fairer prices. The beer garden is attractive among horse chestnut trees, while the interior is a reasonably character attempt on an old setting. Whatever beer was brewed here or nearby has gone, but Kneitinger step into the breach ably. Service is also pleasant and quick.

name: The Free Press
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Greene King owed but thankfully it remains a pleasingly homely and characterful pub that hasn't yet been turned into a Laura Ashley dining room or a blandardised chain pub. Well reviewed, unsurprisingly.

name: Champion Of The Thames
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: While Greene King owned, thankfully they haven't messed with the format or appearance. Small, compact ale house with some dedications to the rowing team. Even the pump clips are 'retro' which is a nod to keeping things just how they were. (Added August 2020)

name: The Cambridge Blue
description:
EBG Rating:: 9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Fabulous free-house with distinctive barn-like interior strewn with beer ephemera. Characterful and cosy, with a community feel. A list of beers longer than your arm and a pleasant garden out back, this is the stuff of dreams for any pub-goer. (Added 2020)

name: Mean-Eyed Cat
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: Vampy b-movie decor and garish seating ends up actually working quite well here at this studenty bar. The basics and the setup work, the beer selection is exceptionally good (including a Sours Fridge), and it's all just a little bit distinctive, for the better. Bring plenty of money though. (added 2019)

name: The Albion
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A collection of Victoriana and war-era memorabilia clads the walls and fittings of this corner neighbourhood pub. The owner is a collector and his pub creation is the most distinctive we found in the city. With cosy, upholstered seating and a cast of friendly staff and regulars, it's pleasant even when it's quiet, but it needs your help and support to survive after the demise of the owner. Meals have been on offer with some deliberately throwback turn of the century dishes prepared. (Added 2021)

name: The Cross Keys Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: This Joule's pub is beautifully constructed with mid-brown wood fittings and glass panels, along with leather upholstered seats. Worth visiting just to see it. The place focuses on what it does best, which may be why it gets great reviews. (Added 2021)

name: Ye Olde Boot Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: SAM SMITHS ALERT - Please avoid if you can't stand Sam Smiths pubs!

However, the medieval character of this historic pub has been well preserved. The a grand timberframe exterior is a sight to behold, and walking up to the mid-level rows to enter is an unusual experience for an out-of-towner. Inside, the genius loci is retained, with stained glass, lanterns and curtains in a snug corner by the exit, while rows of sturdy bench seats line a main room towards the bar area. No dodgy gentrification. It is a cosy place for a pint and a read, popular with students as well as the older crowd. A place where you can have a conversation with someone different to yourself.

As per usual be wary of the occasional scummy character, you can't use phones, tablets, etc, swear or do any other number of things due to Humphrey's ridiculous petty obsessions. (Added 2021)

name: Ye Olde Cottage Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Dart boards, pool, old fashioned homely bar and 2 room setup with a real fire and timberframe exterior. The end effect is not quite 'Moon Under Water' stuff of dreams, but it is a bustling market town pub with an authentic, unpretentious  atmosphere. Several real ales on rotation, not great lager options though. (Added 2020)

name: Further North
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: Only the traditionally remorseless poor value for money (which is the hallmark of the parent company) holds back this lovely neighbourhood pub, with a cosy, fairly twee design. Upstairs or downstairs, it's a nice space for a drink. The bar area is compact but they still offer 8 or so keg beers + 1 cask beer of varying styles. For a neighbourhood ale house it works very nicely.

name: Fuk;s Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A cool alternative lounge bar decorated with plush antique furniture, this one takes the pace down while still offering a bohemian vibe. A few decent offerings behind the bar, good service and reasonable prices. An absolutely roaring fire in winter.

name: Yorckschlösschen
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Dramatic jazz/theatre entrance way leads to an eclectic performance room strewn with antiques and posters from time past. Incredibly characterful, it has an atmosphere you can't easily bottle. With local beers, food, a beer garden, this is all round one of Berlin's finest options.

name: Dschungel
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Strategic decor emphasises the jungle theme, with the verdant wallpaper and lights complimented by ceiling mirrors to give both a sense of depth and woozy lack of perspective. A terrarium also clearly helps! Not your everyday bar feature. Cocktails are the main event here though they do a couple of beer options for a reasonable enough price.

name: Charlottenburger Wappen
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: A rightly popular community pub with a friendly feel. This one goes for a more genteel appearance, a little like a Czech hospoda. Service is kind and attentive, coming here is a good place to sit and watch a slice of local life.

name: Peppi Guggenheim International
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Richly enjoyable sidestreet bar with live music performances. The energy of the place seems to shine out from the street. Vibrant place that is part of Berlin's heart and soul.

name: Wilhelm Hoeck 1892
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: Old Berlin is preserved in aspic here. Shelves of old brandy barrels, dark wood and a beautiful bar area in the 'kneipe' side of the venue. While Kindl is the stock beer, there are a few other notable options on tap and the old fashioned Berliner Weisse with syrup available. Next door is a smarter Gaststatte, with less character. (Added 2021)

name: Dicke Wirtin
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: While advertised as a restaurant the end effect is somewhere between a Gaststatte and Kneipe. The place is historic with a 'fat landlord' icon, and lots of memorabilia to look at. A long room creates a snug bunker effect, amplified by the tactical positioning of mirrors. The beer and food options are both decent. It's a must-visit. (Added 2021)

name: Zum goldenen Faß
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: An old-timer venue, the kneipen of decades ago here. Dark wood and mirrors prevail, with a simple unflashy setup. One or two attempts to modernise around the bar area are unsuccessful, but the local life and interesting features further into the pub room stand out. It's also dirt cheap.

name: Zur Pinte, Berlin-Neukölln
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: Welcoming boazn style bar run by a kindly middle aged lady. Popular with all different ages, classes and so on, for the good service and very honest prices.

name: Altstadtkneipe Noah
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Wide range of German, particularly Bavarian beers and full compliment of Central European-slanted alternatives to beer.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cluttered antiquey aesthetic with wall space crammed with framed artwork, collected nik-naks and ephemera. Dusky and brooding atmosphere with candle light. Outdoor courtyard seating in thematically similar surroundings.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very cosy, brooding, chatty, local life.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, music, very occasional events.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair / Standard

description: A bolt from the blue. This place stands out not only among its Erfurt contemporaries but in Germany as a whole. The time and effort to assemble the fixtures, fittings and decor, and the skill in producing one of the most cosy pubs you're likely to visit anywhere, is striking. This isn't all about the decor either, by far. Along with a couple of unusual tap options, the bottle range is extensive, covering Franconia, Belgium, and craft options. There's a very nice beer garden out of the back too. Sublime, almost worth visiting Erfurt alone to find. (Added 2019)

name: Pintchen
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: "The last quaint pub in Wetzlar". You'll find Pitchen in a traditional townhouse with a medieval pillar entranceway, leading to a deep, dark brown pub with yellowing windows and jazz instruments turned into light fittings. It's smokey, and this is one pub where that really works. Damn the smoke smell, this place has real atmosphere. The old guy who keeps the bar has an appropriate appearance. The surroundings are an expression of his personality. (added 2021)

name: Café Vinyl
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A smallish town like Wetzlar does well to feature two outstanding venues. This one is music focused with a huge selection of vinyl. The guy who runs it clearly loves music and keeps his bar open while he's having fun. There are a few amenities such as a pool table in the back, and the decor feels like a record store trying to become a bar...or is it the other way around? Atmosphere, a little bit charming and an all round good place to sit. Decent drinks options too. (Added 2021)

name: Altes Brauhaus
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable selection of beers, albeit that this is no longer a Brauhaus but the shell of one.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Typical city centre brewpub type appearance with high ceilings, long bar, bannisters and chunky furniture.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The pub does a lot of day trade with locals despite the relatively prominent central position in what is a touristy town. More of a sluggish option for later on in the evening though.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Cooked meals, newspapers.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Middling, going on poor.

description: A reliable, staple city centre option is what everyone, both resident and tourist hopes to find. This is surprisingly difficult sometimes in Germany, mainly due to overemphasis on food or bland setup. This one balances pub and grub with neat precision. As a result, you will find regulars and local life here for beers and a chat, who are as much part of the scenery as the decor. The size also helps, remaining reasonably compact, rather than bloating into an enormous beerhall. It's a decent all-rounder rather than a spectacular option, but each aspect rounds up to a satisfying whole.

name: Brewery Päffgen
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Quoted from European Beer Guide: (which we here at European Bar Guide also agree with)

"Päffgen is a must visit (not a Cologne must visit, but a European must visit). Should you wish to do that shopping thing, Päffgen isn't that far past the bit of town where that sort of stuff goes on. You could walk it. It's only about 1 km from the station/cathedral. (For lazy gits: from Hauptbahnhof U5 two stops to Friesenplatz.)

I try to do my background research when writing these guides and there is material aplenty about Cologne. I have learnt that I am not alone in my admiration for Päffgen Kölsch. There are plenty of local fans for both it and Malzmühle (another favourite of mine). Taking the Kölsch-konvenzion seriously, this is the type of beer you would expect to get. Light, but quite bitter and aromatically hoppy. Very, very drinkable. The tiny glasses can be frustrating when you get a bit of a thirst going.

I always dread this bit. How the bloody hell do I think of a new way to tell you lot about the white pine tops to the tables? Is there a new twist to the wood panelling? The oak barrels in the corridor spouting Kölsch - is there anything you haven't already heard me say extolling the virtues of this method of serving beer? No. I think that I've used up my thesaurus for brewpub/ brewery tap/ ausschank or whatever. Päffgen is a very good example of a traditional Rhineland brewpub. The brewery is there for everyone to see, joined to the pub by a roofed-in courtyard. If you've been in one of these places, you'll know exactly what to expect inside. Half pigs roasted. Sacks of potatoes fried. And served on one plate.

It was founded in 1883, at the height of the "Gründerzeit".

I hope that I don't upset local chauvinists when I say: it's as good as being in Düsseldorf"

name: Gaststätte Em Hähnche
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: If you are seeking a more intimate experience than the beer halls, the dinky Em Hahnche on the corner provides this. While it is a food-focused gaststatte there is plenty of room at the bar for a drink and a chat, in fact the very nature of it makes it feel like the right thing to do. Service from the two women running the place is quick and charming. Decor from fairylights and of course - hens! , along with some tiling, helps to create an effective cosy atmosphere. The reviews do not lie.

name: Sion Bräues Traditionsbrauhaus
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
No longer a brauhaus, if it ever was. The drinks offer is Kolsch with some alternatives. Full back bar for those who can't stand Kolsch or beer in general.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Standard workaday pub that has been retconned into an ever old-looking beer hall.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Busy-feeling during the day with passing trade and a cast of regulars, then struggles to get out of 3rd gear at night. Pretty cosy and effective surroundings though.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, newspapers, TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A useful option up your sleeve if the permanently sought after Lommerzheim is full. This bar is on a busy street and does a bustling weekday fare. It's an all-rounder with space dedicated for drinking, sport on TV but also places to sit and chat, and in the back, dine. The Antik element of the decor helps make this place stand out above the norm, and you can rest assured this place is frequented by locals, not tourists.

name: Brewery Schumacher
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: An altbier beer hall which has kept its pointedly dour, brown, traditional appearance (all for the better, we believe). This is one to visit when the weather is frightful outside (It's Dusseldorf so very likely). The beer is full flavoured and yet subtle and yet highly drinkable, which is much to its credit.

name: Uerige
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: It took a couple of tries but we are now sold on Uerige, especially the Shaenke room with its stained glass, copper panels and brickwork, which during the day help create an atmosphere of almost church like dedication to altbier. The complex is sprawling however, and you may wish to explore, choosing your favourite spot, if it's is available. The Altbier is decent and reliable here, though a little overrated in comparison to others.

name: Et Kabuffke Killepitsch Stube
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: Similar to Jenever tasting houses in Amsterdam, this bar focuses on Killepitsch krautlikor, among lots of other shot options, some of which are served from a window hatch in the front. NOT Beer. The bar itself however is well worth popping in, with a balcony level and decor that feel suitably aged enough to make you feel as though you are partaking in a long tradition. The switch between here and Uerige is not just a rite of passage for all young Dusseldorfers, but tourists too.

name: The Strugglers
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: Classic community pub, patterned beer emblems lining the ceiling and walls, traditional real ale sidestreet boozer. Locally well known, and clearly run like a tight ship. A special atmosphere and cosiness overrides relatively poor value and lack of good lager and bottle choices to compliment the decent range of real ales. (Added 2020)

name: The Ackhorne
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: While close to the station and busy Micklegate bar, this pubs situation halfway along a narrow cobbled side-street near a church, makes it not obviously visible from either side. As a result, it is just off the beaten path enough to remain unsullied by the tourist hordes. This is largely a local's pub, not a tourist pub, with a pub bulldog, a friendly down-to-earth and communal crowd with pub grub, bar billiards and attractive features such as exposed beams, settles and unusual layout. An all-rounder with a dynamic feel on busy evenings. (Added 2020)

name: Craven Heifer Hotel
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: Beautiful riverside setting, this Yorkshire country pub is the beating heart of the hamlet of Stainforth. Unlike so many that have been turned into anodyne dining venues, this maintains rooms for drinking, socialising and games while also serving lunch and dinner, providing a decent balance. Current owners are keen to keep it that way. (Added 2020)

name: Game Cock
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A Thwaites-tied pub in a beautiful, often bleak Yorkshire village. The rural setting is complimented by a roaring fire in the bar area with several little rooms set off it. The fact it hasn't been opened up means it retains some character, especially considering the array of nik-naks and ephemera they've collected. Try the snug or the public bar for the best atmosphere, while their food currently has a French slant. Wines are a plus, and the adjoining shop and bakery are testament to this unusual operation. (Added 2021)

name: The Pheasant, Bassenthwaite
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: This is certainly a gastropub and hotel more than it is a pub, but the part of the pub that remains is an absolute one off, with crackled crimson paint on the walls and ceilings, lamplight, rickety furniture and fire, they have preserved the very heart of the pub for drinking and socialising. It's vitally important nothing happens to this room otherwise the soul of the place will be extinguished. (Added 2021)

name: Fox & Hounds Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: This pub is an increasingly rare example of a homely, lived-in extension of someone's living room, rather than a template duck-grey dining room. Local cask beers and craft cans provide a surprisingly up-to-date choice, a real fire and true Yorkshire patter provides the home comforts, food is also available. A community venue to treasure. (Added 2021)

name: Brewery Beroun Bear
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ****
Style/Décor: ****
Atmosphere/Character: ***

Amenities/Events: ****

Value For Money: *****
description: Quite an experience to walk from the station, through a building site to a seemingly abandoned industrial complex with tanks and other military hardware in the courtyard. But then you reach the brewery doors into the pub itself. Warm, cosy, rustic and entirely local, you'll need a phrasebook or be good at pointing in order to be served. Even the brewery's list of beers is unusual, with an 8 degree light lager and some interesting seasonal rotations and experiments.

name: Restaurace Dačický
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Atmospheric front room with bar and huge hearth in high Medieval style. An interesting range of beers are available here, while large tables and a cosy environment mark it out as a standout in the city. Hearty meals complete the set. (Added 2018)

name: Smugglers Den
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A diamond in the rough, you may not expect this place to be up to much, but in the backstreets of Morecambe there is a tidy little pub here. Very much a smuggler's den with stone floor, tarred beams, brasses and stained glass in the front giving it a murky but very cosy feel. Highly rated and popular with a range of locals.

name: Gaffel am Dom I Kölsches Brau- und Wirtshaus
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: Undeniably A* view of Cologne cathedral and sympathetically decorated with antique and retro signage. This place is cavernous so you may prefer to sit in the more pub-like space to the left of the entrance. A decent all-rounder and undeniably one of the main beer halls in the city, perhaps not a top 5 but certainly a top 10 in that category. (Added 2021)

name: Duck & Drake
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A long time before Leeds became gentrified this pub was ahead of the game offering live music, real ale in a revamp of stale offerings around the place. It remains completely disinterested in the various corporate-financed bars elsewhere in the city and continues to do its own thing. Several real ales, down to earth boozer surroundings, live music and a pimped up beer garden make this, in hindsight a bit of a standout in a city centre lacking similar venues. (Added 2021)

name: Snickleway Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Characterful layout with old signage perched on a ledge with windows to the upstairs. Several real ales on the pumps as well as a couple of one-notch above the ordinary lagers. Friendly sort of crowd

name: House Of The Trembling Madness
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Good luck getting a table in the loft. A very much in-demand venue with exposed beams, statement wall with mounted deer skulls and antlers. A bottle shop offering everything under the sun and range of pumps upstairs. Small but quality food offerings. Lovely in winter. (Added 2018)

name: House Of Trembling Madness, Lendal
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Temple of beer in converted Georgian townhouse. Decor has a dramatic, slightly macabre flourish in places. Layout is across several floors operating as a bottle shop, cafe and upstairs pub. In demand for obvious reasons, it is an excellent choice. (Added 2018)

name: Mother Shipton's Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A lovely cottage style inn far enough out of town to not be too touristy. Inside there is a cosy country pub with a roaring fire in winter and enough niches to feel comfortable and cosy. Outside, a riverside terrace provides beautiful surroundings to drink or eat. The food is occasionally fantastic, and reasonably priced. (Added 2019)

name: Pivnice Ferdinand
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: It's back. After a worrying year or two of closure it's reopened doing the same business as always. A great neighbourhood pub that sometimes serves as a drinking hole for the nearby football fans (friendly though) Ferdinand beers are on tap served in pristine condition as always, and for a very reasonable price. Simple, sociable and just a touch of lived in atmosphere. (Added 2018)

name: Het Waterhuis aan de Bierkant
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: On balance we have been churlish to exclude this place over the years. It really is a good spot with a nice range of beers and excitable local crowd, though there are areas where you can have a quiet ruminate with a book and a strong beer too. Good views out over the water, as you'd expect from the title.

name: The Victoria
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.4
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Beautifully well preserved alehouse near train tracks with ornate Victorian frontage. Inside, there is a simple understated class to the place, decorated with retro signage and simple tables extending to the outdoor area. It is simply a classic of its kind. (Added 2020)

name: Canalhouse
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: A pub with a canal and barges inside is pretty peculiar and this props up what might otherwise be a rather cavernous and middle of the road venue. The drinks selection is very strong covering lots of bases, while food and outdoor areas make it a versatile venue and one that's hard to miss out on while in the city. (Added 2017)

name: Ye Olde Trip To Jerusalem
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: Even Greene King haven't messed with this pub too much, and long may that continue. It's a one off, built into caves besides the castle, with nooks and crannies, spectacular unique rooms and just about free enough of merchandise and tacky plaques to survive as a day to day option as a boozer. All rooms are interesting in their own right. GK range of beers is of course one of the shortfalls. Nevertheless, you'll find cosy seats around the fire in the bar area, snug or upstairs.

name: The Old Nags Head
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: One of the ultimate hikers pubs, this venue is the official start of the Pennine Way, and always host to an excitable/weary wave of hikers coming and going, looking for a rest and some grub. Despite the clear touristic aspect, the interior remains almost scrupulously unchanged with tiled floor suitable for muddy boots, and simple rustic decor and furniture that has gained a certain character over the years. Hard wearing. Despite the location there are one or two interesting beers, along with several cask ales. (Added 2021)

name: The George
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: This is one of the less touristy pubs in Castleton, with a mixture of locals and hikers. While it does food, there is much more space for drinking and socialising in this two-sided pub with a central bar flanking both rooms. A reasonable all-rounder without a wow factor but with a real sense of countryside familiarity and welcome. Some unusual beers and local beers available despite Wells involvement.

name: Ye Olde Nags Head
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: The true pub character is in the front room by the bar near the fire. Stone walls, cosy seats, carpeted floor, it exudes welcome. You'll find local real ales available too, albeit fairly expensive in places. (added 2021)

name: The Briton's Protection
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: A clearly distinctive venue with preserved heritage interior, tiles, ornate saloon bar and comfy snug backroom. A survivor and worth seeking out. Very large whisky selection and local cask ales. Tenants in long running hate-hate relationship with their PubCo owners Star Taverns. (Added 2020)

name: Peveril Of The Peak
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Super distinctive light green exterior that looks so out of place it seems to now have been beamed down from space. Multiroomed throw back interior. Majestic curved bar area with stained glass, snug rooms, pool. A classic preserved boozer of its kind and one of the most treasured venues in the North. Our favourite pub in Manchester. (Added 2020)

name: The New Oxford
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A beer mecca, with several cask + keg options supported by a large selection of some of the best Belgian beers. Green upholstered bench seating along the side give the place a slight feel of a bar over a pub. The overall effect is positive enough to merit an inclusion.

name: 80 Days Bierhaus
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
For a small bar, impressive number of bases covered with their drinks option. Most recent visit showcases Franconian lagers, but Belgian, UK craft and others feature. A small back bar with non-beer alternatives is offered.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Shabby chic interior with patio terrace. Reasonably intimate due to small space.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably lively with a nice balance of music and chat. The patio becomes lively on warm summer evenings while the indoors accommodates only a few groups.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, limited board games/reading material.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Decent for the UK, standard for the area.

description: A well executed beer mecca. Small but with a choice that covers several bases well. Decor is shabby chic with some fairy lights, candles etc which are a nicer touch than the stark industrial look of many similar places. Friendly service helps too, and a new look patio helps give it an almost continental feel. (Added 2022)

name: Bridge Tavern
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: A sign on the door says Private members club, but here you have a pub, and as long as you ask nicely you will probably be allowed entry. Stained glass, horse racing memorabilia on the walls, and the typical pub offerings, dartboard, sport on tv, live gigs, altogether a community based venue which compensates for the lack of good drinks offerings, albeit they may have 1 or 2 cask options. (Added 2020)

name: The Corn Dolly
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Superior range of well kept cask ales from regional breweries, two new keg options from Vocation, 3 box ciders and some unfortunately disappointing lager options with a stock back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Backstreet boozer set alone on a corner by a slope, but easy to reach from either train station. A whitewashed house with signage on both sides and a beer garden (more of a yard) to the rear. Inside, a one room setup with pool and TV to the back and lounge to the front. Simply furnished with communal upholstered seats and individual circular tables. Black beams, pump clip decoration and Bradford City FC memorabilia. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Can be quiet in summer months inside but for most of the year the interior is lively in the evening, a classic example of a social, not food-focused pub.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pool table, jukebox, outdoor seating, summer bbqs, snacks + tapas, occasional events.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for the beers and cider on offer.

description: Friendly lived-in, and endearingly knackered old boozer with black beams, Bradford City memorabilia and pump clip decorations. Several real ales kept immaculately and reasonable prices. Pool table, a growing outdoor area. Well reputed. Unlikely to be everyone's idea of a good time but a great example of a northern boozer that's kept its charm,  coziness and overall social format while staying attached and relevant feeling. (Added 2020)

name: The Fox
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Micropub with small beer garden to the rear, the bar area is a solid wood fit which along with the beer ephemera and flags on the ceiling gives the place a little bit of a hybrid feel between a classic micropub, with its recovered furniture, and a Belgian brown café. Overall it's a good look and has a bit of a distinctive character. Beers are carefully curated with a balance between cask, keg + bottle offerings along with a few ciders. For the size of the place it's a reasonable selection. Before Brexit + Covid they used to boast 64 different bottles behind the bar, lots from Belgium. That is reduced but it's still pretty good. With quiz nights, open mic, board games and books, this is a place to hang loose, and has its own community of people. Terrific atmosphere at times both at warmer and colder times of year. A real classic of its genre. (Added 2020)

name: Ye Olde Watling
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: Attractive olde London town pub with literary and architectural connections, but most importantly still retains some character with exposed beams and a nice intimate feel. While there are concessions here and there along with Nicholson's usual drab chain signage, some aspect of it retains its genius loci. The drinks options are reasonably good and for London standards food doesn't cost a bomb. Busy in the cobbled yard directly after work on weekdays giving it a sense of atmosphere and significance. (Added 2019)

name: The Pride of Spitalfields London
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Tiny carpeted pub with piano, cosy niches and unspoilt, without becoming a parody of a London pub either. This shows in the clientele and hint of authenticity about it which stands out from the more touristy venues. (Added 2020)

name: The Harp, Covent Garden
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
description: It has taken several visits to get our head around the charm of The Harp, a small two floor pub focused on drinks and largely standing or on raised seating downstairs. However, slowly we begin to understand the appeal. The lampshades, the excellent beer, perhaps even the celeb spotting and history plays a part. (Added 2018)

name: Duke Of Wellington Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A surprise to find a country pub still focused on drinks and socialising for locals above Sunday dinners for middle class out of towners. Leather upholstered bench seating, a real fire and homely old-school approach set a traditional scene, while the range of cask ales is good. Well reviewed and seemingly well loved. (Added 2020)

name: Beerwolf Books
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Keg, cask ales and European lagers evenly represented with local cask options of different styles.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Loft in handsome old building. Lots of wood from the floor to the ceiling. Exposed rafters. Red paint. Bookshop also.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Stripped down minimalist ale house ambience but with music and a mixed crowd.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Books, board games, snacks, occasional live events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Standard for the area, reasonable.

description: Beautiful loft pub with exposed rafters and wooden furniture and floors. The red paint and green touches here and there give it a warm feel. Very good range of drinks which shows both a local and international focus. The quirkiness comes in the shape of its bookstore and interesting board games like Carrom tables and so on. A distinctive and enjoyable venue that's a must visit in Falmouth. (Added August 2021)

name: The Chintz
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cocktails, gins with a small range of beer and cider options

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Eclectic, mad, fussy, and of course chintzy. False book cases, ornate frames and furniture. Juliet balcony overlooking a courtyard

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Calm during the day, very buzzing in the evening.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Small plates, board games, piano, live events, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Standard/High for the area.

description: A one-off, The Chintz does what it says and more. Arrive through an archway into a courtyard with mixed outdoor seating, ascend up to The Chintz via a set of corner steps, past some very mossy rocks of a cliff edge. The Chintz is based in the loft. Exposed rafter and an explosion of eclectic decor that is at once fussy, dress and mad. Vintage furniture, false book cases, piano, fish tank, chaise lounge, it's a thing of careful creation. While a cocktail bar churning out competent if unspectacular efforts, you will find a back bar stocked with enough to keep most people happy. At night the place comes alive with an excitable crowd, and you can feel a warm glow from the energy and happiness that is something to be part of. Excellent venue. (Added 2021)

name: The Old Ale House
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Unsure what the options are since Skinners packed up but this has traditionally offered a broad selection of cask ales and typical back bar alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Decorative exterior with Victorian styling and hanging baskets. Corner pub with wedge shape. Attractive dark wood interior with low ceiling. Monkey nuts are free and the shells are freely scattered all over the floor.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The centrepoint of local life, and so a den of hubbub and socialising. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Occasional live music, sport, free nuts

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the town

description: A clear standout in Truro, so much so that it almost dominates the alternatives into feeling mediocre. The social centrepoint of the town and a strong all-rounder, a pub with lots of areas where people with different tastes can congregate. Quirky touches from its brewery owners with a range of their ales and free monkey nuts which are shelled and cast freely around the floor like the good old days. A true boozer that typifies the simple effective appeal of the format. Lively at night with occasional sport and music.

name: Bag Of Nails
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local cask and keg ales with decent Belgian beer bottle selection. Small cider selection. Limited alternatives for non-beer drinkers.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Personalised 1-room boozer with plants, little red niche for record playing and lots of sweary signage with important rules to observe.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Intimate due to the small size, the cats to humans ratio is almost 1:1. Records are played from start to finish without interruption.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Do you like cats? Do you like indie records? That's about it. Oh, there are board games and snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Standard/High for the area.

description: A local institution, this one-room boozer is a left-leaning outpost popular with anyone of an alternative leaning (provided they like cats). Famous for its menagerie of cats (who you may never, ever pick up) long list of exasperated rules on the pillar and all-round ad hoc atmosphere. We really enjoyed it but it is destined to be a love/hate place. (Added 2020)

name: The Orchard Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Rare broad array of cider options along with good quality cask ales. Some whiskies. Limited alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Traditional cider house with chunky rural-feeling furniture, exposed beams, fireplace and piano. Simple bar area decorated with hops. Beer casks at the back of the bar. Genteel.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Simple, almost tunefully joyful in it's unreconstructed simplicity. Calm during the day and social at night.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Board games, piano, live events. Pre-made sandwiches and snacks. Limited outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: Unreconstructed inn with simple seating, vague nautical themes in the décor (it is close to Bristol Marina) and a good range of cider and beers. Highly thought of for good reason. It is a shining example of the enduring virtues of a genteel traditional boozer. (Added 2020)

name: King William Ale House
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Sam Smiths range of drinks, so a fully stock bar. The handpulled bitter was unavailable when we visited but the pumps are in evidence.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A low slung entrance leads into the gloom where you will find a magnificent fitted bar with niches opposite for small groups to socialise. There's a pool table in a side room and the rear of the pub expands into a carpeted lounge area with a fireplace.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Magnificent gloom and brooding quality downstairs.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited food and snacks, outdoor patio seating, real fire, pool table

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area. No longer the value option it used to be.

description: WARNING: Sam Smiths Pub. Now that the warning is over, we must say that this is a wonderful historic boozer. The King William Ale House and The Famous Royal Navy Volunteer Public House on King Street were originally a row of three houses dating to around 1670, these are now two public houses side by side with gabled fronts to the road. While these pubs are always love/hate, for now we can recommend due to the unique evocative atmosphere in the central bar, the sweep of dusky calm that has settled on the place. A wonderful place to have a quiet drink in the half-light or a catch up with a close friend. (Added 2020)

name: The Holy Tavern
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: St Peter's brewery beers and ciders on cask. 
Style/Décor: A 1990s recreation of a Georgian style tavern, simple furnishings with wooden settles, partitions, lamplight and the occasional oddity. Small without a clear focal point.
Atmosphere/Character: No music so there is calm during the day and social conversation during the evening.
Amenities/Events: Food, lunch deals, limited other amenities. 
Value For Money: Reasonable for the area.
description: While the appearance may give off a 1700s Georgian coffee house look, this is a wholly sentimental recreation carried out in the 1990s for St Peter's brewery, for whom this served as its London base until 2021.With its narrow entrance, niches and partitions, it has been carefully curated. Without any music there is just natural ambience either through calm or social conversation. The range of drinks is very decent and opening hours have improved to include Saturdays.

name: The Troubadour
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Wines with a compact range of beers.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Bodega style venue with exposed beams, old music instruments and simple wooden seating. Sometimes candlelit.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Buzzing and hyper-social with many budding musicians using it as a rallying point.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Renowned for its live music performances 

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Expensive even for the area

description: Enter through a carved back door which gives a hint of the trinkets and strangeness inside. From its former use as a coffee house, it has long been a bohemian meeting place for budding musicians, with a long and perhaps unnecessarily amplified list of famous visitors. No cask beers, the place offers a range of wines and limited keg offerings. Relatively expensive but well worth it to be camped among the candle light, dusty beams and old musical instruments strewn across the wall, and the excitable crowd appear to agree. (Added 2020)

name: The Salisbury
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited choice of ales with several keg options and a couple of cask.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A music theme with memorabilia and nik naks strewn about a traditional Edwardian tavern with side rooms and niches, with a long bar by the entrance.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Lively with a cast of die-hard music junkies as regulars. Similar to The Duck & Drake, Leeds

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cooked food, live events and music performances, jukebox, outdoor seating, books and board games.

Value For Money: Standard for the area of the city.
description: A music-focused pub slanted towards Rock, but not really a metal or punk place as such. Instead you'll find a pleasingly unpretentious cosy tavern that allows the original features and the current purpose to shine without detracting from either. Plenty of amenities and events keep the punters interested, while they aim to cover most bases with the drink selection. A good all-rounder and decent choice. Also very near Oxford Road train station in the event of needing to kill some time or max out your afternoon or evening. (Added 2021)

name: The Fighting Cock
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Corner neighbourhood alehouse in unsalubrious surroundings (well it is Bradford) with rotating range of ales on cask and some European beers available. Live music, events, outdoor seating available. A calm refuge indoors on quiet afternoons, this spartan stripped back venue can get going later on. Expect a male-dominated environment that's not necessarily everyone's idea of a fun time. But that's how it goes, we don't all like the same things. A strong example of what it is. No-nonsense boozer that nevertheless has time to curate a good range of drinks and a decent authentic environment. (Added 2020)

name: The Ship & Mitre
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A broad range of beers from local cask, keg & European bottles. Decent gin selection and straightforward back bar with the normal options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cabin-like ale house with wooden struts and fittings, bench seating and some rickety furniture. Retro beer signage.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Calm in the afternoons, buzzy in the evenings. Dominated by conversation rather than music, natural ambience.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Bottleshop, snacks, limited outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area

description: Essential venue for beer lovers visiting Liverpool, you'll find an unpretentious alehouse with a slightly timeless genteel quality, well stocked with cask, keg and bottled beers from home and abroad. Key to visiting is the natural ambience of conversation and the excellent design of the venue that draws people towards communal space well. (Added 2021)

name: Botanical Garden
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited selection of bottles and cans, broad rather than deep selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Ruin bar aesthetic with hidey holes, industrial chic, grafitii, ramshackle, but still a bit corporate

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Weather-dependent outdoor venue, buzzy in summer

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Street food kitchen, outdoor space, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A decent alternative outdoor hangout spot for youngsters in the summer where you can feel sufficiently far away from the rest of the city centre action that you could squint and be in one of Budapest's ruin bars. In the ex-industrial Baltic Triangle this is a solid all-round choice with outdoor seating and streetfood kitchen, a genuinely relaxing vibe, albeit one with a limited drinks selection. (Added 2021)

name: Peter Kavanagh's
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited range of cask and keg covering some old fashioned names but also some contemporary ones. Nothing to get craft beer fans excited though.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Wonderful on CAMRA's inventory of interiors with two snug rooms aside a bar, with a lounge and mezzanine opposite. A true neighbourhood pub classic stuffed with things to look at, antiques and nik naks.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fantastic, both from the excitement of newcomers and the community vibe from the regulars. A home from home.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Occasional live music and community events, snacks, limited outdoor space.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A wonderful pub that takes already special raw materials and a dying breed of pub then elevates it to a new level. The fact the neighbourhood pub is still going and intact with its small snug rooms and layout is impressive enough, but the place is a labour of love and immediately stands out with distinctive personalised decoration and selection of antiques. The corresponding atmosphere that is generated when these combine with happy customers is that spark of genius we are search for. We loved it and you should go. (Added August 2023)

name: Ye Cracke
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Mediocre selection of beers though not entirely hopeless either. Limited back bar. In fairness this is not really what this pub is about.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Distinctive exterior with intact, if worn, retro signage. The interior maintains some special features such as the War Office snug with red leather bench seating and stained glass. Well preserved

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A true neighbourhood pub fuelled by local life and conversation above all else.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, limited food options, occasional events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Decent for the area.

description: A terrific neighbourhood local that has some historic connections, firstly the 'War Office' a terrific snug room that was a debating room during the Boer War, secondly John Lennon's patronage during his younger days. All the same to us, but we loved the War Office especially, which remains intimate and snug while still offering views to the bar and the room behind. The layout is untouched and has a proper sense of homeliness. The local life can tip over into occasional garrulousness but this is a pub with a genuine blend and balance of different people, all the better. We liked it, and will be going straight back at the next opportunity. You should visit. (Added 2021)

name: Beer in Hand
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Several box ciders and keg cider options, along with a full range of tap beer options. Very strong.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Beer mats on the ceiling, blue walls, a narrow entrance leads to a wedge shaped back room with a piano, guitar and angled bar. Some photos from 'the old times'. It's an alehouse with some micropub DIY-style aesthetics, but too big to be called a micropub.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local life and friendly hangout that's a safe haven during the day for a peaceful drink but gets going later on. Limited hours though.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Musical instruments, dresser full of board games. Snacks.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard, perhaps slightly high for the area.

description: A contemporary ale house has to hit hard to impress and this one really does, being easily the best place for independent cider in the city and having a strong range of keg and cask beers too. Along with that there needs to be a community, and that is truly in evidence here with local life and friends gathering here across a range of generations and backgrounds. A slightly more bland appearance becomes more interesting around the bar with beer pump clips stuck to the ceiling, instruments and board games and some personalisation. A strong choice. Check opening hours carefully before visiting. (Added 2020)

name: The Barrels
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Strong range of cask beers from Wye Valley with some guest, and a few local draft ciders too. A perfunctory back bar of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Homely interior with stained glass and bench seats, very much unpretentious, warm and homely.
