Brewpub with the famous Leipziger Gose and range of more traditional German lagers, with some seasonal rotations too.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Train themed in homage to the former station it now resides in. Otherwise a familiar Bierhalle feel with high chairs and tables around the bar area and dining areas outside of that.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A fairly typical airy beer hall with all that that entails.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, outdoor seating, kids play area.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
More expensive for the area.

description: An approachable beer hall situated in a historic building, Leipzig's old station that was still going as a stop even in recent history. The train theme prevails with some impressive bits and pieces and occasionally quirky, though the general format is straightforward and familiar to anyone who has stepped into a German beer hall. The Leipziger Gose, the brewery's other offerings and the dramatic setting  make this stand out more than most, just enough to squeak onto our guide. (added November 2021)

name: Zwille
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
While there are too many similar pale lagers, at least they are all pretty good. Two Czech, two Franconian which could be so, so much worse in a place like this.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The bar's trump card, an immense effort has been made to creating a distinctive style with a sinister, sci-fi fantasy look, albeit brighter than you'd expect from that description. Almost impossible to describe properly, but there is a tree and a snake for starters. Furniture is typical rock pub territory. Frontage is graffiti inspired and striking, immediately drawing your attention.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Typical rockpub hangout but with a left-wing leaning (as will be confirmed by the wall of stickers in the toilets)

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Smoking allowed, limited other amenities.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for the city.

description: Down in Connewitz seems to be where the action happens in Leipzig. Zwille is the main rock pub which excels in its sci-fi/fantasy decor and decent beer options. Furniture is standard, perhaps even quite comfy given what rock pubs are usually like, and a left leaning crowd keep it feeling fairly friendly without the antagonism some bars of this nature bring. All the same, with smoking allowed this is most definitely not an all rounder, but a love it/hate it place. Whichever side you fall on, it is a great example of its kind. (November 2021)

name: Frau Krause
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
A simple range of beers none of which set the world alight but do the job. Limited selection of spirits.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A corner Gaststatte that has the appearance of once being genteel, homely and upstanding, definitely no more. Time has aged the place, not such much like a fine wine but a craggy rock. Characterful. Dark wood panels, chunky furniture, net curtains. You'll find a backroom which is almost undetectable unless you head to the toilets (which are, by the way, absolutely battered)

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Clearly a local institution in this alternative district, full of locals hanging out and socialising. Smokey and raw, but not unfriendly, in fact the double team behind the bar will make you feel at home. Candles are even lit later at night.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited food offerings, smoking allowed.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: Fantastic frozen in time Gaststatte which has become a bohemian hangout spot, still serving no-nonsense pub grub but plenty of space for drinking. Old wood, net curtains. Looks brilliant. (Added November 2021)

name: Könich Heinz
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Extensive range of pale lagers, peculiarly all of the same standard and background, but a couple of standouts. Extensive back bar with other options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Retro-signage galore, crimson paint and a long double-sided back which leads off to side-rooms in both directions.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fantastic, an immediate sense of being in 'the place to be', at least as far as the alternative scene goes. Totally unpretentious raw and fun pub going that will take you back decades if you're British. No tacky rubbish like games machines, no betting channels on the TV and no right wing views,, this place has kept all the best bits of how it used to be in the early 00s in Britain and ditched the rest.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Table football, pool, limited outdoor 'space', smoking allowed.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area

description: It's great visiting a pub that immediately feels like you've stumbled on the place to be. Hugely popular and for good reason, as this bar provides a good deal of space for the largely younger crowd to socialise. Connewitz's scene leans strongly left-wing, though this one feels one of the more liberal and welcoming with it. Crimson paint, retro signage and a double sided bar completes what is a terrific must-visit venue in Leipzig. Smoking allowed, and as an alternative venue this is clearly love-it or hate-it. Choose wisely according to your own needs. (added November 2021)

name: BillHart
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A reasonably decent range of drinks though nothing to set the world alight.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Multi-roomed pub with pool room at the front and series of niches in a bunker-like low-ceilinged venue.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A younger crowd and informal hangout that gets busy and lively. Friendly and welcoming enough, it is on the tour of venues in this area.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pool table, table football, smoking allowed, limited snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the district

description: A local crowd of youngsters and an informal social atmosphere in this multi-room bar. It feels somewhat like the overflow car park for Konich Heinz but that would be unfair overall, indeed it would be worthy of note anywhere you plonked it in the city of Leipzig. In Connewitz it is simply yet another high quality option. (added November 2021)

name: Mahr's Bräu
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Top quality Franconian lagers from the wooden barrel, with everything else barring the schnapps a perfunctory afterthought.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A peculiarly unprepossessing entrance with wooden door leads to a conservatory type area which then leads into the pub itself. You'll find the taproom easily the most atmospheric with wooden barrels niches and dark wooden, hugely atmospheric. The side rooms are typical and fairly by-the-numbers German beer hall in appears, although at least intimate in size.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Head to the taproom for the core atmosphere of the place where the history and ageing of the wood, murmur of conversation and back and forth of staff make it feel like the place to be, hunkered down protected by the layers of pub around you.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Quasi-outdoor space, food.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
OK for the area.

description: While the venue undoubtedly has mixed reviews, our site focuses squarely on whether the bar has good beer, good decor, good atmosphere, fair value and any additional amenities. This really does, but be sure to grab a seat in the core of the pub to get the most out of it. The beer is magnificent and sitting back to recall the experience rouses a wistful longing to return. (added November 2021)

name: Schanzenbräu Schankwirtschaft
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beautiful beers from the brewery, true Franconian style with the Nurnburg rot bier (red lager) from the wooden barrel.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fantastic interior with historic looking bar area, a long but intimate room which has kept a patina of history and character. Surprisingly small, in fact.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The intimate space and ageing decor inevitably helps elevate the atmosphere which is typical of a German Gaststatte, blurring the lines between eating and socialising, but there are plenty here just having a beer for that not to be a problem.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area, perhaps a little higher than average.

description: A long-time recommendation, we finally made it here and true enough, you'll find a lovely pub. A one-room affair with a biergarten, the pleasure just keeps on coming. Superb beers including some from the wooden barrel, honest fresh pub grub for decent prices and space to socialise that feels suitably homely and aged. A must-visit in Nuremburg. (added November 2021)

name: Balalaika
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Basic lager options but decent back bar selection of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brooding low key and compact one room candlelit bar. Verging on antiquey.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Intimate, almost romantic venue with candles and piano. Low-lit and social.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Live music, limited else.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Typical for the area.

description: Terrific in-the-know bar. Brooding darkness and candlelight, piano,, occasional live music, drinking and socialising focused. Can sometimes open late in the evening. (added November 2021)

name: Rote Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good quality cocktails and extensively stocked back bar with rum and whiskies. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Red, of course! Knock on the bell outside to be greeting by a smartly dressed front of house. The bar is small and gaining access required some luck, or at least willingness to start earlier.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Compact and intimate but with a buzz and pace too. A busy bar and sugar drinks makes for a chatty crowd.

Amenities/Events: n/a
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Expensive, it's a cocktail bar after all!

description: Bell for entry and a rather formal front of house kicks things off in an atmosphere of faux-exclusivity which almost evaporates on entry once you see the rest of the crowd dressed casually. Don't worry about a black tie, basically! Still, this is a relatively high end cocktial bar but on the fun side. Red punchy decor, busy coming and goings and an intimate space give this place a pace and justify a recommendation for any cocktail drinkers out there looking for a quirky spot. (added November 2021)

name: The Wolf
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Craft beers with a mixture of cask and keg available, decent bottle selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Wooden in a craft-alehouse chic look, but well designed and homely enough in the evenings.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Warm and welcoming in the evenings, with a more sedate café bar type atmosphere earlier on.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food available, board games, books, events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area, pricey but in accordance with the quality of produce

description: A good quality craft-beer alehouse is worth having up your sleeve in any city, and this ticks the right boxes, not being too stark or angular or generic in design, therefore having just enough character to be homely and have identity. Nothing drastic but reasonably effective. Along with the multi-tap beer offerings there are board games and bites, an effective combo. (Added November 2021)

name: The Anchor Digbeth
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A decent range of cask and keg beers with standard back-bar offerings.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Victorian/Edwardian layout with a main bar area and smaller side rooms enveloping the bar. Old fashioned and unspoilt, but not a museum. Lived-in appearance. Effective.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A classic corner boozer with a social, relevant feel.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pool table, dartboard, boardgames, community events, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: It took a couple of tries to be won over by this pub. The exterior and shell is a typical Victorian corner boozer with some fabulous ornate inset windows and small-room layout enveloping a central bar. The place is very sociable with a pool table, and hosting community events. To top it off, a range of well-kept ales keeps its reputation high amount beer nerds. A very good neighbourhood pub. (Added November 2021)

name: Three Pigeons Ale House
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: One of the oldest, best preserved and rare exhibits of Art Deco in a Northern pub, Three Pigeons combines the angularity of the style with more familiar cosy pub aesthetics very well. A well restored multi-roomed pub which offers a community feel despite the proximity to the centre and train station. On entry you will find an unusual octagonal hallway which leads off in 4 directions - check the pigeon mural on the ceiling as well. The bar room is perhaps the most basic and traditional, but the lounge with its fireplace and striking artwork is impressive too. The backrooms with games and more intimate space come alive at busier times and shouldn't be missed. Ossett Brewery owns the place and most of the beer offerings stem from them, all of which are excellently well kept. A great selection of pub snacks - pies, pasties, rolls, scotch eggs from local suppliers, all at fair prices. On matchdays there is a friendly swell of supporters and a rhythm to the pre-post match atmosphere that enhances its social value. A clear gem. (Added December 2021)

name: The Cross Keys
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: A country pub with an alehouse feel, the multiple options stand out for a rural pub and provide a wide high quality choice. The pub itself is unspoilt with a small bar area to the left and locals seating area, with a more open plan area to the right. A separated backroom could potentially be isolated but looks fairly cosy itself. The stone inn by the roadside is a classic Yorkshire look. Known for live music as well, this is a pub with more than one feather to its bow, and while we can't quite understand the effusiveness in the incredibly high reviews, it certainly deserves a place on our guide and one we will return to (Added December 2021)

name: Victorian Craft Beer Cafe
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A must visit place for any beer drinker in Halifax, combining a contemporary ale house concept with a uniquely sprawling concept. A café style bar room gives way to a warren of niches, off-centre shelving , angular nooks each stuffed with books, antiques and memorabilia. In the evening especially this creates a warm, brooding atmosphere. The start of the show is the beer selection with an impressive cask and keg offering covering traditional to modern, domestic to international. Here is proof that if you are prepared to go the extra mile in your concept it can make all the difference, we don't just want to sip beer in a plain sterile room. (Added December 2021)

name: Big 6 Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: An absolutely fantastic neighbourhood pub matching any comparable traditional pub in England. On a row of terraces this stone pub is accessible from both sides, including, oddly, a walk through what appears to be someone's back yard. Inside a multi-roomed pub has preserved its layout and tastefully retained a traditional, cosy social space that feels warm and welcoming. This is supplemented by a cross section of local support of different ages and interests. Regional ales both traditional and modern, a games room at the back and two fires complete what is a frankly outstanding set. Oh, if you like dogs, you'll find plenty at the bar. If you are anywhere near Halifax and fancy a pint, go here. (added December 2021)

name: Ye Olde Vic
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
High quality regional cask ales with competent back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Homely, small, warm and welcoming traditional pub with quirky clock/stuffed otter decoration by the bar, simple comfortable seating.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Jovial, a throng of people having a great time.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Board games, functions, occasional live music, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very fair for the area.

description: A wonderful pub inside and out, the sort that gives off good vibes even standing outside it. This small pub opens at 5pm and focuses on drinking and socialising. It isn't a man's drinking den either, the place has an offbeat feel that attracts a range of people, with boardgames and friendly service seeing to that. You'll find an excellent range of ales and walk out wanting to go back as soon as possible. (Added December 2021)

name: Swan With Two Necks
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Robinsons ales including the sought after strong dark ale Old Tom on cask, and rather macro selection of lagers, with a decent tidy selection of whiskies and spirits.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A narrow pub with 3 snug rooms and a little seating area opposite the bar. Traditional with wood panels and carpets.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A bustling market town centre tavern with passing trade, which is offset by the homeliness of the three rooms, which each provide a rabbit hole style bunker of cosiness.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Pies, outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable given the central location.

description: Robinsons have a nasty habit of bleaching out the character of pubs they take over, but it would be difficult to do so here with so many preserved features in good condition. You'll find wood panels, flagstone flooring by the bar and stained glass down the corridor. 3 snug rooms are relatively unaltered and each a den of cosiness. Bustling trade due to the central locations keeps this pub alive and well, as such it has to be recommended. Old Tom on cask is a revelation. (Added December 2021)

name: Queens Head
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Sam Smiths range of beers, spirits, etc.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Traditional and historic English city tavern with preserved features situated beneath a Victorian railway bridge.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Were it not for Sam Smiths it would probably be the best place in town for atmosphere, as it is, it depends who is in the building. Certainly very characterful.

Amenities/Events: ❤️
Snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Good for the area.

description: AKA Turner Wine Vaults, An unaltered city institution by a large Victorian bridge, you'll find a dark wood panelled bar area and bar still with original taps fitted. Tiling in the backroom and lanterns up the stairs are worth looking out for, as is an old fashioned partioned area to the left of the bar. As usual, Sam Smiths b.s runs the place down, but this is one venue it really can't fully spoil. (Added December 2021)

name: The Lamb
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Young's beers on cask and keg, small back bar

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Victorian/Edwardian splendour with triple sided ornate bar with 'snob screens' from the era and wood abounding. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A great autumn and winter pub, warming and cosy, golden glow from the lamplights, hubbub of conversation.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, fires, snacks available, occasional social meet ups.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Standard for London

description: An impressive historic ensemble with preserved Grade II listed features that take the part of an integrated vibrant pub rather than simply a curio or museum piece. The bar dominates the pub with narrow seating areas either side, and an extended back. Young's beers are available on cask and keg, and the atmosphere is at its best in the winter months, warm and cosy inside with a golden glow from the lamp lights. (added December 2021)

name: Konvikt bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A long standing old town classic, a late night Pivnice in traditional Czech style but aiming at a younger crowd. Typical yellow paint, chunky furniture and arched walls with Pilsner Urquell on tap. For a late night the atmosphere is buzzing and convivial. (added January 2022)

name: Hostinec Drinopol
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: An ur-typical traditional corner Czech hospoda with brown wood strip walls, but this place has been personalised and decorated more than some, with football trophies, historical photographs and ancient beer bottles. Cast of crusty regulars and a cheap food menu. It comes highly recommended as a way to sample real Czech living. (added January 2022)

name: Klub Knoflík
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: Cult late night venue with table football and darts. A simple format in the basement with cosy communal surroundings and occasional smokey environment, the place has been around a few years and has that confidence and poise you'd expect. Based in Andel, the beer options naturally centre around the local Staropramen brewery. (added January 2022)

name: The Exchange Craft Beer House
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A balanced range of cask and keg ales to suit most tastes, slightly let down by their lager options. Good bottle and can options. Expect curation rather than exhaustive directories.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Modern frontage by a bus stop leads down into a vaulted, bunker like room with pillars, decorated with breweriana and fairylights. A bank of booth seats opposite the bar, more loungey at the front.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pleasant hideyhole.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Books, board games, pies, snacks, occasional events.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard city centre prices for a modern bar, though some cask ales are slightly more reasonable.

description: From the outside you may expect a reasonably clean, modern but generic craft beer taproom. Inside a little more character awaits. Vaulted brick ceiling, breweriana on the walls and local football signage adds a personal character. The furniture is also wooden and comfortable rather than anything arch. Sometimes has an odd, unpleasant smell lingering around the entrance. A balance range of cask and keg ales to suit most tastes, slightly let down by their lager options. Interesting pies available. Board games, social events. A good all-rounder. (added January 2022)

name: The Royal
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
4 cask ales, standard lagers, small bottle selection and standard back bar options

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Multiroomed pub with high ceilings in old hotel. Cosier than that would suggest with CAMRA heritage bar and several cosy siderooms, particularly the red room. Candlelit in evenings.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Bustling and democratic attracting a cross-section of society. Busy at the bar and intimate in some of the side spaces.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, occasional live music and events, snacks, outdoor seating, Jukebox, TV, games

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area

description: On CAMRA's national inventory of interiors, this has been reasonably well preserved with an attractive bar area. Live music events, ales and cosy seating across a series of rooms. Bustling and at the heart of the community which is all you wish to see in such a place. The different spaces allow for a range of people to congregate, there is something for most people here. (added February 2022)

name: Dave's Pies & Ale
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
3 cask pumps of real ale, Guinness and local lager, fridge of craft beer. Small back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Dark green paint, breweriana and some art nouveau mirrors, a tiny corner bar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Intimate and local.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Pies and snacks!

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable

description: A tiny micro pub/bar, one room, green painted with a compact but decent range of ales and independent produced pies. Local and social with only 6 tables and 4 bar stools. It takes a few visits to get used to and still has a bit of a shop front/takeaway feel despite best efforts. Nevertheless, it squeaks onto our guide for novelty factor, local life and care taken with the decor. (added January 2022)

name: Bosorka klub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A reasonable range of lagers considering the down n dirty nature of the venue, likewise competent back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Witch themed, balanced relatively well with a punk aesthetic.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A true backstreet down and dirty dive bar, smokey, raw and authentic. Friendly too, with an explicit anti-fascist leaning.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Table football, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Decent, nothing too out of the ordinary.

description: One for fans of rock pubs, punk pubs, cult venues and very late night socialising. Come here to let your hair down and more besides. Authentic and raw, but with a social and friendly side accompanying the occasional wild drunkenness. Managed by a couple of rock chicks who seem to keep things under control. (added February 2022)

name: Steinplatz kaviareň a bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Multitap offerings from Slovak brewers, far better than most with good range of alternatives too.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Modestly sized basement with exposed brickwork and red seating. Musical nik naks strewn around.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A little bit smokey and clandestine despite the almost brutally exposed position of the bar on the square. Social but not anarchic.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Occasional live music. Snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Fair considering the location, but 0.4l pours 

description: A staple venue on the old town route, this is a converted space, now a basement pub with exposed brickwork and hideyholes, that feels clandestine despite acres of space outside on the square uncovered. A fair range of drinks including multitap Slovak craft options, and that smokey vibe keep it feeling easily interesting enough to return to over and over again.  (added February 2022)

name: Hostinec U deda
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Pilsner Urquell and other brands from that brewery. Czech backbar classics as alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A large venue in a park and clearing surrounded by tower blocks. Despite the concrete surroundings this place is an homage to all things rustic and wooden, with niknaks, artwork, photographs abounding, and the place is big enough it will take several visits to absorb.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Superb atmosphere in the interior - particularly the backroom - on evenings. All local, far from the tourist crowd.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food available, outdoor seating, TV, Snacks.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard.

description: A diamond in the rough, well and truly sticking out among the tower blocks of Ruzinov, one of Bratislava's outlying districts. A neighbourhood and a cult classic offering traditional dishes and on point Czech lagers. Highly personalised with distinctive rustic decor, chunky wood and nik naks everywhere. Enough of an all-rounder to also have sport on TV without that killing the mood. An essential stop off to or from the airport (added February 2022)

name: Stary Port Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Typical Polish range with 1 or 2 additions to spice things up. Large range of cocktails and mixers and decent back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Nautical theme, almost like being in the storage of a tall ship, or a brig somewhere. All quite brown and aged which helps make it not come across too tacky.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Social and medium-paced but enough room to brood. Local life due to the venue being a little enough outside the old town. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food - toasties seemingly. Board games, occasional events.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A stalwart Kraków venue, this place has been around a while and is known about by denizens of the city. Popular with people from nearby offices and government buildings, with tour guides meeting up here for a drink after their shifts. While that almost seems dull, this is a real refuge, characterful and distinctive with an easy self-assurance. You should give it a try, though it won't be to everyone's tastes. (added February 2022)

name: Puzzle Hall Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Many bases of beer, cider and perry covered on cask and keg with UK and European beer representing. Limited back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️~Ad hoc with some bright paint and rickety furniture. Not the most comfortable surroundings in the bar area which is a shame.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Lively, intimate and certainly social when it fills up, this is a true community pub with a loyal fanbase.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live music, community events, snacks, outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very reasonable overall.

description: A backstreet pub with a cult fanbase and community following. Large covered outdoor seating in summer, music and community events in the compact and intimate interior, Great selection of ales and some real ciders and perry too. A labour of love for the owner clearly. A standout. (added February 2022)

name: White Horse Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Sam Smiths range of drinks.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Superb eye-catching rustic market town tavern with preserved stoves and cupboards, tiled floors and maze of side rooms. Bar area lit with a fireplace and leather seating. A true throwback.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A truly special atmosphere in all rooms except perhaps for the more familiar barn-style conversion/extension at the back. The bar area has a cast of locals and roaring fire, the side rooms are dimly lit and clandestine, perfect for winter visits especially.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, outdoor seating. No phones/ no swearing etc allowed 

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Decent for the area but not the bargain value they used to offer.

description: Bittersweet that this pub is owned by Sam Smiths, although the benefit is the pub remains in superb preserved condition, worn and characterful, museum-like but still relevant with the cast of regulars in the main room. and warren of rustic side-rooms that will transport you to centuries past.

Known as ‘Nellies’ locally after the landlord that used to run the place up until the mid-1970s. The building itself, a former coaching inn dates back to the mid 1600s.

Don’t miss the candelit quiz nights.

A true gem worth seeking out even from far away. (added February 2022)

name: Black Swan
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
5 cask ales and a fairly mediocre macro keg selection. Standard back bar options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
The reason to visit. Low blackened beams, leaded hatched windows, off-centre and gloomy, candles and lamps.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Oozing plenty of character through the historic building, the atmosphere is slightly dampened by the crap selection of pop music on the radio, but improves during folk club performances and when it gets busier.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Folk performances, meals, hotel, outdoor seating. Pub cat, fireplace

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: Enough outside the city centre to be clear of the tourist crowds, this place strikes a nice balance between locals and visitors. A historic centuries old building with low beams and an atmospheric entranceway, also acting as a hotel and luncheon diner. The bar area is where to be, with an intact and suitably medieval feel. Some bits and pieces, such as the radio selection slightly drag it down, but overall it is well worth a look. (added March 2022)

name: The Rook & Gaskill
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer focused with a good spread of cask and keg beers but also wide selection of gins.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Modernised interior with some sympathetic wood and dark features, overall not too arch craft beer borr, nor uncomfortable. More of an ale house pitched at a younger audience. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A social space with a community feel, though a little spartan when it's quiet. Clearly local rather than tourist driven

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, fireplaces, limited outdoor seating, snacks. Board games.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable for the selection.

description: In amongst the various historic taverns York does also need some point of difference. This ale house provides a relevant but still familiar feel with its treated wood and black fittings. Visit to find a large selection of cask and keg ales at reasonable prices for an independent free house. Food nights, outdoor seating, a fireplace and board games prop up what can be a little bit spartan at quieter times, but the quality is clearly there. (added March 2022)

name: Geea Caffe
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Although draft beer options are poor, there is a decent selection of bottles. The majority of the drinks are not beer based and you will find a well stocked back bar and cocktail menu.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Macabre paintings with vintage furniture. All quite showy, a touch gothic too. The upstairs location provides a certain boudoir quality.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A central institution with all that entails. Very popular and can be difficult to find a table with limited space. Once in, however, you're in for a fun evening in what really is Sibiu's premiere hangout spot. Though open during the day, the atmosphere is too sedate to really compare.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited snacks, piano, books.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very good value for money considering this is the central cog in Sibiu's nightlife, especially for cocktails.

description: Upstairs in a side-alley building not far from Sibiu's main square is the centrepiece of its nightlife, standing head and shoulders above the rest, not only due to the 1st floor location. A macabre boudoir with paintings ranging from classic, to grotesque to downright tasteless, and a core audience that know this is by far the best place to be. Limited draft drinks are compensation for by the bottle range and very good value cocktails, which while not exquisitely prepared, are at least functional and light on the wallet. Great fun at night, going on until the early hours, you simply can't look past this place while in town. (added March 2022)

name: Voynich Cafe & Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited beer selection but a healthy enough back bar with alternatives. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Voynich manuscript themed, walls full of scrawl, even taken over with locals comments in places, greenery, wood panelled walls and some lamp-light.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
This one room café bar has a friendly, green feel with a personalised, lived-in and unpretentious atmosphere. At times the rock soundtrack feels out of kilter, at others, it fits in just fine.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Dart board, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very good.

description: With an arguably unique concept, the Voynich manuscript theme is played out on the walls of this one room café bar. With other elements like plants, wood panelled ceiling and parts where locals have made their own comments, it feels unpretentious, lived in and loved, not trying to be the height of fashion while generally managing a certain bohemian charm nonetheless. Drinks are simple and straightforward in the main, with a few unusual options sprinkled in. Prices are very competitive given this is nearly the only genuine pub in Sighisoara. (Added March 2022)

name: St. Andrew's Scottish Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A relatively big selection of beers in the fridge by Sibiu standards, limited tap options and a fairly stock Eastern European back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
As awful as a Romanian Scottish themed pub sounds - and it does sound pretty awful - we were pleasantly surprised by the place. The Scottish theme is relatively understated (although some of the tartan could still go without losing anything in the process), and the pub makes good use of its natural assets, with a beautiful ceiling and stone carvings, and a nice bar area too. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Busy and popular with a young crowd, most people are sat chatting, and the social atmosphere is generally good, with some communal-sized tables leading to cross-chat and mixing.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited outdoor seating in summer, board games and books. Snacks.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Normal for the city centre.

description: As awful as a Romanian Scottish themed pub sounds - and it does sound pretty awful - we were pleasantly surprised by the place. The Scottish theme is relatively understated (although some of the tartan could still go without losing anything in the process), and the pub makes good use of its natural assets, with a beautiful ceiling and stone carvings, and a nice bar area too. The pub also offers a good range of bottles by comparison with pretty much every other pub in Sibiu. Service can be slow in the off season due to trying to rely on too few staff. The underlying raw materials of the place are good however. If we could persuade them to ditch the Scottish concept, widen the draft beer offerings, hire some staff and focus on the history of the building instead, there would be a strong contender. As it is, it is a really good pub for Sibiu.

name: Music Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably extensive back bar, with a typically limited selection of draft beers, albeit with Pilsner Urquell (a not very well kept version at that)

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
The music theme is about as generic as you can get, so thankfully the raw materials are more interesting. Set in a basement leading out to a terraced area, you descend two storeys until reaching a basement pub. When inside, the decoration is a little bland but relatively tasteful. An all-rounder.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of those places that's an effective all-rounder, meaning there will likely be an occasion meriting a visit even if there is no one thing drawing you there. Some intimate spaces, some more communal and a slightly clandestine atmosphere due to the basement location.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Limited outdoor space, live music performances, events, food + snacks.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: Ahh, the all-rounder. The music theme is about as generic as you can get, so thankfully the raw materials are more interesting. Set in a basement leading out to a terraced area, you descend two storeys until reaching a basement pub. When inside, the decoration is a little bland but relatively tasteful. There will likely be an occasion meriting a visit even if there is no one thing drawing you there. Such places deserve a note even if they stick to doing several things well rather than one or two things brilliantly, particularly in Sibiu where even doing 1 thing well is somewhat of an immediate draw (added March 2022)

name: Drayman's Son
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local ales straight from cask poured from a back kitchen, large cider and perry selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️
Simple alehouse/bar-cum-café setting with white walls, train station ephemera and fairy lights as decoration. A step up to the bar area.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Communal, local and chatty with drinks brought to your table.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Board games, community meet ups, light cold food and snacks.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A market town alehouse from the 00s new wave of micropubs. Stylish green sign with retro stylings matched by recovered signage inside connected with the local train service. Fairylights and antique furniture in a small room with raised area at the bar. There are no pumps at the bar area itself, while pouring goes on in the backroom, with drinks brought to your table. Board games, community events and general hubbub of friendly activity round off what is quite rightly a very popular highly rated venue. (added March 2022)

name: The Brewery Tap
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cask ales from the Fat Cat brewery plus a wide range of alternatives both traditional and modern. Ciders and perries with a decently stocked back bar. You should have no trouble finding a drink you like.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A building which was clearly formerly a post war pub akin to a working men's club or community centre, this modernist building turns barn/warehouse-like inside though, decorated with hops, red and green walls and some retro signage, all sympathetic and effective.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A bustling district hub for community activity and local life. Welcoming and with plenty of space for different people.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, cooked food, big screen, snacks, community events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A community asset, this large venue is a brewery tap but also base for community events, with a big screen and a large garden widening its base and reach further. The decor does well with the barnlike interior, with hops and retro signage adding a timeless feel to what is really a modernist building. (added March 2022)

name: The Malt and Mardle
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Compact but high quality range of ales and ciders with gin selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Tiny micro pub, rich blue paint with fairy lights and brown wood, with casks displayed and poured from a cabinet. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Cosy and friendly with a typical drop-in alehouse feel. A smidge over-styled but still fairly low-key and relaxed.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Board games, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: Another superior micropub that reboots the alehouse dynamic. This one room pub on the corner offers compact but high quality choices of cask, keg and ciders with a time-honoured format of simple seating for friends and perhaps new acquaintances. Dog friendly. (added March 2022)

name: The White Lion
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A superior range of cask ales with a less impressive but solid enough selection of keg, bottles and back bar choices. Some European beers on show.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Old fashioned with red paint and blackened beams, multi-roomed with a low ceiling. Wooden furniture and a bar billiards table. Fishtank between the bar and lounge.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local and all the better for it. A cosy and atmospheric social meeting space.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Bar billiards, board games and cards, books, snacks and fishtank.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Slightly more expensive for the area.

description: An excellent pub which combines a number of key ingredients well. The raw materials are good for a start - low ceilings with exposed beams, a multiroom setup with a hatch for serving. These are retained, decorated with red walls and blackened beams, fitted with traditional wooden furniture and a bar billiards table. A local feel with community events. Very well reviewed and deservedly so. (added March 2022)

name: The Fat Cat
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Large selection of cask ales with limited European beer options and craft keg. Standard back bar alternatives with a good whisky selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A labour of love with a distinctly curated traditional feel. Enter to find a long narrow bar area with niches off it and a backroom. Recovered signage is not randomised but carefully put together to compliment each item and each wall, the effect meets you almost immediately.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Bustling and buzzy, a social nexus with an atmosphere to match. A good range of people present too.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, meals, snacks, quiz, TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area

description: A truly outstanding English pub that aims high and hits the right notes on song. It is near immediately apparent why this pub has won many awards both local and national. Beer options are not the be all and end all, but they are nevertheless excellent with a tied microbrewery and many alternative options from smaller breweries. The place itself is a curated work of art with each room and each corner carefully put together piece by piece. A long narrow bar is a natural congregation area, with pleasant niches around it which generate the hubbub and energy that make the pub really shine. Even TV with sport can't really split opinion as the venue does so well balancing each need. Covered outdoor seating and food help to supply further reasons for coming. Simply put, a classic pub. (added March 2022)

name: Adam and Eve
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A compact but superior and well kept range of ales from around England.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Rustic farmhouse pub with original settles, low-beamed ceiling with creaking doors and off-centre fittings. One small and cosy bar area with two adjoining rooms more for dining, but still fine at certain times for a drink. Both of those rooms are similarly interesting. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A slice of country life in the city, this really does feel like a country pub teleported into near the city centre, just far off the beaten path enough to keep it the way it is. Preserved, authentic and with a certain hush and reverence about it. Social scene feels a little hemmed in by the entrance and dining areas.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, limited outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
A little more expensive for the area.

description: A legendary historic pub of national importance, this converted farmhouse has centuries of recorded use as a pub and preserved features to prove it. A tiny low-ceilinged place with charm, character and a certain special hush about it that creates calm and intimacy. Find one of the off-centre creaky corners to sit - perhaps on one of their original Settles - and recline with a pint and a book. A charming place. (added March 2022)

name: Kings Head
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A superb selection of cask beer and good selection of bottles from Belgium and Germany. Zero keg beers (a personal decision of theirs) and limited back bar. One or two ciders and perries.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A traditional stripped back minimalist rustic ale house with a timeless appearance, red walls, wooden furniture, genteel pastoral decoration that compliments it. Initially comes across as a small pub with an immediate cast of locals to navigate, but check the larger backroom for space.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Immediate impressions may suggest a cliquey locals hangout, however this is soon dispelled by the genteel nature of the place, with natural ambience uninterrupted by music or lairyness. The modus operandi is natural calm and cheerful conversation. Inevitably this attracts an older crowd, however it deserves better.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Bar billiards, books, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A traditional stripped back minimalist rustic ale house with a timeless appearance, red walls, wooden furniture, genteel pastoral decoration that compliments it. Initially comes across as a small pub with an immediate cast of locals to navigate, but check the larger backroom for space. Immediate impressions may suggest a cliquey locals hangout, however this is soon dispelled by the genteel nature of the place, with natural ambience uninterrupted by music or lairyness. The modus operandi is natural calm and cheerful conversation. Inevitably this attracts an older crowd, however it deserves better. Highly recommended. (added March 2022)

name: Boltmakers Arms
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Timothy Taylor's range on cask with mediocre lager and cider offerings.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A very small alehouse dominated by the big fire opposite the small bar. Comfortable upholstered seating and a raised area at the back. That's it!

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local with a throwback feel. Drop in for a pint, inevitably overhear everyone's conversation. It's intimate and probably not to everyone's tastes, but not unfriendly either.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, limited outdoor seating, fireplace

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Expensive for the area.

description: The cosy corners and roaring fire won us over, along with the best Boltmaker we've ever tasted. It should taste good really, operating as almost a de facto Timothy Taylor's brewery tap. This is a small place with a local crowd and intimate atmosphere, but there is welcome to be had in true gruff Yorkshire manner and the reviews aren't far wrong. It sneaks onto our guide. (added March 2022)

name: À la Sarthe
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: Atypical range of farmhouse ales on tap with a standard well-stocked back bar.
Style/Décor: Crumbling townhouse with exposed beams. A two room setup with a small narrow bar, first floor largely stripped bare and inaccessible, with a snug sideroom. Low-lit.
Atmosphere/Character: Low-lit, clandestine but fast-paced late night bar for partying.
Amenities/Events: Functions, limited space outside, snacks.
Value For Money: Standard for the city.
description: When you fancy turning the dial up a notch without going anywhere tacky, this is Lille's best option. Low-lit and clandestine small bar with exposed beams, fairy-lights and a true buzz to the place. Check out some of the oddities like the reinforced glass covering what appears to be a well, the stripped out first floor and the tiny side room. A characterful atmospheric bar but largely for those who want to party on in the late evening. (added March 2022)

name: Beerchope
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: Large bottle selection with a rotating multitap range of local and Belgian ales.
Style/Décor: Narrow and tall two floor setup with a large cabinet displaying beers, tiny bar on a raised area and more informal hangout space upstairs. Small bar furniture for use in this compact space.
Atmosphere/Character: One one of Lille old town's main streets for wining and dining, there is a need filled by this place, which offers a slightly more informal and friendly pace than the stuffy Estaminets. Buzzy with a true Belgian bar type atmosphere.
Amenities/Events: Limited snacks. Little else to report.
Value For Money: Standard for the area. Central so prices fairly high, as to be expected.
description: One one of Lille old town's main streets for wining and dining, there is a need filled by this place, which offers a slightly more informal and friendly pace than the stuffy Estaminets. Buzzy with a true Belgian bar type atmosphere, narrow and tall two storey beer bar with impressive cabinet of beers and fairy lights, more characterful than online images may suggest. (added March 2022)

name: La petite Cantoche
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: Belgian ales on keg, well-stocked back bar for mixers and cocktails
Style/Décor: Funky cartoon-like decor in a part-covered courtyard with a small interior area. Overshadowed by taller buildings, grafitti, street art, etc.
Atmosphere/Character: Pleasant spot for a lazy afternoon in the sun or a buzzy evening in the courtyard.
Amenities/Events: Outdoor seating, meals, snacks
Value For Money: Middling for the central area.
description: Funky, welcoming and accessible, this bar hits enough of the right notes to appeal to a cross section of ages, race and gender, a skill in itself, without being overly bland. The atmospheric courtyard setting helps with an ensemble of tall buildings overshadowing and focusing the sound and events going on below. A good range of Belgian ales on tap, tapas emerging from the kitchen and a venue that works whether it's a quiet day in the sun or a buzzy evening out. (added March 2022)

name: La Biche & Le Renard
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: A combination of local French tapped and bottled beer along with a compact but reasonably broad back bar.
Style/Décor: Hipstery with a shop element, colourful furniture and eclectic bric-a-brac.
Atmosphere/Character: One of those bars that works day or night, with a stripped back informal feel.
Amenities/Events: Limited outdoor seating, meals, shop.
Value For Money: Slightly above average for central Lille.
description: Funky, hipster and bohemian, but far too informal and low-budget to be overly pretentious with it, which is a relief. Quality drinks and the reasonably quirky setup provide standout features along with some pleasing decor and furniture choices, Prime location too, overlooking the square. (added March 2022)

name: La Ressourcerie - Cantine & Bistrot
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: Some unusual house beers with a back bar set up for cocktails and mixers.
Style/Décor: Hints at an African convenience store type vibe, but without the groceries. Colourful, low-budget but charming, with some neon and fairylights. A 2 storey venue so try upstairs.
Atmosphere/Character: Friendly almost disarmingly local vibe considering the central location. It is a hangout spot for locals that Lille's lack of tourism allows for.
Amenities/Events: Limited outdoor seating, small meals and snacks, occasional events.
Value For Money: Standard for Lille centre.
description: Another bright, colourful bohemian low-budget effort with a friendly, young neighbourhood feel. Enough going on to have atmosphere and something interesting to drink in a venue that's very 'Lille'. (added March 2022)

name: La Capsule Lille
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: Multitap of contemporary craft beer from Belgium and France.
Style/Décor: Attractive corner townhouse with many tall windows which adds to the ambience of the room. Otherwise a familiar craft beer bar setup. Big blackboard, row of taps, relatively bland, if warm wood with Thankfully chunkier furniture too, albeit mainly stools rather than seats.
Atmosphere/Character: Overall the building and ambience is superior to most craft beer bars with less harsh lighting and a convivial and relatively intimate space despite some starker elements.
Amenities/Events: Limited snacks/spreads. Function room.
Value For Money: Standard for the area and especially considering the quality of goods available.
description: Sneaking onto the guide despite some relatively humdrum craft beer bar elements because of its impressive building with tall windows and complimentary warm fuzzy lighting. A convivial and intimate space to sample very high quality beers. Yes, there could be more personality and a distinctive touch added to elevate it further, but for now, it passes the bar for us (added March 2022)

name: At Square Des Halles
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: Surprisingly good selection of blondes and Tripels on tap for a rock bar. Well stocked back bar for mixers and spirits.
Style/Décor: A rock music den with flags and hoardings on the ceiling. A one room bunker that carries on past the bar situated by the entrance. 
Atmosphere/Character: Despite the energetic rock soundtrack most people are sat chatting in this bar that has a fairly pubby feel as a consequence. The usual range of people you'd expect to find in such a place, but relatively friendly feeling.
Amenities/Events: Limited snacks, jukebox.
Value For Money: Standard, perhaps a little bit expensive considering the rock pub theme.
description: A rock pub that is both lively and energetic as well as friendly with space to sit and chat. The balance is suprisingly subtle in this bar, which is to its credit. Lived-in and loved, with flags and haulage strewn above you, this place has a feel of a safe haven, and for anyone who enjoys rock music and informal evening hangouts, you can do worse, particularly bearing in mind the selection of specialist ales on tap. (added March 2022)

name: L'Atomic
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: A surprisingly good selection of Belgian ales on tap along with a competent back bar for alternatives.
Style/Décor: Sleazy, red, pink and neons with black furniture, records stuck to the ceiling and thousands of messages pinned to the wall by previous guests. 
Atmosphere/Character: A little wild, a place with a clear personality of its own, but if you're in the mood for fun, for letting your hair down and mucking in with the rest of the crowd here, you'll have a blast.
Amenities/Events: Occasional snacks brought to the table.
Value For Money: The price appears to be whatever the bar guy wants to charge you...good luck!
description: There's no disguising what this place is. Since 1991 this shrine to fast-living and the spirit of the night has been churning out the hits long into the small hours. Sleazy and a little bit raw, there is nevertheless a lot of joy, fun and welcome to be found if you are happy letting your hair down a little. Despite all this, they have quality ales like Tripel d'Anvers on tap, comfortable seating and a musical theme augmented by the thousands of messages people have scrawled and stuck on the walls. Atmospheric, distinctive, a Lille institution. You'll love it or hate it. (added March 2022)

name: The Dog & Bell
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Normally several cask ales on with a large selection of Belgian and German beers in the fridge. Otherwise typical back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Bright red hoardings with terrace out the front. Inside, multiroom with upholstered seating in familiar London fashion and a continuation of the red paint. A side room with rickety furniture, and walls decorated with breweriana, local history and ephemera including the strange cabinet by the entrance.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The character you'd expect from a pub that's got a little bit more going on with it than most. Dusky during the day and brilliant in the evening.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Meals, outdoor seating, quiz, snacks, bar billiards

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for London, albeit this venue is further out than some.

description: Award winning London pub that is well-known and well-loved. Distinctive red signage and a similarly distinctive interior give the place a lot of character. This is supported by a raft of community of events, good quality cask ales, large bottle selection, billiards and reasonably priced pub meals. One to seek out. (added March 2022)

name: The Bell, Bush Lane
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Range of cask ales with Pilsner Urquell as a lager option.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of the surviving pubs of the Great Fire of 1666. Tiny two roomed setup with low ceiling, beams, classic pub bric a brac and tinted windows. The main bar area has a very old fashioned ale house setup for a drink while standing, leaning or on a stool. Upstairs is almost like walking into a different place. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A clearly atmospheric venue in and of itself, with history that does convince as authentic.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Pies, snacks, upstairs seating, phone charging banks.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Expensive.

description: A tiny pub that should be on anyone's tour of the historic pubs in London. The low ceilings, tinted windows and out of date alehouse setup are immediately redolent of times gone by, while some OK beer options keep things real where it's important. While expensive, this is worth supporting. (added March 2022)

name: Old Coffee House
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Brodie's beers, limited keg and alternatives. OK back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Classic Londonia with thick vivid red paint and signage festooned wherever you look, including framed photographs of movie stars above the bar, and attractive mirrors in the corner. A bunker like pub that has been opened out.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A classic London boozer if ever there was one, this is a step aside from the chain pub format, albeit that the surroundings are familiar feeling in themselves. Quiet and cliquey in the afternoons and in the week before coming to life in the evenings.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited food and snacks, TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A historic venue that has nevertheless since its distant inscription turned into another thing entirely. You'll find a vivid bunkerlike pub with a familiar Old London Town feel. This place lays it on thick with nearly every inch of wall space used. The drinks could be improved, the carpet could be replaced, but overall there is easily enough going on to merit an inscription. (added March 2022)

name: Star & Garter
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable range of local ales on tap and small back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Simple brown upholstered furniture in a small 2 storey pub.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The vibe says 'please go away, American/Japanese tourists', and that approach seems to work from the evidence of our visits. A neighbourhood pub in an area slowly being leached of the things that form a neighbourhood.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
TV, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: A Soho pub that's for locals, not for tourists and almost stridently so in its simple and no-nonsense layout. A small bar room with an upstairs area is filled with some regulars nattering to staff and social life going on in a way that sadly isn't possible in the transient Monopoly trail pubs you find in London. Almost featureless, and that in itself is a feature. It sneaks on our guide. (added March 2022)

name: The Red Lion
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A reasonably generic set of options on tap which is a shame given it is not a chain pub 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Down a narrow passage lit by gas lamp, some of ol' London town may flood back. Small L shaped interior with wood panels, prints, brasses and bench seats. The leaded windows out to the passage are very characterful.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Bags of historic character when including the yard, with hints of Whitelock's in Leeds about it, and another survivor of the great fire of London. Whatever changes have happened since have hewn this pub into a cosy hideaway and drinking den away from the crowds of tourists.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Affordable and honest sandwich options. Fireplace. Snacks.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area

description: An old fashioned diamond down an alleyway, the wealth out on the streets of Pall Mall is shielded by this welcoming little hideaway that has hints of a pub like Whitelock's or Fagans in its total lack of sight of the yard outside. Allowing you to concentrate on relaxing in the intimate social surroundings of a proper pub. (added March 2022)

name: The Duke
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Sadly drab selection of cask ales and keg considering the otherwise opulent and singular nature of the pub. A better, if old-fashioned back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Art Decor splendour with varnished wooden traditional partitioned seats and screens, pastel paints and a backroom, complimented with foliage and some sympathetic ornaments.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Dusky atmosphere of total calm during the day in a way that has a feel almost of a Belgian café, with the parquet floor and old wood. The community feel comes alive later in the day, complimented by a soundtrack that works well with the surroundings.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited outdoor seating, meals, snacks, fireplace. Occasional events.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Expensive, no doubt due to the location.

description: For stylists, this pub is a must visit in London, a rare Art Deco ensemble with a firmly convincing effect, curated with big plants and tastefully chosen ornaments. The atmosphere is dusky and calm by day, with a more community feel at night time. If the drinks options improved and they were more democratically priced, this pub would move up to being one of the top 10 in London. For now, it is simply superior. (added March 2022)

name: Falstaff Free House
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Home brew cask conditioned gravity pulled ales from a traditional range of English styles, with some US influences.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
2-room pub. Leather upholstered bench seats and corner bar with hatch through to the back room.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Dusty and calm during the day with a cast of regulars nattering in the main bar area, that is definitely 'their space' and decent backroom with fireplace.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Pool table, jukebox, limited outdoor seating, snacks, fireplace, own brew beers.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very good for the area.

description: Magnificent Edwardian exterior tucked away in a string of residential streets, the cracked paint on the awning gives a hint of the wear and tear inside. A lived-in ale house with cast of regulars in the main room. Not unfriendly but a little cliquey and definitely using the whole room as their social space, while the back room goes unattended. The brewing operation gives the place an extra edge, with traditional ales available fresh on cask for a lower price (it's also CASH ONLY) than normal. With a pool table and jukebox, there are some amenities to enjoy, and we are sure in the evening the atmosphere will bubble up a little bit. This will be a love or hate it spot for many, but those who enjoy a throwback neighbourhood boozer that has been weathered but ultimately unspoilt should visit here. (added April 2022)

name: Ye Olde Dolphin Inne
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A range of cask ales, some at budget prices and its own-label pale ale available. Standard keg range and back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Half-timbered pub claiming medieval heritage, the interior manages to retain some character with low ceilings and a snug. Nice fireplace by the bar, some attractive niches and a characterful alleway entrance. (Update: Apparently subject to an unsympathetic paint job in some rooms)

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Excellent cosy bunker-like space that is friendly, warm, low key while at the same time feeling significant in terms of the nightlife of the city.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, meals, fireplace, books, boardgames.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for the area.

description: There is always a risk the Historic Tavern with a ghost story can be tacky, weathered and a bit touristy. Not so here, we're glad to report. While the exterior signage may give off the wrong vibes, this immediately improves on entrance, with a flagstone alleyway leading into a series of options, whether that's the snug, lounge, bar or courtyard. Inside low ceilings, cosy warmth and spaces that excel at providing intimacy and ease. While the format may be a little hoary and old-fashioned for some, this pub does the key elements right, and that's ultimately the most important thing. (Added April 2022)

name: The Smithfield
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Large selection of cask ales. OK back bar. Poor keg range that needs updating.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Genteel alehouse surroundings with tall ceiling and a curved wall around which bench seats and stools are placed. A hint of a café bar to it, A backroom with more pub appeal, red walls, pool table and breweriana recovered and placed on the walls.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Dominated by older folk during the day, it did seem bordering on an elderly waiting lounge, however comes alive during evenings and on Match Days.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, games, books, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
OK for the area, slightly more expensive.

description: No great anticipation arises as you approach the Smithfield with its generic greywash exterior, however on entry the place has an immediate draw with its simple farmhousey appearance with high ceilings and stripped back rustic decor. A rounded seating area envelopes the bar, with a backroom that acts somewhat as overspill but is more pubby and less café like than the bar. The clientele are late middle aged and as such, the place lacks a certain verve outside of evenings and match days where it comes alive. Cask ale options are great but there is room for improvement on keg and the back bar. Overall though, the appeal is sufficient to merit an inclusion. (added April 2022)

name: The Alexandra Hotel
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An outstanding selection of cask beers with some very decent modern decent keg options as well by comparison with other options in the city. A strong suit.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
2 room tavern with a bar area and lounge, both of which have a certain appeal. The lounge is especially characterful with its archway and recovered brewery signage, with simple furniture. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Buzzy and local in the bar room, while in the lounge, surroundings that put you immediately at ease.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Hotel with rooms, pub rabbit, cold food available, books, board games, dart board, fireplace.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
OK for the area.

description: A fantastic pub and candidate for one of the better traditional taverns in England. The two room setup provides both social informality and comfort depending on your mood. There is a nice mixture of locals and passing trade, partly on account of the proximity to the train station but also its pull as a reputed beer house, demonstrated by its CAMRA awards, not to mention new keg lines of craft beers. Service is friendly and the overall impression is extremely good. Worth going to Derby for on its own, which is even factoring in Derby's general lack of appeal is quite the statement. (added April 2022)

name: The Brunswick Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Home brew beers covering many styles with other brands available too. Some OK keg options. Standard back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A long pub with rooms off a central corridor and bar area. The centre of the action is the bar area itself, while some of the pub rooms feel a little detached in quieter periods, the shape of the building not lending itself terrifically well to the concept. Decor is quite plain with train station and brewing signage, also check out the brew kit at the end of the corridor.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A popular ale house with a good range of customers. Locals can sometimes block the path by congregating at the bar (see above). Some of the spaces don't generate enough atmosphere but there are effective parts of the pub.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Own brew beers, TV, meals, snacks, limited outdoor seating. Occasional events.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A local institution, popular pub brewing a large range of its own beers. A long building with some design quirks, not all positive, that overall achieves a decent ale house type appeal, depending on where you manage you place yourself. Decor is reasonable although signage is a little bland at points. As an all-rounder with a good range of beers it is effective enough to sneak onto our guide. (added April 2022)

name: Rapsodi
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard Euro range with raki and whiskey options standing out. Some draft beer.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Lounge bar with some traditional Albanian and new age influences standing out.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A local place on the main drag, this qualifies as one of the standout venues in a city largely taken up with wannabe Tirana type lounge bars.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, outdoor seating, dart board

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very good in general, though fairly standard for the city.

description: A local place on the main drag, this qualifies as one of the standout venues in a city largely taken up with wannabe Tirana type lounge bars. Albanian weaving and new age influences dominate the decoration, while competent and largely friendly staff set a welcoming atmosphere. In Elbasan at least, this is a standout. (Added April 2022)

name: Komiteti - Kafe Muzeum
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.4
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A decent range of mixers and cocktails with adequate, if not particularly outstanding beer options, including draft.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A work of art, hence the museum element in the title. Traditional Albanian arts and crafts decorate this courtyard bar with many galleries and side rooms decorated in unique fashion.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A true ruin bar atmosphere, laid back by day, buzzing at night, with plenty of locals still evident.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, outdoor seating, live music and events, books, smoking area, possibly Shisha

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Good in general, standard for central Tirana.

description: One of the Balkans best bars, Komiteti is a labour of love, and work of art that transmogrifies Albanian folk heritage into a ruin bar type setting. Worth a visit for the environment alone, but there are plenty of amenities and events to enjoy along with it. One to come back to again and again, and close to being a single reason to visit Tirana, high praise given this is hardly an uneventful or uninteresting place. (added April 2022)

name: EKO CLUB
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Range of non-alcohol drinks accompanied with some interesting flavoured Raki and adequate beer selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Lush and verdant with wood panels and greenery everywhere, a swing in the middle of the bar and plush cushions, with some traditional Albanian weaving. Covered terrace area.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
At first glance the place may seem dressy and pretentious but that is hardly the case. The mission is more wholesome with an ecological interest and community café vibe that becomes more bar like as the evening progresses. 100% local life too.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Books, music, outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fine for the area, which is already very affordable for Westerners.

description: At first glance the place may seem dressy and pretentious but that is hardly the case. The mission is more wholesome with an ecological interest and community café vibe that becomes more bar like as the evening progresses.  Lush and verdant with traditional Albanian weaving, enjoyed alongside interesting types of raki or a local beer. 100% local life too. An excellent place. (added April 2022)

name: Hemingway Bar Tirana
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Well made cocktails from a manageable menu along with mixers and shorts for those seeking something different. Some beer available too.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Hemingway themed, so expect Cuba, sleaze and excess in this small one-room setup with a fairly striking exterior.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brooding and very atmospheric inside with plenty of items to look at and people to interact with. A mixture of tourists and locals, this place is a little out on its own when it comes to the Tirana bar scene.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Limited outdoor space, live music, books.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Higher than the norm for Tirana

description: Hemingway as a cultural touchstone for bars may be somewhat long in the tooth, but that doesn't mean a bar itself has to be, and that is certainly not the case here. Vibrant with an efficient 1 cocktail maker 1 server operation pumping out quality cocktails with efficiency and a degree of care too. Brooding and yet lively, there is a lot to like about being holed up in here for the evening. Highly recommended. (Added April 2022)

name: Radio Bar Tirana
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Decent range of Belgian beers to accompany an extensive cocktail menu.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Antique radios and retro chic decorate what is still a relatively humble, unpretentious venue.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
At the centre of the Blloku district, this has the energy and verve required to fulfil Tirana residents needs on an evening. Buzzy with louder music later on.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, occasional live music, limited outdoors space

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Higher than normal for the city, fairly standard for the type of bar and the district.

description: An essential stop off for young guns seeking to experience Tirana's atmospheric Blloku district. One of the area's best bars, there is something to interest most pubgoers tastes here. Interesting decor with antique radios and retro music themed chic, Belgian beers that are a trickier find in Albania, and an extensive cocktail menu provide a decent all-round range for people. While the music gets louder later, this is a pretty versatile all-round venue and a must-visit.. (added April 2022)

name: Kaon Beer
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
It's called Kaon Beer and it has Kaon Beer on draft. An old fashioned Pivnice style range of wine, raki and old school booze otherwise.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Difficult to not find a way of adding "there's a huge mature tree in the middle of the bar' in every sentence concerning this place. However, look around that (literally) to find an unusually unspoilt old-school Balkan Pivnica hangout with wood fittings, footy memorabilia and a few nik-naks, with a fairly characterful bar area.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
This is a central hangout spot for older folk that is known by a new generation, who largely sit up on the terrace (where the tree sprouts through from). Outsiders are welcome too, just don't expect much English spoken.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, food, snacks, sport on TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Extremely good value for money for the area and almost pointedly so.
