Atmosphere/Character: Some character to be had here, clearly a venue that has seen a few things and survived. In summer it may be quiet inside but it will come alive in the winter months.
Amenities/Events: Basic snacks, outdoor seating
Value For Money: A few cents more for some beers, but occasional deals can surprise.
description: The famous Oude Markt may be the 'longest bar in Belgium' with many bars outdoor seating bleeding into one another, but despite the natural amphitheatre and dozens of lots, plenty of the operations on the square do not get any better than simply 'yeah, ok'. Café Belge is an exception with enough going on to recommend it. For starters, a large bottle menu with a couple of taps on rotation should retain the interest of beer geeks. The snack tray is enormous (if not especially high quality) and late opening will prove convenient too. Inside there's a reasonably cosy space that's somewhere between brown café and the dive bar this venue really would prefer to be. (added August 2022)

name: Ankertje aan de Dijle
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: Several taps with some more modern Belgian options, with a typically competent suite of bottle options for Belgian classics.
Style/Décor: A two storey pub with a patio, this is one Belgian café you can definitely describe as more of a pub. Exposed wood with selective decoration of historic scenes, breweriana, pop culture and Mechelen heritage.
Atmosphere/Character: Both visits have found the place quiet, but it is clear there is a central importance and no doubt it fills up at night, particularly in winter. Even when quiet, the place is pleasant if not a true standout.
Amenities/Events: Jukebox, food, live music, occasional community events, snacks, outdoor seating.
Value For Money: Standard rate for the city centre.
description: A pub/tavern rather than a café, this two storey drinking venue offers a little bit more, with jukebox, games, events etc, an all-rounder covering a number of bases well. (Added August 2022)

name: The Queens Head
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A range of cask ales with some midlands classics, well stocked back bar, poor keg options however.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Victoriana, with side rooms and partioned areas including a snug. Leather seats, decorative wallpaper and local heritage.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Due to the decor, a characterful place quiet or busy. Local life comes from the surviving backstreet location, and unusual circumstance of being 1 of 2 pubs directly next door to each other.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Darts, TV, community events, snacks, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable for the area.

description: This little gem has a distinctive Victoriana feel that has been kept well, unspoilt with tiled floor, floral wallpaper, multi-rooms with snugs and a basic bar area that is transporting in time, reinforced by the Bass beer handpumped from the cask. Local life comes from a backstreet location, truly a survivor, an oddity too, being one of two pubs directly next door to each other. A lovely neighbourhood pub reminiscent of The Victoria in Durham. While not as purely artistic or characterful as that, a distinctive standout location in the area nevertheless. (Added August 2022)

name: Pivní lokál U Bomby
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Poutnik with a range of rotating options from smaller local independent brewers. Limited alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Making micro-pubs look small, this is no more than a corridor with a bar, one big table and some leaning posts. Red paint and a large map of Kralovo-Pole, the district it is based on.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Out in the suburbs, but Brno is cosmopolitan these days and the crowd is truly varied from alt-kids, grizzlies, local families with their dogs and post-grads including the international crowd.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks, books

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair, unremarkable.

description: This tiny, tiny pub is almost a kiosk with outdoor seating, but still classes as one with its large stamgast table in front of the bar and leaning posts. The range of beers rotates and some unusual ones feature alongside the ever presents like Poutnik, trusty delicious Poutnik. Out in the suburbs of Kralovo-Pole, the new-town extension to Brno is plotted on the walls of the pub, these days it feels integrates into the city well, and it really doesn't take long on the tram to get here. (Added August 2022)

name: Pivnice U šneka
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brewpub beers plus a few on rotation from small Czech brewers. Wines from the region by the bottle and typical back bar spirits.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pubby little pivnice with the bar straight at you by the entrance, stamgast tables then a ramp to a backroom. All warm mid-brown wood, curved ceilings and pump clips decorating the bar. A few little quirks here and there.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The centre of the town's pub action and by far its best pub for atmosphere, this is where to find the local gossip, where to meet new friends and have a natter. The duo running the place are good cop/bad cop which comes with its own ups and downs. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Books, board games, limited outdoor space, snacks and basic meals

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Quite reasonable 

description: Znojmo's pub life centres around this brewpub which has wisely, in the viewer of this write, focused on creating the social pub rather than brewing and leaving the venue as an afterthought. The place has a natural space which promotes socialising and on entering you immediately get the sense that the goings on of the town are never far away from being discussed here. As for the beers, a very competent 11 degree pale lager is the stalwart with their brewing operation producing a few seasonal rotations and specials, which is complimented by 3 or 4 alternatives also from independent small brewers. Which around here is an excellent find. Wines by the bottle reflect this is wine country. A great place and clearly an institution. (added August 2022)

name: Pivnice Na Stadionu
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Dalesice 11 on tap, a surprisingly excellent option to find in a pub like this. Otherwise basic but competent macro lager, wines and typical Czech spirits.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A large function room type pub with warm wood fittings, which is an afterthought in summer as the beer garden under mature trees is very pleasant and almost a venue in itself. Large signage fitting the name, with the stadium next door.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Great social atmosphere outdoors, a large venue which takes in a decent catchment area. It's reassuring to find pub life like this not necessarily where you'd expect.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, outdoor grills, live music, games, food, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very reasonable with all beers under 40 crowns at the time of writing (2022)

description: A local pub by a football stadium doesn't necessarily give off vibes of warm friendly collegiate family-focused fun, but things are different in Czechia and especially this region. Outdoor beer garden seating is pleasant under mature trees, with a grill and stage prepared for events and an outdoor tap meaning you often barely set foot in the place. In winter the large function room with games does the job functionally. But it is the overall package that appeals and deserves credit, with the cherry on top, Delicious Dalesice 11 beer on tap. (Added August 2022)

name: Vinotéka a vinárna Jezuitská Znojmo
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
The finest wines from the region with a very reasonable selection by the glass. Bonus, a large fridge with some of the best traditional Belgian beer and a very good Czech lager on tap.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Based in an attractive old townhouse with bench seating around the curved walls, this leads to a small entrance with a little bar area and upstairs with fairylights. Through the gap downstairs leads you to their wine shop.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Friendly service and pleasant bar adds to an intimate atmosphere that avoids becoming overly formal though is still a little staid and hushed. Nevertheless it is a good location to take a partner.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food platters, tastings, community events, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value considering the quality of wine and beer on offer.

description: Sneaking onto our guide with a combination of great wines by the glass all from the local area, friendly service and an intimate atmosphere inside. Outside on the benches is a nice place to enjoy the wines also - or beer - there is a fridge filled with the best Belgian traditional Belgian beer you'll find outside the major cities. (added August 2022)

name: Hostan Na Kopečku
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Hostan, South Moravian folk classic (now just a brand) and a limited array of Czech spirits. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A time-stood-still hostinec with wood strip panels, dusty interior and relics decorating the wall. A large long table facing the bar hosts most of the socialising. Dartboard at the back of the pub.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A true locals pub where you can expect to find a few raised eyebrows, though not necessarily any hostility if you enter armed with some polite phrases. It is local gossip town with banter between friends, or long term acquaintances at least.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Dartboard, snacks, basic meals, limited outdoor space

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value with the beer easily 10 crowns less than most of the venues in the centre.

description: A preserved out of time Hostinec with almost dream like woozyness to the atmosphere inside, like entering into a saloon, with a hint of trepidation given the core of local life that call it home. However, you shouldn't expect too much hostility with a kindly hostess and generally tolerant crowd that will get on with their own business rather than hassle you. A true piece of social history that's authentic - unlike the Hostan beer now brewed by Starobrno, but hey, you'll find it here at a very low price, almost half the rate for a Pilsner Urquell in Prague. For the adventurous who want a slice of authenticity with their Czech pubgoing. Not for those who want a safe time in a sterile venue with a world class beer. (Added August 2022)

name: Cafe Bendl
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Basic lager with some ok alternatives. Wine and spirits are similarly routine Viennese offerings.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Not too well preserved old-fashioned café situated just by the city hall that has long ago shed any pretensions of elegance or high society. Crackled, worn, peeling, but oh-so-characterful.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A superb frozen in time café oozing with character (and god knows what else). The lady of a certain age running the place is well-loved by a young crowd who share space with the remaining old fogeys.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, simple food, jukebox

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the location

description: Well, well...just when you thought Vienna was a tough nut to crack, along comes this bar hiding in plain sight in one of the most fancy and upmarket areas of the city. It's a true dive that has seemingly turned an elegant café into a late night bar. The elderly fixtures and fittings crackle and peel but that just adds to the character, along with a lively audience of youngster rubbing shoulders with the older regulars, all of whom are served by and show appreciation for the lady behind the bar who operates in a warm, kindly way. Whether you're by the bar or in the lounge, there is plenty of atmosphere and a lot to look at. The drinks may be perfunctory but that's hardly the reason to come here.  (Added August 2022)

name: Stehbeisl Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A decent selection of beers given the average offerings, with several decent Austrian Landbiers and a couple of German classics. Well stocked back bar serving cocktails and aperitivo.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A wide frontage leads to a shallow, narrow space inside with the bar running along the back wall and two small areas at either end for seating. Moody, alternative decor of dark reds and colourful lamplights complimented by rickety fittings.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Characterful venue that is adept at slower and busier times at providing the right mood. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, outdoor seating, books

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing outrageous.

description: A relief to discover Stehbeisl, one owner of the Beisl name that hasn't devolved into a silver service restaurant. Quite the opposite - here is a lively bar with a combo of olde-worlde charm and offbeat bohemian decor. Decent drinks across the range and an audience of mainly post-grads attest to its relevance, without the bar feeling at all pretentious. It's effective quiet or busy, and ticks a lot of boxes in a city where good bars are trickier to locate. (Added August 2022)

name: Kaffee Alt Wien
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Compact, competent but fairly unexciting range of staples.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Walls covered in old posters for live events and movies, old time café furniture and seating in a bar that is surprisingly cavernous, opening out to a backroom which then leads to a further sizeable overflow area.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Busy and buzzy, befitting the central location and tourist swells. Overseen by typical elderly Viennese wiseguys that are kindly but never far away from a barbed remark.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, occasional live events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little more expensive on account of the area.

description: Historic Viennese Café propelled to continuing relevance by its golden location ensuring everlasting footfall. Wisely though, they've kept the interior more informal and so here is a place for a drink rather than worrying about dress code or silver service. It functions as a bar effectively most times of day, with the social function pushed to the fore. The establishment nature of the place is accentuated by typically Viennese service, friendly - or are they - wisecracking servers. It's a really nice place and there always seems to be space due to the cavernous backrooms. A vital casual hangout in a city not endowed with places like this on every corner. (Added August 2022)

name: Gasthaus zum Holunderstrauch
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good beer and wine here with specials. Bio-focus.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A Gaststatte type pub with a pubby ground floor bar area with communal seats, and basement restaurant type area. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pleasantly rustic with a good balance of visitors and locals, nice rhythm of staff and decent welcome. Not overly stuffy at all. A sense of institution despite its modesty.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, meals, newspapers, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
A few cents higher for drinks, we are in the pricey part of Vienna, but meals are reasonably priced given the location, particularly the daily specials.

description: A city institution, superbly-reviewed, this Gasthaus offers pub style environs in its genteel ground floor ausschenk/kneipe type that could feature anything from old fogeys reading the news to a group of youngsters coming for lunch and beers. The intimate space makes for a good social experience, although it is relatively staid given the food focus. Downstairs is more restaurant-like. Service is honest and food is usual hearty committedly Viennese stuff. (Added August 2022)

name: Café Hawelka
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: A typical café range but deliberately stripped back in reference to the fact of its historic offerings.
Style/Décor: Preserved café which has a hint of the Belgian brown café if a Viennese one had been left to pickle in aspic in the same way. The effect is uncanny valley, at once elegant and tatty, out of time yet familiar. Some live event posters fixed to the wall, with evidence of the erstwhile former owners all around, including busts by the fireplaces.
Atmosphere/Character: As described above, expect to be enveloped in a sense of history if you decide to sit indoors, although at least these days you won't be enveloped in smoke, as happened until relatively recently. The atmosphere sways through lulls and buzzier moments during the day, and it's cute to see the waiter have to grumpily rush to answer the phone from an old kiosk installed in the corner.
Amenities/Events: Food, newspapers, books, snacks, outdoor seating
Value For Money: Higher than average on account of fame and location.
description: A true city institution and one of the places you will find mentioned in the guides. There are pluses and minuses to visiting. The pluses, the interior is a thing of beauty, the service is a thing of charisma to spectate on, and the interior is bar like enough to socialise informally. Minuses, yes, it's touristy, more expensive and occasionally the waiters will lose their rag at some idiots or other. Taking the rough with the smooth, it's still worth recommending. (Added August 2022)

name: Brendl
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Tyrolean beers and wines, reasonably stocked back bar across the range.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A reddish boudoir with chandeliers, plants.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pitched somewhere between a bordello and a café, very friendly staff make you feel immediately welcome, setting a positive tone. A little outdoor terrace is popular in summer while the environment of the interior serves the winter months well. Atmosphere has a drifting feel early evening but can get rammed on certain dates, winter weekends especially.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Complimentary snacks, live events, community events, books, games, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair when pricing in the complimentary snacks.

description: This quirky little bar is a nice change of speed from the traditional venues offering a truly warm welcome with kind service and complimentary tapas while also adding a bit of glamour and seediness with big chandeliers and woozy red walls. As a result, the audience fits the appearance, with a diverse alternative crowd of post-grads and neighbours. There are decent Tyrolean beers available on draft, good wines, spirits and aperitivo and in some respects it covers a number of bases rather well. There's a pleasant drifting atmosphere at quieter times while it can get busy and buzzy inside on winter weekends. One to bookmark if that sounds your thing. (Added August 2022)

name: Philosopher Beer Bar Beisl
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: Despite the tempting title, the offerings are good rather than great here, with decent Austrian Landbier and traditional bottles, with craft beer still pushed right to the periphery.
Style/Décor: A small bar with traditional low key fittings, a pleasant backroom with shelves and board games.
Atmosphere/Character: Pitched at freaks and geeks, this isn't the usual Viennese beisl, low key with a rock soundtrack and casual atmosphere.
Amenities/Events: Books, board games, outdoor seating, snacks
Value For Money: Usual for the area, fair.
description: An antidote to the stuffy Beisls, Philosoph acts as a bolthole for freaks n' geeks, rockers, punks, scruffs and anyone inbetween. The decor isn't too try hard, it's a casual low-key but decidedly informal alternative spot, a little slice of something different among a city centre largely set up to delight haute-bourgeoisie. The beers are decent with several  Austrian Landbier options on tap and a good range of bottles, though mainly around traditional styles. You can easily imagine dropping by regularly if you lived in the area which is perhaps the best compliment to offer. (Added August 2022)

name: 7Stern Bräu
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brewpub offerings charting typical German/Austrian styles with seasonal specials. Mainly competent. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
While the branding itself may be a little outdated, the venue has a decent concept with the brewkit and bar in the centre with a crucible of bar and seating around it. A pleasant courtyard at the back provides significant additional space.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably versatile with the beer garden in summer and steamy warm brewpub in winter. Not someone to find a cult crowd of locals or scenes however. The trade is fairly transactional and transient.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Special brews, occasional events, meals, outdoor seating, bottle dispenser

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area, though not particularly cheap.

description: A long standing brewpub operation that has become a minor institution while retaining some of its fairly naff branding. However, the venue itself has a striking position for its brewkit at the centre of the room, with the bar around it and furniture above it. The courtyard out the back is pleasant too, and overall with the homebrew beer offerings this makes for a pleasant combo, and a reliable option. (Added August 2022)

name: The Glebe
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Joule's ales with a dull range of keg options. Standard bottles and back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A jewel with stained glass with Joule's branding insets, hues of reds and browns, large paintings and chunky tables, every bit the town tavern.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pleasant to sit in when quiet, conversely it's busy and buzzy on match days. Reasonably versatile.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, food and snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: Next to the council and city institutions, this place feels similarly like part of the fabric. A town tavern with stained glass, large paintings and insignia, the place is intended to convey some sort of Georgian type tavern and does so pretty well. Due to the interesting interior and big comfy furniture it's pleasant to sit here on quiet afternoons but it can up the pace when it needs to, as shown on busy match days. Well worth checking out. (Added September 2022)

name: Bridge Street Ale House
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Several cask pumps and cider boxes with local and regional produce. Well kept and high quality.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Rustic micropub that feels somehow like entering a wooden crate. Raised seating by a little bar which unintuitively faces sideways rather than towards most of the punters. Casks on display in the window.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local life and character on show even mid-afternoon on a Monday. Yes, an older audience as you might expect, but this varies depending on the time of day and day of the week. Quite a social circle with local gossip and banter.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks, occasional community events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair

description: A micropub that's a backstreet local, this place pumps high quality cask ales and ciders but acts as a social circle whether that's midweek midafternoon or busy weekends. The value can be seen not only from the great reviews but upon entering with exposed casks and cider boxes, the warm welcome despite the local crowd and the intimate space that promotes social conversation and mingling. A really good find if you're in the area. (Added September 2022)

name: The Victoria
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Several cask pumps, at the time of writing two Tiny Rebel ales on permanently with rotating guests. Typical neighbourhood pub fare when it comes to alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A small, warm pub with light touch of Victoriana to the decor. Plush red upholstered seats by the window, simple furniture and a small second room. In good condition and well maintained.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A nice intimate social space. While there is an absence of the spectacular, it is a series of small decisions along with the well-maintained nature of the place that brings together its quality. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, light food, limited outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair, nothing outstanding

description: Situated by a busy link road with some grand buildings, this place could easily be a hair salon or an accountants from the outside, with its curved windows and light hues, but enter to find a pub with Victorian influences, cosy seating and several cask lines in good condition. There is a distinctly reassuring feel to having such a pub be where it is. As it is comfortable and intimate, you can easily pop in during quiet hours and enjoy the calmness, but it is fitted out to step up the pace when called upon. A very nice, low key venue that should attract a range of ages and tastes. (Added September 2022)

name: The Holy Inadequate
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Excellent range of cask ales with the host brewery tap's wares, guests and then large fridge taking in craft ale plus Belgian classics. Perfunctory alternatives

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A large whitewashed building by the motorway which stands out. The interior is low-key with a few hints of the 'roadside tavern' about it, but mainly going for a simple ale house look. The furniture has had some thought (and money) put into it with some niches, benches etc to accommodate different crowds.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very popular hangout so expect to see plenty of people even earlier in the day during midweek. The bar area tends to have a throng of locals but there are places in and around to sit. You can't help but feel like you're in the right place in the area.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Pies and scotch eggs, snacks, outdoor seating, occasional events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fair value throughout

description: Credit to any pub that does a lot of things well, that you can reflect on and while not thinking of any particular standout feature, have been thoroughly satisfied by what was on offer. This applies to here where the most striking element of the pub is its silly name. They host homebrew beers and a broad range of options from cask, keg and bottles not just from the UK but with some Belgian classics featuring. Good cider options too, and all are provided for pretty reasonable value. Care has gone into the furnishing with each space used thoughtfully to maximise the room and promote both conviviality and discretion. A cast of locals even earlier on attests to what a local legend the pub is. A venue to mark on your map should you ever be in the area. Do be careful to check opening hours before setting off there. (Added September 2022)

name: Hillgrove Porter Stores
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cask ale focused and standard back bar options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Lived-in hillside suburban pub with corner entrance, pump clips, bookshelves, leather bench seats. Cosy. Terrace at the back.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Homely, cosy and characterful pub that has the benefit of feeling lived in and loved. Not everything is sparkling new and that's part of its charm, more like putting on a comfy pair of shoes than Sunday best.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Japanese streetfood kitchen, books, board games, snacks, outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: One of those pubs where everything about it feels  right, from the traditional ales to the contemporary street food and everything in between. This is an unpretentious cosy, casual yet relevant feeling hangout spot for reading, games, socialising and relaxing, aided by a good deal of amenities and an attractive terrace out the back. Up on the hillside with views over the valley to the South East, you feel something extra too, almost a club-like feel of belonging even from a first visit. A truly superior pub warranting your attention. (Added September 2022)

name: Highbury Vaults
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A relatively unexciting range of competent cask options with some mediocre beer-tie options. Not the pub's strongest suit, but does the job.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A small interior of niches and side room with a small bar area. Browns and deep yellows with the distracting quirk of an operating train set running along the wall. A larger back room leads to a partially covered beer garden and terrace out the back.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Superbly characterful bar and niches which are set up for cosy socialising in the winter months perfectly, while the pleasant back garden feels like an extension of the same place (even if it's quite different). Excellent social quality with a true range of customers.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Bar billiards, snacks, outdoor seating, train set, books

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Relatively expensive for beers.

description: An outstanding neighbourhood pub with plenty to recommend it, enter to find a throwback gloriously characterful old boozer with niches, browns and yellows and social surroundings, but it doesn't end there, with a few unusual additions such as a train track running alongside the bar and a bar billiards table, (almost always a sign of a good pub). The back yard in summer is a pleasant spot too and gives the place a versatility it may have not had in the past. Although the ale choices are towards the perfunctory end and not the best value either, that is one slight weak point in an otherwise fantastic pub that should be on your hitlist. (Added September 2022)

name: Клуб Шапките / The Hat's Club
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Compact selection with a fridge of Czech and Belgian classics, and back bar with straightforward whiskies, rum and brandy.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A small one-room pub with a partition and leaning posts, very limited seating with stools at the bar. Decorated in a wooden old-timer style with old suitcases and radio, the odd piece of memorabilia.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A friendly smoking/pipe club with cast of regulars who all know each other well. Initially you may feel like an outside but you are quickly brought into the fold. An international feeling place too.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited snacks, smoking allowed (not strictly speaking, but...)

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area, nothing alarming.

description: A special little hideout for pipe enthusiasts with a core crowd of friendly regulars there for conversation and relaxation. At first you may seem like an interloper but don't be put off, before long someone will make conversation - they are friendly and internationally minded so you will be fine. Drinks are basic and do the job, but the core quality is the tremendous social value. Before long you'll notice hours have flown by as the next person introduces themselves and so on. Really a diamond in the middle of an unlit backstreet, but also in Sofia in general. (added October 2022)

name: Beer Kolobars Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
8 taps of high quality beer with some seasonal variation and guests, international and regional along with brewpub wares from the same business. Large bottle selection (it's also a bottleshop). Limited alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Converted office space with those familiar panel insets but converted to a bar tastefully with lamplight over the bar area, a row of tables adjacent to the entrance and lower down seating by the front door and the bottle shelves. Terrace too. Walls decorated with breweriana.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The decor helps create a feel of being a beer club, but the diverse audience, TV and sense of significance adds quite a bit more than that, it feels like the place to be - and in this town it certainly is.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Deli cuts / snacks / outdoor seating / Sport on TV / Brewery / Bottleshop

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very reasonable

description: A true diamond in the rough, in a provincial town that has an obscure European reputation at best, finding anything like this is a huge - and welcome - surprise. A beer lover's paradise with shop, brewery and bar which has been tastefully set up in such a way that the obsessive beeriness doesn't dominate - it serves just as well as a local pub, as confirmed by a diverse crowd. The sport on TV doesn't dominate, nor does the row of beer shelves at the other end of the room. Friends can be made and lost, snacks consumed and lovely high quality beer in abundance. Fantastic place. (added October 2022)

name: Art club NYLON (Найлона)
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Basic, but reasonable range of typical late bar drinks, not a specialist area but bases covered. A couple of craft beers in the fridge and some lesser seen spirits too.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Antiquey venue with recovered radios in stacks, browns and muted colours across the place. The bar area opens out to form a natural stage opposite the bar itself which tapers off to the wall.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A late bar that requires a degree of custom to drum up any atmosphere, simply due to the space in the main bar area. When it is busy it feels like the place to be, but when quiet, the space near the entrance is characterful enough to have a slow drink.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live music, limited outdoor space, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for money

description: A late bar with antiquey decor, live music and a worn-in feel, this operates as a reasonably alternative, rock-leaning hangout spot in Plovdiv city centre, and the complimentary combo of lively crowds and interesting decor creates that buzz that helps it stand out from some of the more sterile, generic choices. Maybe not a place to go at opening or closing, but pick a sweet spot between 10pm and midnight and you'll see what the fuss is about. (Added October 2022)

name: K.E.B.A.
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Serving a mixed audience, focus is on cocktails and aperitivo, though they have not left out beer lovers with a range of craft bottles. Tap options and regular choices leave a bit to be desired however.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An attractive courtyard bar with space that widens out the more you explore. With fairylights, plants and conservatory areas it is a pleasant space. Inside, a multi-floor late bar-cum-club is a mish-mash of styles, deliberately so.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very pleasant in the courtyard with a relaxed feel, livelier tempo inside, although can feel absent of atmosphere when it is quiet.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating / food / club 

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Not very good value, as this is one of the see and be seen spots in central Sofia

description: One of Sofia's main nightlife hubs, K.E.B.A tries to be several things at once - lounge bar, alternative courtyard bar, multi-level club, and just about succeeds. There are corners of the place to hangout and enjoy that will suit most people, with the best perhaps being the conservatory bar area to the left as you enter. Cocktails and aperitivo come first but thought has been paid to people who enjoy alternatives. The plants and decor in the courtyard create a warm glow that's very pleasant, while the option to take things up a notch means this is a versatile venue to recommend, just not one that is particularly great value for money. (Added October 2022)

name: Kontrabas
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
A small bar with simple options of beer, wine, mixers and spirits that are on the basic side.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Situated in a restored Ottoman house in Plovdiv old town, exposed beams, off-centre rustic and homely decor with a large double bass fresco by the bar, a few little old timer nik nak ornaments, and a terrace where live music is played.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A superb setting for live music on the terrace, even if you can't get a front row seat, the music permeates the whole pub, and makes you feel part of what's going on even if you're chilling out and socialising inside or out front. The old house and hilltop location make it feel a bit extra special, although it certainly is on the mainstream middle-aged side rather than alternative in many ways.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live music / food / outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
A little higher than average with a cover charge for live music, albeit not extortionate.

description: Plovdiv old town is a restored marvel with large trader houses and cobbled streets. Up on the hill is a good place for this Jazz bar with its warm homely hues indoors and pleasant leafy terrace acting as a natural stage for the music. There is a cover charge, beware, though not extortionate. Drinks are basic in comparison to the food, but thankfully food doesn't dominate and you can come here to listen but equally to socialise. It isn't too touristy either, the vast majority of people when we visited were obviously locals. (Added October 2022)

name: Halbite Beer Hall
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer specialists with local beers but concentrating on German and Czech lagers, with Belgian ales features. This dominates the selection on tap and bottles.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
'Pubby pub' with wood fittings and a few basic tables around a surprisingly narrow bar area. There does not seem much of a focal point inside, however the beer garden is a decent size. Not really a 'beer hall' unless there was some vast cavern we missed.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Social and deliberately low key, you enter via an unassuming corridor to the beer garden which is pleasant and social, likewise the small bar area inside. It's a step away from any kind of aspirational see-and-be-seen nightlife, this is just about a nice beer and a chat, simplicity.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, basic meals, outdoor seating, TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Decent value for money.

description: A local pub in the centre that is deliberately unassuming and simple, the merits of Halbite are in its total universal simplicity, with good quality beer wares and places to sit and chat inside and out. This makes it difficult to describe in florid details, but it stands out beyond any typical lounge bar or even certain craft beer bars for its obvious social significance. (Added October 2022)

name: Jazz Club Jazz Insights \ В Джаза
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
A good whisky selection, basic back bar and really quite poor beer selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Basement jazz venue with neons and a natural stage near the stairs as you enter. The bar is tucked away in a sideroom.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A friendly crowd that clearly regularly haunt the place. You don't need to be a musician or a jazz expert, although it wouldn't hurt. Pretty atmospheric both pre during and post jazz concerts.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live music / Snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
A little higher than average

description: With Plovdiv already boasting one popular Jazz bar, it is relatively unusual to find two in good health even in a relatively large city. This one is almost the flipside of the coin. While Kontrabas is up on a hill in the old town, sophisticated and middle aged, this is a basement bar in a city centre block with a younger crowd that perform and enjoy jazz with a bit more of a flourish. (Added October 2022)

name: Baba Yaga
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A well-covered range of drinks from cocktails to spirits and beers, without any specialism but all of a good standard. Beer range is supported by a fridge full of good regional German options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A bit of an odd one, not necessarily in an effective way. The ceiling with some corrugated plastic is a bit distracting while the rest is quite effective. A corner bar with two main rooms, the second acting as a more loungey side. Upstairs is a games room with ping-pong.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Certainly a social hangout with an international flavour, English regularly heard and diverse faces. This goes easily with the environment, and you'll find most here are on the younger side of the audience.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Table tennis, games, instruments, books, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing unusual for the area

description: This corner bar is somewhat of an in-the-know place for Plovdiv, hardly a secret, but tuck a few streets along from the mainstream crowd. You have an interesting mix of ex-pats, misfits and cool sorts enjoying a somewhat bohemian if not totally successful bar. Oddities like an upstairs table tennis room and corrugated odd ceiling, with blackboard defaced with the latest stream of consciousness add to the vibe. Drinks are broad in range and very decent. It's one to mark down for the city. (Added October 2022)

EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️
Very basic beers and spirits in what is effectively a Bulgarian mancave.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Kamenitza hoarding obscures what is a dark-wood cabin style interior with traditional decoration, net curtains and floral print seating. Pointedly ad-hoc, and quaint.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An old man's drinking den owned (whatever that means in this context) by a few families, but in reality run as a bit of a retirement hobby. Don't be surprised to see stares and raised eyebrows if you decide to go in, but that's all part of the charm. Once inside, there's a true pub atmosphere and if you're lucky one of the younger family members will be around to say Hi.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Smoking allowed (or at least, it happens), limited snacks (if you ask nicely)

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
About the cheapest beer in a pub in Bulgaria.

description: We found this place fleeing from a thunderstorm overhead. The lights were on, it had a beer sign, so off we went. But until our visit there was no Google profile or online reference. However, we can confirm this is in fact a pub. An old dark brown cabin with genteel decor and hard smoking locals, this is softened slightly with a pub dog and a general tolerance once you get seated and served. In a place like Samokov, such places are rarer than hen's teeth in a country with little pub culture to speak of. However, as a business run by 3 families, if you are lucky enough to run into the younger members, they may engage you in conversation. Sit back and enjoy old time simplicity. Smoking, telly and beer so cheap you could barely by it for less in a supermarket. The marmite factor is sky high, you'll love it or you'll wonder what drugs we're on. (Added October 2022)

name: Клуб Мария Луиза/Club Maria Louisa
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Slightly out of date drinks selection, albeit in rather a charming way. Bases still covered but modernity an afterthought, if a thought at all.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A colourful, stylish and slightly bawdy corner bar with an open entrance in summer, you walk direct from the street onto a parquet floor. Small with local artwork on the wall and personalised ornaments.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The rhythm of the place goes according to its appearance, certainly more latin in influence than many Bulgarian bars, slightly arty and one of the few venues that fall between the gaps of the typical venues. Lively from evening onwards.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, artwork, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️ Not unreasonable
description: Stylish, bawdy long-standing corner bar that has been going since the mid-90s which around here is a long, long time. Small with a parquet floor for dancing and colourful red paint and local artwork in amongst oddities collected over the years. Drinks are perfunctory and sort of lost in time a little, you'll find this venue a breath of fresh air, maybe even more than that in amongst some of the more typical cookie cutter sterile venues elsewhere. This is a place to wear your heart on your sleeve, and all the better for it. (Added October 2022)

name: Eddie Sicoy Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A couple of Irish beer options as a nod to the concept, along with whiskies and an Eastern European notion of what such a bar should stock. A couple of local Bulgarian craft beers available in bottle.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Although an Irish bar in concept, thankfully the effect is very muted that such details fade into the background a little. Tasteful green paint and fairly recent looking Bushmills merchandise decorate a two level pub with a lounge area and some TV screens.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Recognisably pubby with its lounge seating at the back of the bar and congregation of locals at the bar itself. The place tries to catch some other customers with music pumping out and TV screens, which is only partly effective.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
TV, events downstairs, occasional live music

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
City centre prices but not outrageous

description: A tasteful Irish-influenced bar rather than a plastic paddy one, this is a pub to all intents and purposes which has had a bit of money spent on it recently. The overall effect works reasonably well, and although it lacks standout features, the sum is greater than its parts, which should be seen as the compliment it is. There are different spaces to hang out too, whether that's the social hub at the bar, the lounge space at the back or downstairs with occasional live events.  It's a good bar, one to have as an insurance policy. (Added October 2022)

name: Papa Beer - Craft Beer Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The latest craft beers from home and abroad on tap, with a decreasing offer on the bottle shelves, but still better than most. Some good quality German beers available.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Typical craft fare with seaside influences feeding into the sailor hat and bearded man drawn across the wall. A pub with two rooms and a reasonable outdoor terrace on the street.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
It is the nature of the pub there are always some people milling about. A mix of locals and transient tourist custom, it works equally well day or night, possibly better earlier rather than later actually. Sullen staff.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Merchandise, bottleshop, snacks, takeaway

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
A little higher than average which should be expected

description: A rare craft beer bar in Bulgaria and a decent one too, with a good social scene on the street side in summer, the latest local brews on tap complimented by good European offerings. If only service was even slightly more civil, the only bitter flavour would be from the beer. That said, if you can handle the grumpiness and find a good spot to sit, this is going to be a must visit bar in Burgas. (Added October 2022)

name: HIGH FIVE taproom // craft beer bar & shop
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Latest Bulgarian craft beer offerings with sizeable fridge with cans, bottles and a few alternatives. Complimented by Czech lagers on tap.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A tiny drop-in local with a few tables, almost perversely small with a corner bar and fridges taking up easily half the space. Colourful decor with blues and yellows, certainly distinctive.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
When popular, the place is quickly crowded, but it can also be a nice place for a quiet drink mid afternoon in a reasonably intimate space. There isn't much else to add except to say the staff are friendly and speak English.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food can be ordered form the next door restaurant. Snacks, takeaway.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Expensive, possibly even by western standards, city centre, capital city prices.

description: One of Sofias handful of craft beer specialists, this tiny microbar offers the latest wares at city centre, bordering on Western rates, but quality is assured. The space itself is typically ad hoc and a little quirky, benefits from being able to order food from the next door restaurant and friendly staff. It can get very crowded, atmospheric in itself, but also a nice intimate space when quiet for a beer and a chat. Overall, well worth marking down to visit. (Added October 2022)

name: Котка и Мишка, Cat and Mouse Beer Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
5 or 6 taps with a range of Bulgarian craft beer and a few standards. Bottles from the connected brewery available.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Modern craft with the typical slate and exposed wood decor, warm colours and overall a pleasant if slightly generic space.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Modern, hip and happening in the core of Plovdiv's most cosmopolitan street, you'll find the usual array of fashionably aloof looking 20 somethings in ill-fitting clothing, and a quite pleasantly informal atmosphere with belongings strewn about in what seems to be a work space for some as well as a bar during the day.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Takeaway, Food, snacks, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
More expensive than normal for the area.

description: One of Plovdiv's official cool spots, and while that might invite a bit of a sneer, the venue is actually pretty good. The usual slates + greys dominate the decor, but this is warm and welcoming, the beer selection is superior including their own operation's beers available on tap, the workspace type feel during the day has an easy informality which is likeable, and overall it represents the best of the mainstream options in town. (Added October 2022)

name: The Baum
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good range of local and regional cask ales with a perfectly competent back bar for alternatives. Weak keg options however compensated for by strong can and bottle selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Revivalist pub with niches, raised areas, mirrors and antique signage. Plush red upholstered seats and old-world ornaments with wood fittings around the bar and side areas. A bland conservatory dining area to the rear.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beautifully atmospheric busy or quiet due to the duskiness created by the old-world decor. You'll find a cosy sport without fail. In the autumn and winter months the hubbub around the bar area creates a special feeling that is one of the key reasons to visit.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Meals, jukebox, snacks, community events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable for the area, while not competing with chain pubs like Wetherspoons

description: A true gem, to call this the best pub in Rochdale is somewhat of an understatement. It blows the rest out of the water. A true labour of love fitted out in a revivalist old-world pub style with raised areas and niches, large mirrors and antique signage, along with that typical textured ceiling. Good quality local ales with CAMRA discounts available, community events and meals available later in the week. Simply unmissable if you're going anywhere near the town and have time on hand. (added October 2022)

name: The Old Post Office Ale House
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local cask ales with some craft keg + middle-brow continental lagers.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A converted Post Office still displaying some of its old signage. A one room affair with pool able to the back and bookshelf near the front. Bar is on the left as you enter. Simple beg/borrow/steal DIY type furnishings with a mixture of brick and wood strip on the walls.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very much a locals hangout spot by day, with a slightly more diverse audience later on. Friendly and conversational as well as dog friendly. Music at a background volume.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pool table, books, board games, loyalty card, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value, more so still with the CAMRA discount offered and loyalty card.

description: A local micropub serving a similarly local suburban crowd. The average age during the day is veering towards the elderly but it does get more diverse later on. Friendly with plenty of social conversation and banter across the tables, the combination of social value with amenities like books, board games, music and pool create a pub that may feel quite DIY in execution but does feel to all intents and purposes like a proper boozer. (added October 2022)

name: The Meanwood Tavern
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer focus with regional cask and keg offerings along with European classics. Reasonably well stocked bar of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A recent redesign following inheriting the site from a previous operation. Art Deco with sweeping dark green, stylish carpet and upholstered seating with globe lamps lining the walls, somewhat similar to a cinema bar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The new look venue feels warmer and cosier with its carpets, curtains and dark green. Already a popular fixture across a range of ages and backgrounds.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Street food vendor, community events, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Nothing out of the ordinary for Leeds or Meanwood, but definitely seeking the upper end of the market.

description: A new creation from the team behind Leeds' Whitelock's and Turk's Head. Marketed as a 'modern pub', the environment feels more retro than modern, with its sweeping art deco, dark green ceiling and curtains, globe lamps and backlit signage. The carpeting has created a cosier loungey space somewhat akin to a good cinema bar. Distinctive and already busy and popular, not least due to the good range of beer on offer. Worth the trip out, particularly with some other bars only a short walk away. (Added October 2022)

name: The Carriage
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Several local cask ales, small fridge of 'craft' cans and a decent stocked back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An old station building, this is played on inside with some signage and artwork referencing it. Tiled floors, heritage photography, leather upholstered bench seating and traditional lounge space.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmospheric quiet or busy due to the history of the building, fixtures and fittings and general ambience.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Books, jukebox, games machine, TV, snacks, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Not the cheapest in the city, that's for sure.

description: A little gem hidden away around some modern developments, this building used to house the ticket office and waiting rooms at Jesmond station. Repurposed tastefully and with some panache, the place feels both classical and relevant, with local beers, plenty of amenities and an easy going atmosphere that makes it worth relaxing on afternoons, while still being able to up the tempo later on. Well worth the walk from the centre. (Added November 2022)

name: Bridge Hotel
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Local ales are the standout here, with an otherwise mainstream selection, albeit a broad, well-stocked one.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A classic city tavern with leather upholstered bench seats in turn of the 20th century style surroundings. Original tiles and fittings, spread along a long ground floor space, with small seating around out the back. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A clear sense of 'institution' about it. The place can be deserted but still feel like one of the pillars of the city's nightlife. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
TV, jukebox, live events, outdoor seating, snacks, basic food, lodgings

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: One of the city's core institutions, the Bridge Hotel is a heritage pub with turn of the century faded glamour that can be seen from its facade, to the interior fixtures and tiling in the bathrooms. It is no dusty relic, however, as central footfall ensures a steady trade, its reliability pitted in its good range of real ales, sporting fixtures on TV and palatial space to socialise and accommodate large groups. Overall well worth marking down as an option. (Added November 2022)

name: The Cumberland Arms
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local ales, compact cocktail menu and decent spirits selection. Perfunctory alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Two-room boozer set at the end of a sidestreet. Perched on a slope overlooking a stream. Striking facade with yellow signage and leaded windows. Inside, leather bench seating and a spit n sawdust feel. The bar opens out into each of the two rooms.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Sleepy in the afternoons but comes to life later on. Local life is augmented by those coming to see the live music.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live music, snacks, outdoor seating, events.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Not great value given the location but not outrageous either - to be expected for what is a regional institution.

description: A well-known and well-reputed neighbourhood pub famous for its live music, local ales and spit n sawdust atmosphere. Somewhat detached from the centre, it can feel peaceful in the afternoons, if a little too quiet at times. At night you'll find it hard to believe there are many better places you could be. (Added November 2022)

name: Tynemouth Lodge Hotel
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
A couple of local real ales and a traditional selection of beers and spirits outside of that, catering for the older audience mainly.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beautiful kiln-fired ceramic tiled exterior that is so well preserved and so now so out of date it looks like it has arrived by time machine. Enter to find a bunker with frosted windows, detailed Victorian style wallpaper and framed artwork. Long communal bench seating.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Old fashioned with a cast of regulars and couples who visit as the evening progresses. It is too busy and too pleasant to feel out of time, but you also get the sense this won't last unless they draw in a new audience.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Limited outdoor seating, snacks, pub cat

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing out of the ordinary.

description: An iconic exterior deserves an interior to match. All too often that isn't the case, and the inside has been gutted. Here, typically detailed fussy Victorian wallpaper, lamp lights, framed mirrors and long bench seats decorate what is a brooding boozer, prettifying what would otherwise be a 'battleship'. Local ales, a pub cat, fireplace and an intimate spot removed from the outside world to forget your troubles. (Added November 2022)

name: Low Lights Tavern
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local ales plus an outpost for Bass on cask. Perfunctory alternatives, although there are some superior wines.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A low-ceilinged dockside tavern with white painted walls, lamplight and simple seating. The bar area is dedicate for drinkers although everywhere has limited space. The room to the left of the entrance has a fireplace, piano and folk instruments.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A slightly uneasy balance between the food service they need to survive and the fact the venue is, or rather should be a very simple wet-led pub for socialising and folk music. That said, with local life and a cast of regulars around the bar, this remains an intimate pub with a social scene.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, limited outdoor seating, snacks, live music

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing notable.

description: A historic dockside pub that has also acquired recent fame through Sam Fender working there before becoming some sort of pop star. Meals are served in what should be content to be a boozer, and the table set for food do subtract a little from the overall ambience, but with a fireplace and piano, bar area dominated by locals and decent ales on tap, you could do far worse than give this cosy, low-ceilinged place a try. (Added November 2022)

name: The Steamboat
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good range of cask ales, which shouldn't be surprising but is worth pointing out. Well stocked bar bar including whiskies.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Distinctive preserved wood fittings. Enter to find an angle bar area with rich aged reds and browns leading to back areas on different levels. Each part of the pub is decorated with nautical chintz and local heritage. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Exuding charm and character, you could happily sit here solo and quietly enjoy the patina of quality this place has acquired over the years. However, it is also a living breathing concern with local life and a loyal cast of regulars.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Normal for the area

description: Check the preserved exterior and the hugely distinctive interior of the Steamboat which exudes history and character. This is no museum to old time pubs either, its clearly a living breathing ongoing concern. This is without doubt a classic, one of the highlights of the region and a reason in and of itself to visit South Shields. Adding to the nautical theme is the option to arrive via the Tyne Ferry from North Shields, only a 7 minute journey. One of the best pubs in England. (Added November 2022)

name: The Wobbly Duck
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Up to date contemporary cask and keg choices for craft ale, with an emphasis on local offerings, with whiskies too.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Small basement bar with barrel cutouts decorating the ceiling inventively and further barrels acting as tables. You won't fit too many people in the place.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
With the natural colours and basement setting there is a pleasant organic intimacy which a lot of craft ale houses either miss or seem to have no awareness of. This places Wobbly Duck above the norm.

Amenities/Events: ❤️
Snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
City centre prices, it doesn't come cheap, but it is not extortionate for the quality.

description: A casual basement craft ale bar decorated tastefully but with a degree of invention too. The beer options are of course excellent and varied, if expensive, but the use of space and intimate basement setting does genuinely elevate the place above many craft ale houses where such matters are an afterthought or worse, not a thought at all. Credit where it's due. This is a goody, go here. (Added November 2022)

name: Birch Hall Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Limited but good quality local cask ales with perfunctory alternatives. Occasional local produce like fruit juice.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Unspoilt little pub based in a whitewashed stone cottage. Tiny bar area with almost more pumps than seats, and a lounge with a hatch. There is a sweetshop counter in between. All 3 accessible from separate doors. Rustic and homely with fireplace and cushioned seating.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Truly intimate and special, the sort of place that starts conversations going. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Sandwiches, pies and snacks, sweet shop, outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Considering the remote location, fair.

description: One of England's one-off's, a surviving country inn still running a sweet shop as well as a pub. Three little rooms each accessible from individual doorways, this charming and unique family-run cottage serves local ales, very basic butties, pork pies, snacks, sweets and occasionally locally made produce like juices. Inside the pub it is very cosy and intimate, a social space that's exciting, out of time and an instant conversation starter. As the proprietor says himself, on average 3 times a day he'll hear someone say the words ' Never change'. Three cheers to that! (Added November 2022)

name: Jolly Sailors Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
The stock Sam Smiths selection but with the handpulled cask bitter.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Traditional two room pub with leather-upholstered bar room and cosier lounge, albeit both with real fires. Upstairs dining room. Decorated with local art and nautical themes including the distinctive lamps.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A popular dockside pub which can fill up quickly with less space than it may appear. Unlike many pubs in this stable it has somewhat of a distinctive life of its own, untamed by the owner's draconian rules.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Meals, snacks available

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Although not as good value as previously, still overall fair prices.

description: WARNING: Sam Smiths Pub

That aside, the Jolly Sailors is a cosy riverside pub with two small rooms and real fires. Traditional with beams and upholstered seating, there is a positive social atmosphere here in spite of the owner's draconian rules. It is a place to pop into for a drink, have a chat and enjoy the warmth and social scene in a pub that has a democratic spread of people from locals to tourists. (Added November 2022)

name: Black Horse Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A decent range covering several bases from cask ales and some limited (but at least present) craft options to the back bar with spirits and mixers.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A narrow two room pub that is small and intimate. Red leather upholstered seats, pokey bar room and 2nd bar opposite what is ostensibly the lounge. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Having retained table service following Covid, this now becomes something of a novelty. In a small space like theirs it works quite well. You will be seen, seated and served quickly. Once that's sorted out the atmosphere is similar to any other, albeit without standing at the bar, which does lose the place a point or two for dynamism.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Yorkshire tapas, basic meals, snacks, occasional events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
On the higher end for the town

description: An unspoilt little pub surviving on a touristy thoroughfare almost in plain sight. You'll still find the typical poky little bar rooms, red leather upholstered seats and excitable chat as a mixture of tourists and locals take the seats. Yorkshire tapas compliments a reasonable selection of beers and alternatives. Table service has remained even following Covid which may require a little patience at the door. After that the dynamics are fairly similar just with a conspicuous lack of patrons standing at the bar. Outside of that it is an enjoyable, distinctive pub worth a visit to while in the town. There are a core of naysayers which seems to stem from Covid conspiracism, ignore them. (Added November 2022)

name: The Quirky Den
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A contemporary ale house selection with some savvy traditional choices, often including Theakston Old Peculier From The Wood.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A rickety rustic frontage leads to a slightly plainer interior with the bar directly to the left of the door. There is an upstairs, somewhat of an overflow.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Intimate, as many micropubs can be, and fairly cosy. Dogs only allowed downstairs which can be overbearing.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, occasional events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
'Town prices', so not outrageous but the usual modern ale house pricing.

description: A little ale house serving an attractive selection of modern and traditional beers including from local breweries, with a decently stocked bar for alternatives. The key to the place is its size, compact and intimate, good for socialising and meeting strangers. The decor could use a little more distinction, and the downstairs can be too dog-heavy at times but it has to be recommended overall (Added November 2022)

name: The Waiting Room
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Typical contemporary ale house choices with local cask, craft keg and some European bottles. Beer focused.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Repurposed train station waiting room, compact but with a high ceiling. Beer and train ephemera, as could be predicted.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Friendly and social despite the inherently transient nature of such places, it is a place you could stay for longer, make your local and get to know people.

Amenities/Events: ❤️
Snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Town prices, nothing out of the ordinary.

description: A successful repurposed train station waiting room turned ale house, with a well chosen range of beers covering several basis and pleasant environment mixing the two themes sympathetically. Well worth a visit on any go around Whitby's drinking holes. (Added November 2022)

name: Holly Bush Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A range of beers that would shame some venues in cities, quite far beyond what is normally on offer in village venues. A range of classic and regional/local cask ales accompanied by craft keg and superior lagers and bottles. Limited cider options, and decent back bar for alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
17th century stone inn with low ceilings, stone walls, 3 fireplaces kept lit in winter. There is a small bar room a snug to the reverse of the bar, larger backroom and tasteful extension to the rear of the building albeit an overflow area, with a hatch to the bar. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Supremely characterful 'if these walls could talk' venue that has a good range of customers even on slow November Monday afternoons, and can be heaving to oversubscribed at other times of day and year. Very social and extremely cosy, one of the most atmospheric venues in the country.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Meals, light pub food, snacks, music nights, community events, rooms, books, outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for a village pub, certainly considering its fame.

description: The 'Moon Under Water' idyll really does exist and it is here in the Amber Valley in Derbyshire. An atmosphere of warmth and contentment through its rhythm and ritual, warm natural fittings, social setup which naturally encourages conversation between strangers and neighbouring groups. A stone cottage set off from a country lane, quiet and in a scene that is almost farcically quintessentially English from the manicured village scenes right down to the cars blocking the view. Inside you'll find exposed beams from low ceilings, a small bar room with bar facing a large fireplace and bench seating around the sides. To the rear of the bar is a tiny snug with an excellent fireplace and settles. Down the corridor is a larger pub room with a further fire that is in itself a very nice place to sit. An extension has been made to the rear of the building for further overflow which is tastefully done and in keeping with the overall pub. All 3 fires are roaring in the colder months even on quieter Mondays. The place is dry, warm and cosy. But there's more to it still. Customer-focused food, not corporate profiteering, meaning you can get portions to suit your needs. Several main dishes are served as small portions, there are pub snacks like pies and rolls and they deal with any gradient of hunger. The food isn't dominant as you typically find in rural pubs these days. Tables aren't set, there is no background clutter of cutlery or catering smell. They aren't religious about final orders at 2.30pm (even though it is best not to take the mickey). It keeps going. The ales for a rural pub are impressive. Typical classics complimented by several local and regional cask ales, craft keg with one or two raising an eyebrow - not craft beer bar standard but would shame many city pubs. Prices are all fair given the location and fame for the place. After all this it seems a pointless addendum to mention Dick Turpin, and the association of the highwayman to this place, but if you want to find out more, they'll tell you. It is far from essential to enjoy a pub of this quality. One of the best in England. Visit at once. (Added 2022)

name: Dead Poets Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cask ale and real cider focus, both have a range far superior to the norm for village pubs. Occasional festivals.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Modern quirky signage on a rural stone cottage. Inside typical low ceilings, exposed stone and beams with fireplaces and niches. An extension area to the rear.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Distinctive and quirky attracting hikers and lovers of good beer and cider. A core of regulars even on a damp Monday in November is a very good sign. If that is the general low bar then this is a very good pub.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Light pub food, snacks, outdoor seating, occasional festivals, music nights

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for money at the time of writing, particularly for a rural pub.

description: A standout distinctive village pub with a drinks focus, with superior cask ales and ciders available and offered to compliment what is a social pub rather than a dining room. An attractive stone cottage houses what is an unspoilt rustic interior with fireplace and niches, decorated with poetry commemorating previous regulars. Quite a find in an otherwise unassuming, albeit pretty village. (Added November 2022)

name: Thorn Tree Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Bass on cask, a few regional cask ale options, basic lagers and back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Wedge shaped pub with distinctive revived frontage. Inside, this lends itself to bench seating which widens to a bar. There is a snug rear bar area and games area up the stairs to the back.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Local life, this is a steady walk out of the town centre and serves its neighbourhood catchment. Ale House feel, with a male dominated middle aged contingency, but not totally dominant.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Dartboard, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for the area

description: Sneaking on our guide, this neighbourhood pub offers local life in a social but not intimidating setup, good Bass on cask, darts and is hosted in a distinctive wedge shaped building on a tight corner. With some personalisation in the decoration there is enough comfort, quality and social appeal to recommend it. (Added November 2022)

name: Bohemia Jazz Café
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A range of sweet-edged cocktails, gins and middling beer bottle selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beautiful bookish Jazz cafe with warm hues, artwork and shelves, along with musical ephemera. A bit of a bunker layout, windowless with a bar area leading to a lower lounge. Two pianos next to the bar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brooding, private, and a feeling of an experience. More Bohemian and social than staid and grand though, it's still a pub at its core.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live music shows, books, games, snacks, events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little higher than average but still well within reasonable margins.

description: One of Europe's great Jazz Bars, this also dips into golden age ephemera as a decoration, along with a collection of books and niknaks lining the walls. Bunker-like layout without windows adds to the intimacy of the experience, along with the booze which is largely centred around sweet-edged cocktails. A male duo arrange the service in a rather personal, kind and slightly effete manner. Once seated the experience is woozy good fun surrounded by things to look at and music to experience. A highlight of the city. (Added November 2022)

name: Taberna Cofrade Las Merchanas
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A broad suite of typical Spanish offerings from beer, fortified wines, normal wines, spirits and mixers.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
The highlight of the venue, a cornucopia of Easter Parade ephemera, Catholic kitsch and mind-boggling artefacts decked along the walls. There are two parts, the bar to the left and the taberna to the right, which are quite different, the latter being tiled and a little closer to an ordinary taberna.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Hugely characterful with incense burning and a looped soundtrack of marching brass band music, popular and social with plenty of people chatting at the bar itself.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Tapas, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little higher for the area but not out of any reasonable margin.

description: A characterful brilliant bar dedicated to the Easter Parades and adorned with serious and quirky Catholic kitsch, intense atmosphere with burning incense and brass band music. The bar is to the left of the entrance with a tiled taberna to the right for more formal sit-down meals. Very popular and queues may emerge for the restaurant side. A must visit while in Malaga. (Added November 2022)

name: Antigua Casa de Guardia
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A dozen plus barrels of fortified wine from the familiar (Vermut, Pedro Ximenez) to the not so familiar (Pajarete, Malaga Cream) with basic alternatives (bottled lager). It's all about the wine.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Historic and preserved, one long room with sets of large barrels behind the bar, a wooden counter and tiled interior. A small kiosk for offsales near one entrance.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A local institution with all that entails. Service has a rhythm and ritual with bills written in chalk on the counter and bells frequently ringing for changes of shift and barrels. Standing room along a natural social space works brilliantly.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited tapas dishes and finger food, off-sales.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Good value for money albeit smaller servings.

description: A historic local institution that will appear in every guide book, for good reason, as you will not find a venue quite like it. Well worn and characterful, this one room with two entrances is effectively a tasting room for various fortified wines. Bills are drawn up in chalk on a wooden counter and people gather around to drink and chat. While there is a tourist trade, in the off season this is very well balanced with local life too. The service has a tradition and rhythm with smart shirts and bell rings adding to the feeling of ceremony. A couple of vermouths will set you back a few euros at most. A must visit. (Added November 2022)

name: La Casa Invisible
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Very simple kiosk style drinks - bottled beer, box vermouth, soft drinks, etc. See below for why.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A courtyard beneath a commune decorated by local artists. A fountain with a clutch of tall trees and some awnings. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Due to the nature of the venue there is an ad hoc, alternative nature but with its popularity this is tempered by the range of locals who visit.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Community events, live music, outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for the basic offerings.

description: La Casa Invisible is a cultural centre and commune in dispute with the city administration, and assisting others fighting eviction.
