A little higher than normal but still in line when considering the free popcorn and rarity of Croatian craft on offer.
description: If you're staying in Zagreb old town and enjoy any one of the following: free popcorn, multitap craft beer, buzzy social scene, music, sport on TV, then this place may be for you. Blending a number of things together without there being a clash or becoming overly bland is a skill and one that's been executed well at Kvazar. There's nothing wrong with being the venue people have 'up their sleeve' as an answer to 'where next?'. We enjoyed both our visits, but bear in mind it is quite small so seating is never guaranteed. (Added April 2023)

name: Air Cafe
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Extensive rum collection is the focus with cocktails and mixers, but being Czechia, there are beers too, including one from a small brewery. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
RAF/Anthropoid themed celebrating Czech and Britain cooperation in World War two. A white room with a high ceiling and cabinets leads to a 2nd side room with loungier feel.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A more upright and formal place than most Brno bars but still welcoming. The decor and surroundings represent a distinctive enough and welcome departure from the norm.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Food, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
City centre prices plus cocktail bar prices, but overall reasonable fair. 
description: Located in a 17th century palace, this complex hosts several institutions, one being a Museum, one being this interesting curio. Decorated to celebrate the co-operation of the British and Czechs in WWII, there is plenty of ephemera from the era to look at. Drinks wise, Rum and cocktails dominate but Pivo is never far away, and their offerings are sound there too. Service is welcoming and friendly, so you should consider a visit here as a departure from the typical places. (Added April 2023)

name: Jan Olbracht Browar Staromiejski
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brewpub operation which churns out some reliable unfiltered lagers along with some more adventurous stuff, occasionally available on tap and bottles. Decent selection of alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Well-financed complex tastefully making use of historic premises, accentuating natural brick, black beams with effective lighting and some quirky touches such as the barrel recesses opposite the bar. Brewkit with neon signage draws the eye from the main room.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Typical brewpub crowd due to its versatility, but it treads a nice line, neither shiny and sterile or dog eared and tired. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
On-site brewery, meals, snacks, outdoor seating, TV
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
City centre prices, nothing offensive but certainly predictably pitched.
description: A brewpub generally offers a reliable experience, formats and templates ranging from craft industrial chic and street food vans to the traditional wooden beer halls with communal tables. Embracing the modern and traditional is not a line many tread, but when well-executed, it can work well, as here. The exterior doesn't stand out beyond being located in  Torun old town's historic Hanseatic buildings, but inside it's clear considerable finance has been lavished on it, with blackened wood fittings and muted lighting tastefully straddling new and old without any hint of a conflict. Quirky features like recessed barrel shaped seating opposite the bar and a complex of rooms emphasise creativity and importance. The brewkit is positioned at the entrance with neon signage and you'll be shown to a table at busier times. The food and drink is reasonably up to date, with some creative offerings as well as the traditional lagers available, there's plenty to get stuck into here. (Added April 2023)

name: Karczma
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
A broad, if shallow range of pale lagers on tap with a broader and somehow still shallow range of pale lagers and radlers in the fridge. Perfunctory alternatives (liqueurs, vodka, etc) available.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A shack isolated around the train tracks and modern urban sprawl. Interior is traditional rustic 'Karczma' style with country heritage decorated around wooden fitting and niches. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Extremely unusual for Warsaw let alone the downtown, a throwback with an elderly operation. There's something special about the fact this is such a survivor whether you happen to like the decoration or the beers. True local life, and not all old crusties either, with the beer garden attracting younger people in the known.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, shop, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Excellent value for money for central Warsaw, even bearing in mind basic wares. 

description: A true survivor, the owners of the glass towers overshadowing this tiny old shack probably see it every day and dream of nuking it from orbit. This itself makes it a charming venue, even a cult one. There is nothing on the approach except an extremely unprepossessing cabin, but on entry you will see what the fuss is about. This old-timer pub has an elderly owner, local legend, Karczma style rustic interior and churns out tap lager and Polish pub food (Sausage, Pierogi, etc) for pennies. Attracting a young crowd for the value and the beer garden, and old crusties for a taste of the land that time forgot, this is not going to be everyone's cup of tea to say the least, but it is authentic, and in a world where authenticity is bleeding out of the universe, one to treasure for its simple charms and forgive its trespasses. (Added April 2023)

name: Buffet Trzesniewski Dorotheergasse
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Other than the cafe bar selections, the place is about the Pfiff, 0.15l pour of beer to wash down their sandwiches.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A 1970s era soup kitchen with an effective, fairly faithful retro refit. Entrance directly off a pedestrian street into a canteen style atmosphere with deli counter and some seating + high tables to the right. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Unlike most bars you could visit, and the sense of excitement gives the place a perhaps unexpected buzz. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Sandwiches, snacks, limited outdoor space
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing out of the ordinary for the area.
description: One of Vienna's iconic venues, this is a particular format and set up which places it apart from other pubs and bars. You could perhaps stay no longer than 5 minutes, but that's almost not the point. A Polish canteen serving finger sandwiches with a Pfiff, a tiny 0.15l of beer to wash it down, this is a snack bar but also a social meeting point with an excitable buzz and rhythm of service which is eye-catching. You can just as easily make an hour of it in there returning for further sandwiches and beer while chatting on a high table or the limited seats to the side of the room. A Vienna classic, a bar but not quite as you know it. (Added April 2023)

name: Tanzcafe Jenseits
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Bases covered, but not an overly eye-catching selection of drinks.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Vampy, red, boudoir like and more than a touch camp in that familiar Germanic way. One of its strong suits.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A strong social buzz with an international crowd and a sense that this is certainly a place where, let's say, things happen.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Occasional live events, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️
Pretty poor value for money overall, you might find yourself looking up and down the menu a few times to see if there's a way not to be rinsed - there isn't.
description: A former brothel, the decision to maintain a boudoir type appearance makes perfect sense, and you'll find the atmosphere buzzy, social early on, sliding imperceptibly towards sleazy as the night goes on. The absence of a 'corporate' lounge bar feel and  slithering sense of weirdness that flits in and out provides a kind of lurid allure that overcomes more obvious objections towards its gouging pricing and tackiness. It squeaks onto our guide. (Added April 2023)

name: The Churchill
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Well stocked bar with a sizeable cocktail selection and easy enough atmosphere for alternatives to be offered without much complaint. Cocktails themselves are very good.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A rather bizarre effort, all told, of creating an exclusive English gentleman's club vibe while sporting diverting - not in the right way - artwork of Princess Diana and other odd selections. Still, the rooms layout and lighting are nice..
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good local atmosphere, post-grad crowd with a mixture of some older generations. Friendly and not particularly stuffy.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, books
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Pricing is generally in accordance with the going rate and the quality of drinks, but not especially great value.
description: An atmospheric little bar undone a little in its over-indulgence of the concept, but effective enough in its English club type decor and its friendly, unpretentious crowd. The cocktails are produced promptly to a high standard and the venue benefits from a natural U Shape which provides a gathering at the bar and some nice nooks to sit in for a quieter time. Overall it just about squeaks onto our guide. (Added April 2023)

name: Ambasada -Wine, Beer & Spirits Store
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
For beer, the fridge options are about as good as it gets in the entire country. Several tap options are a bonus in what is a bottleshop-cum- bar.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Typically unexciting bottleshop type decor, enter to find the bar in the far corner with seating along a row of shelves. More bar-like than initially suspected, it is a half-and-half.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A friendly young crowd as could be predicted, here is a place where you could strike up some conversations with English speakers
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, takeaway options
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair considering the quality of wares.
description: Sometimes craft venues can veer towards the stark and sterile, and it takes a hell of a good social scene and a hell of a good beer roster to elevate them. Ambasada has a clear 'beer crowd' social scene and is a place where you could easily strike up a friendly conversation with the staff or the regulars. This is not any kind of cold or corporate operation. Painted in warm amber and black, it is half bottle shop and half bar, with a truly superb Fridge selection we are sure competes anywhere in Europe, not for exhaustive choice but for the selection representing each style, which is of the highest quality, with around 8 or so taps too. If you enjoy beer then it is clear you would end up here regardless of externalities but it is nice to know that it is not just a row of beers in a sterile environment, but a reasonably nice place to hangout. (Added April 2023)

name: Jazz cafe
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A typical Croatian caffe bar range accentuated with a limited offering of Croatian craft beers.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Clearly a labour of love for the owner, this lounge bar has been pimped up with some eye catching Jazz era fittings and decorations, it is more than just a sign on the front, that's for sure. Covered terrace leads to the tiny bar space itself.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A calm and pleasant place to be
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, smoking permitted, outdoor seating, books
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Despite the suburban location, not a cheap place really, though the prices remain familiar with the city in general.
description: Out in Jarun near the swimming lake you'll find a Caffe Bar that, for a change, has decided to create a distinctive and interesting space. Jazz era decor and some memorabilia from what appears to be a Water Polo medallist, a retirement age owner potters about serving while you can enjoy the comparatively unusual surroundings, as well as a few beers that you wouldn't necessarily expect to find in such a place. (Added April 2023)

name: Swanky Monkey Garden
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A modern, if mainstream selection covering most bases.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Enter a courtyard into a complex including a hostel, with the bar at the far side up a set of stairs into a tiered beer garden with indoor area. Modern, eclectic and fun, if a little corporate in design.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A distinctive bar for a city lacking such venues, with a pleasant courtyard in summer heaters in winter decked out in an unusual tiered way. A young, fairly fun format.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Rooms, meals, snacks, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little more than typical for the city centre, though nothing out of the ordinary.
description: Silly name, and quirky concept, a tiered beer garden at the back of an old complex turned into a hostel and funky, smart bar. You can sit by the heaters in colder months or enjoy either the shaded cover or blazing sunshine in summer. Indoors the quirky but sleek look continues, overall the feel is young and hip, with a broad range of drinks acknowledging its relevant, if mainstream audience. There is enough going on overall to recommend a visit and it certainly is different for Zagreb overall. (Added April 2023)

name: The Garden Brewery
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
On-site brewery specialising in sours, IPAs and strong dark beers, but the range is wide. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Large sprawling premises with a large greenhouse housing the brewing equipment, with tall plants and a rather familiar modern interior with street food vans. Large outdoor area too.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A little too cavernous for its own good at quieter times but the place is friendly and welcoming enough.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Street food vans, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Given the fairly removed location, there is not much discount on offer drinking this from source.
description: A tram ride out here marks it as a destination venue. On arrival you'll see the huge premises across a strip of wasteland, and on entry through a large beer garden you'll be impressed by the big greenhouse and atrium housing the brewing equipment, the tall plants complimenting the surroundings. The rest is quite familiar, a clean modern multitap premises with street food vendors. It is a surprise they don't offer flights given the number of taps, and it has a fundamental lack of 'loveability' in its largely unwavering adherence to the craft genre. Overall though, when factoring in the quality of their brewing produce, the interesting premises and suitability for visiting with large groups, it has to be included. (Added April 2023)

name: Caffe bar Croatia
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A not terrible selection, better than the environment may suggest, at least, with some Czech lager complimenting the typical Croatian caffe bar fare, a decent back bar too.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A surprisingly nice little personalised drinking hole that has been decorated in a traditional rustic Krcma style, with a few bits and piece to look at. A small place with some high stools and ledges, with a loungier area near the telly.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Truly local and way, way off the beaten path, here is where to go if you want an authentic experience. Regulars sit around exchanging banter with a young server, with a TV and music cutting in between the chatter. Totally unpretentious and surprisingly not overly hostile either. After a few seconds surprise life continues back to normal.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, smoking permitted, TV, limited outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A fair price here, perhaps it could be a little cheaper for being so far out of the way, but it is still fair. 
description: Any venue in Croatia that pays attention to the finer aspects of a bar - the decor, the environment, while still retaining a degree of authenticity immediately stands out. It took a while of trawling to find this place and we're glad we did. It isn't so much about the wow factor but about the unusually rustic decor and completely unvarnished local life which may produce initial surprise at your arrival but is friendly and tolerant, aided by young staff that are unabashed. TV plays, music is on, smoking is raw and the atmosphere even mid afternoon rattles along at a reasonable lick while you pour your next Budvar. (Added April 2023)

name: Radniční sklípek
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A suite of Svijany's beers from various styles on tap including 2 from the tank unpasteurised, and basic alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A one-off, cellar location in the remarkable Liberec town hall. Cloistered ceilings, stained glass and a grand Ratskeller appearance.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Beer Hall atmosphere, with lunch service and evening rhythms slightly differing, but certainly more of a pub-restaurant than a communal piss-palace.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, child-friendly
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Given the location reasonable value daily menu and the beer prices aren't extortionate either.
description: An opulent 'Ratskeller' that evokes just a hint of the images of the late 19th century high period of brewing and consumption, beautifully restored in the cellar of the fabulous Liberec town hall. Cloistered ceiling, stained glass and a grandeur that makes the venue a one off. This is supplemented by a full range of Svijany's beer on tap including 2 tank options, one of which is the very pleasant '450'. It is a 'pub restaurant' rather than a communal drinking Schwemme but nevertheless, there is an unmistakeable quality of pubbyness and the down-to-earth Czech character avoids it becoming overly stuffy too. While it would be nice to have a schanke or social area, there is enough going on to ensure this just squeaks onto our guide. (Added April 2023)

name: Fort Colomb
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A familiar set of drinks from the mainstream, the best may be a couple of fridge options but otherwise expect the last 20 years of the craft scene to go underepresented.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Interesting location in an old fort, a bunker location adds another element to the traditional basement venue. However, there is also a terrace popular in summer by a pond and park. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Due to its proximity to the train station there is always a hint of transient custom during the day before it livens up later on. With a roaring fire this place is a cosy winter bunker as well as a summer terrace, showing its versatility.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
TV, outdoor seating, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fair prices, not bad considering the plum location. 
description: Colomb fort was all destroyed in 1903 except for this bunker which has since been renovated and turned into a pub. The unusual shape of the building adds further to the brick basement bar atmosphere inside, which is improved with a roaring fireplace in winter months. Outside you'll find a nice terrace close to the park and pond, the whole thing conveniently minutes away from the train station terminal. Drinks are middling but overall the place just - just - hits the mark. (Added April 2023)

name: Deer Bear Pub - Craft Beer Place
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A de facto taproom for Deer Bear brewery which dominates the taps but with plenty of selection of alternatives when factoring in the fridge. Beer focus.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A long room fits a long bar area with seating opposite. Decor is relatively natural, if plain with some of the buildings historic features visible.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Friendly sociable local, slightly lacking a natural focal point and communal area.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, books, boardgames
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable value when accounting for the quality of produce and selection available.
description: Beer specialists, this de facto brewery taproom offers locally brewed beers focusing on IPAs and sours along with plenty of alternatives. The interior is based in a historic venue which helps add a little bit to an otherwise plain and a little bit muted interior. That said, the atmosphere is friendly and social, but the shape of the room makes it more difficult to have that natural social communal intimacy, and will probably always hold the place back a little. It just squeaks onto our guide all things considered. (Added April 2023)

name: 07 PRL Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
A basic range aimed at a value conscious target market and in keeping with the PRL theme.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
PRL nostalgia fest with decoration from the 60s-80s socialist era. Don't think it's all about the main room, the upstairs is far larger and arguably has more of the decor to look at.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing much happening during the afternoon but as it fills up the point of the bar suddenly seems to become apparent. 1st floor overlooking Lodz's famous Piotrkowska street is a nice way to enjoy the socialist era nostalgia.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, museum exhibits, snacks, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Deliberately budget range to fit in with the PRL theme, also due to the overlap of their target markets interest.
description: Nostalgia is big business and Poland more than most ex-Iron Curtain countries has dived deep into their past to unearth that which was quaint or worth salvaging. Most cities have at least one PRL themed bar and here is Lodz'. Don't be fooled by the front room, far more is evident upstairs where an ensemble of furnishings and decor from 60s-80s era Poland is well put together and overlooks the main cultural street in Lodz. Try to visit later as it can be too quiet in the afternoon. (Added April 2023)

name: Piwoteka Narodowa
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Top quality Polish craft beer including some cask pumps, extremely rare in continental Europe. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Modern, smart, open plan with a dark grey, decorated with some nice breweriana. Furnishing is spread out meaning there is a lack of social focal point.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A welcoming open plan meeting point, but definitely on a more corporate level, everything aimed at lack of offensive or conflict rather than distinctive identitity.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
City centre prices but fair for the quality of produce
description: Beer specialists in a venue that may primarily be designed to avoid offence or conflict rather than to delight or be different, but the quality of produce is terrific with an array of taps including cask pumps (very rare in continental Europe) and a general quality of finish that hits the mark. A reasonably large bar - if personal space is your thing there's plenty on offer here. A friendly social crowd of beer lovers both casual and geeky use the venue as a reliable bolthole, with food, outdoor seating and a central location proving a winner. While aspects of the bar are undoubtedly quite dull, it just squeaks over the line onto our guide. (added April 2023)

name: Pardubická pivnice u Járy
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Several taps of beer (which is the main event)  stock back bar options

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A classic old boozer, survivor with blackened wood, red table clothes, tinted glass. Pub is fairly open plan with table around the edges.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A great 'winter pub', with radiators blasting out and occasionally folk music singalongs. Attracting an international crowd with a friendly server always willing to oblige.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, occasional live music, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for the area.

description: A long time haunt, and a slow burner that has taken us years to admit to the guide. There's really no reason why it shouldn't have. A battered old survivor that stands out in today's market, and for years served beer from the now shuttered Pardubice brewery, including an 8% porter for pennies. Apart from the beers don't expect much else to change here, with friendly service, hearty pub grub. It's a warm, cosy wintery place, like getting a hug from your auntie. (Added April 2023)

name: To się wytnie
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A basic selection of mainstream Polish ales and lagers compliments mixers and cocktails
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A fun almost unmarked exterior, try the knackered white door and you'll enter a small pub with some new agey artwork hanging on the walls, casual furniture and a small bar room to your right.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
With live events and a clandestine feel you're assure an atmospheric evening here, with a friendly arty, alternative crowd to boot.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live events, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for money considering the music
description: Finding truly alternative venues in Warsaw is a little tricky even after several days of research, but here is a bar that hosts live music and cultural events in an unmarked location (unless you count Google). Enter a plain white door that looks like the entrance to a squat to find out what all the swirly noises you can hear are. Inside, there may be a band playing, or setting up, or being cheered off. A little bar pumps out the necessary bottled beers, mixers, cheap wine and cocktails. A refreshing change from the usual Warsaw format, one to go to if you are more comfortable in informal, unglamorous places, particularly if you are seeking some live performances. (Added April 2023)

name: Bockshorn Irish Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Typical Irish pub offerings but don't think that's all that's available. For a small cramped bar there is a very decent beer offer complimented by a wide selection of whiskies. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
On the exterior, a so far so familiar, with Irish signage, but enter to find a remarkably small little bathtub of a pub covered from wall to ceiling in collections from the owner's visits to Ireland. The way it has been created is really something that goes beyond the typical Irish ex-pat concept.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Not only characterful in appearance but buzzy, lively, relevant feeling, a huddle created due to its tiny size, a sense that a new conversation (or even romance?) may be only a tap of the shoulder away.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, limited outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Unsurprisingly, you'll encounter city centre prices, but just about acceptable given location and the special nature of the venue.
description: Created in 1991, this 'Irish Pub' surpasses the confines and expectations typical of such a theme. Firstly and most obviously, the place is tiny. On entrance you'll find a crowded bar area with barely a snug at the back and a tiny side niche. Not the ex-pat bar you'd expect! The owner has decorated the place with a hoard of treasure from his collections which span decades of visits to Ireland itself. Every inch of wall space is used - no joke. The crowd is excitable, international and there's a natural buzz and energy as people are thrown together in this little bathtub of a pub. Hugely distinctive - regardless of any misgivings about the theme, these will be overcome. Be aware though that this is a Marmite pub - love or hate - if you don't like crowded space then look elsewhere. (Added May 2023)

name: The Churchill Arms, Kensington
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Fuller's cask range in good condition with a reasonable middlebrow selection of alternatives. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Famous for its forest of hanging baskets outside and old-time memorabilia inside, there is no doubt this place goes the extra mile.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Neighbourly, yet famous, with some rear seating for dining, and the front bar for socialising, this works pretty well, in a similar kind of way to somewhere like Whitelock's in Leeds.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, limited outdoor seating, books, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Kensington prices, but not too scary.
description: The pub famous for WWII memorabilia and its wall of hanging baskets and greenery out front, this is part touristy, part neighbourly, a balance which largely works. Fullers owned with a range of cask ales from their stable, and a connection to the Thai restaurant next door. The interior is crammed with interesting nik naks and collectors items, a firm sense of institution about it. Worth seeking out. (Added May 2023)

name: The Blue Posts, Newman St
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Sam Smiths normal drinks range including the cask bitter.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A beautiful unspoilt downstairs with wood fittings, stained glass and dartboard. Clearly opened out at some stage, but there remains a enjoyably ur-typical London boozer appearance
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
It has its own charm at quieter times, dust motes in the gloom, and so on, but as you'd expect, busier occasions are where the utility comes alive.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Darts, meals, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
No longer a bastion of great value, Sam Smiths ramped up their prices and then some quite a while ago now, however the food is reasonable by London's standards.
description: A historic venue rebuilt in 1896, Karl Marx attended meetings of the Communist Club here in the mid-1870s. Two floors with bar room on the ground and Edwardian era dining room upstairs, the ground floor boozer is a well-preserved classic traditional boozer with ample space for drinking on the stand/leaning and a dart board. Sam Smiths owned, less of a problem in the south with the mobile phones and swearing rules (and signage) nowhere to be seen, however it is not the great value operation it used to be. Nevertheless, with Old Brewery Bitter on cask, this is a worthwhile stop if in the area, a corner of London where Sam Smiths have several similar bars. (Added May 2023)

name: G U I L D • A L E • H O U S E
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer specialists with 6 cask and 8 keg including two fridges. Most bases covered well.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
2 storey Georgian mansion converted to an ale house with a natural grandeur via the staircase and ceiling fittings, but also an attractive curved bar. Light and airy
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pleasant atmosphere quiet or busy with a range of clientele depending on the time of day, of course. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, live music, books, games, instruments
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably fair prices that aren't too different from the norm.
description: Light and airy central ale house in an attractive Georgian building, with a bar on the ground floor and more loungey upper floor with books, games and acoustic guitar. Beer specialists with a more than satisfactory range covering local to international across many bases. A friendly, quiet and comfortable venue during the afternoons which picks up energy in the evenings, partly on account of the standing and high furniture on the ground floor. Not one to miss out on if visiting Preston (Added May 2023)

name: Black Horse
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of only 7 Robinsons tied pubs that allows guest ales, all to the betterment of the pub. Old Tom a regular fixture on cask, extremely unusual given this is an 8.5% old ale. Perfunctory alternatives. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A venue of national importance on CAMRA's inventory of heritage interiors. 1898 build inspired by the arts and crafts movement with one of the few remaining curved glazed ceramic tile bars in the country. A small bar with two little snug lounges and a booth inset at the far side of the bar. Stylish and impressively preserved.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Excellent atmosphere naturally produced by the surroundings but also, on account of its central location, regular custom. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, books, function room, jukebox, real fires
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Normal prices, not much above the going rate.
description: A pub of national importance on account of its preserved interior, this former hotel was created in 1898 and has kept its snug lounge rooms, inset booth, mosaic tiled floor and curved ceramic bar, along with a host of other small features like the call bells and etched glass signage, that has a wow factor most pubs cannot match. Robinsons tied, which would normally be a byword for grey paint, anodyne interior design and a boring closed shop of drinks options, but this is one of only 7 in their stable that allows guest ales, and of course they have chosen not to spoil the interior design of this Grade II listed building. A wonderful, standout pub that, if you enjoy such things, is worth a visit to Preston for alone. (Added May 2023)

name: The Moorbrook
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A strong selection of contemporary craft beer on cask and keg with decent alternatives
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A neighbourhood pub with some preserved features such as the arched facade, etched glass and signage, the small lounges and communal upholstered bench seats. Lived in and worn in/worn out depending on your point of view.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A neighbourhood pub that attracts custom from the nearby college and north end residents, a bit of a 'trad pub reboot'.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Darts, books, live events, pizza, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Normal prices, nothing overly scary.
description: A traditional pub that's kept a sense of relevance through its community events, pizza offerings and bang up to date beer options which are quite far beyond what you'd ordinarily expect from an out of town boozer. A 15 minute walk north from the centre to the college and fringe of the north end, this boozer still has some old world charm, a durability which is endearing, and an easy affability. With live performances, darts and low key informal social space in a nice intimate venue, it is one of the best choices for a drink in Preston. (Added May 2023)

name: Tramvaj
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Basic café bar wares, and Balkan options at that. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Really the number one reason to visit, with an interior celebrating the city's old and long gone tram/streetcar network. With some nouveau flair, and retro signage inside and out, wooden booths and carriage shaped bar area, there is plenty to look at.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good character created by the decor alone, but the city centre location on the main street near the main square ensures a steady activity and pace any time of day or night.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, outdoor seating, smoking permitted, museum info
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Not one of the city's cheaper venues but nothing to scare anyone's wallet.
description: A labour of love, this central café bar keeps the flame burning for the city's long gone tram network, a link to a more civilised and - in some ways - connected past. Floral exterior with nouveau signage and a tram carriage interior, there is so much flair to enjoy about the design of this place, particularly in the Balkans which often makes a point of utilitarianism in cafe bars. Yes, this venue is as much about ice cream, coffee, cake as it is about beer and rakija but it remains a bar, and an essential stop offer as you wander around the city. (Added June 2023)

name: Komitet Pivara & Taproom
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A special find, with quality independent small batch beers across a range of styles on tap and in bottles/cans. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A first floor little taproom with modern, warm interior - too warm in summer - is bolstered by a very pleasant decking area overlooking neighbourhood streets.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A friendly neighbourly audience - albeit from a cross section of craft beers most predictable audience, but you'll find English spoken and a pleasant welcome, it isn't especially cliquey. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, outdoor seating, smoking permitted
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably good value considering the rare wares on offer. 
description: A short walk out of the city centre takes you quickly into the fringes of what feels like the suburbs. Tucked away off a shopping street is this little taproom set on the first floor of an unassuming building. Offering 6+ taps from Komitet brewery including some of the latest experimental brews, this is a rare find in this part of the Balkans. It isn't all about the beer (thankfully), there is a pleasant welcome, helpful staff and a nice social neighbourly feel sat on the terrace enjoying the beers. While the interior decor overreaches its grasp in its modern pretensions, it is still quite cute in its small size. Of the city's nightlife options, among the best. (Added June 2023)

name: KC GRAD
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A broad selection with some more modern options, not just in respect of the Serbian craft beer.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A 19th century warehouse which has received the 21st century treatment - brushed industrial chic inside across two floors, a café downstairs and cultural centre upstairs. Funky and contemporary, with a pleasant garden lit with lamps among a semi-ruin bar type environment with exposed walls and ruins from a derelict building.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Coming alive later on, afternoon visits are a tad too sleepy and quiet to see it reaching its full potential. Out in the courtyard at peak time the atmosphere is terrific.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cultural events, community initiatives, food, snacks, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
A little higher than most even in the city centre - not punishing, but an eyebrow is raised.
description: Established in 2009, this bar and cultural centre was part of an initiative to renovated the dilapidated Mala Sava neighbourhood, which is now something approaching hipster circa 2023. Not really alternative as such, more a mainstream co-opting of certain appearance and activity, but nevertheless a venue well worth a visit. With its lamplit courtyard among a ruin-bar scene of trees and dereliction, nightlife is buzzy and you feel at the centre of the action. Upstairs is an art gallery and performance space, while the downstairs is rather under-exploited given the amount of space. For variety and especially warm summer evenings, this should be on your Belgrade hit list. (Added June 2023)

name: Strogi Centar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Slightly disappointing options given this is a modern venue, but overall competent across a range.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Loft apartment bar with high ceilings and murals in every room which almost make it become jungle like, accentuated with little touches such as tortoiseshell lamps. Downstairs basement bar with a much different character
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Lively, stylish and funky, the various rooms providing some good wandering space. Whether a DJ needs to be doing their thing at 5pm is another thing entirely, but it makes sense later on.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, live music, occasional events, smoking permitted
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing more (or less) than the normal going rate. 
description: A funky, if fairly mainstream apartment bar decorated with a sprawling jungle-like mural with funky little adornments on the tables. This 1st floor venue has plenty of rooms to explore though may feel uncomfortably barren when quiet, it certainly compensates during the evenings. Anyone who still adheres to the concept of a Friday night should keep this in mind. (Added June 2023)

name: World Traveller's Club Belgrade
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard café bar wares but a broad range.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A cute basement hangout in a historic building. Unmarked from the outside, with vintage interior among several side rooms, with a leafy atrium/courtyard
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very pleasant atmosphere in what may be a famous bar but remains a pleasantly hidden away, clandestine place. Friendly service and a social scene that's purposefully international.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Events, snacks, outside seating, smoking permitted, books, games
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard fare for the area, pretty reasonable.
description: Founded in 1999, acquiring the nickname 'Grandma's house', this hidden bar and cultural centre is one of Serbia's most famous bars. Decades later, it maintains the original sense of place and purpose with vintage furniture, friendly service and a deliberately international, collegiate atmosphere hosting cultural events and exchanges, live music and talks, and generally being a set of good people. Despite the basement location there is a leafy atrium if you fancy some fresh air (or what counts for that in central Belgrade) and even after one visit you come away feeling like if you lived here, you'd be in this place a lot. That's as good a compliment as you can pay a bar. (Added June 2023)

name: Bluz i Pivo
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Pretty standard fare overally with one or two bottles offering something different. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Vivid and colourful, part of an ex-industrial complex turned into a string of different bars, enter what is more like a roadhouse front into an expressive, jazzy one room bar, set up for live performances and evening drinking. 


Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Belonging to the Cetinjska complex, having a terrace and doing live gigs makes this one of the focal points of Belgrade's nightlife.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live music, snacks, outdoor seating, smoking permitted
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Normal, not unusual nor a standout.
description: Cetinjska complex, site of a former city brewery feels like wandering into a different kind of ruin bar, you begin to wonder where bits begin and end. At the focal point which is unfortunately still partly a car park, you'll find Bluz i pivo, a roadhouse type frontage with vivid interior and live gigs which kicks off Belgrade's city centre nightlife. Still a little bit ad hoc, it would be dishonest to call it alternative however it is funky and fairly unpretentious in its open informality. (Added June 2023)

name: Monk's Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A competent and broad selection but lacking anything eye catching
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Enter an alleyway into a beautifully lit, leafy courtyard to the side of a narrow loft-space type bar decorated in muted purples with music ephemera.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An enjoyable late evening atmosphere with a good friendly buzz about it and views above the attractive terrace below. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, outdoor seating, smoking permitted
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable value for basic products but slightly too high for what they try to pass as premium.
description: The area Monk's is situated is about the first part of central Belgrade that begins to feel like the suburbs rather than another city street, and that atmosphere travels into the bar itself with a relaxed but happy, chatty atmosphere. Enter an alley to discover a beautiful courtyard with plants climbing all around you, and a 1st floor bar adjacent to it with musical theme decoration and good views outside. There's an ease to the experience that makes it instantly likeable, particular in the late evenings. Maybe some of the finer details - better drinks, a few more touches to the decoration could be tweaked, but there's still plenty to enjoy. (Added June 2023)

name: Kvaka 22
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Perfunctory little bar designed for little more than keeping the show on the road. Perhaps consider wine over beer if quality is a concern.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An unmarked exterior save for a mural which gives away the location. Climb the stairs to the top floor (where you'll hear the noise coming from) and try the door, opening out into clandestine lounge space, a large roof terrace and side rooms. Decor is vintage, faded class.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Regular cultural events make it a toss-up as to what will be happening. You may walk in to formal dancing, cinema screening, etc, but stay cool, you're still welcome to grab a beer and hang out. Night time on the terrace has some good views - very Belgradian.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cultural events, museum, live music, community work, snacks, outdoor seating, smoking permitted
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Entirely in line with usual prices for the area and quality of produce.
description: The quest to find the true alternative scene in Belgrade led here to 'Catch 22', where cultural events from museum exhibitions, formal dancing, community get-togethers and plain old hanging out overlap, coincide, and blend into one another. A loft space in an unmarked previously abandoned building, this is one of the true seats of dynamic culture in the city as opposed to some of the more mainstream poseur venues in the centre. For variety and a sense of being in the zeitgeist, you can't look further than here. (Added June 2023)

name: "Alo Alo"
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Typical cafe bar fare, bases covered, decent wines at least.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
It's an Allo Allo themed pub and it's in Belgrade. Not enough? Well, enter to find a small bar room with further seating to the back, all festooned in memorabilia from the comedy series and - where not manageable, anything adjacent to it. Quite peculiar.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Although advertised as a restaurant, the atmosphere and choices of the other customers strongly suggests this is a pub - one that occasionally churns out a pizza or two. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, outdoor seating, smoking permitted, museum pieces
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Entirely ordinary for the area.
description: While advertised as a pizza restaurant, the atmosphere in practise is much more that of a pub, with plenty of room for just socialising with a drink, among a most peculiar theme, the British comedy series Allo Allo, with memorabilia festooned on every inch of wall space. Unless you're in that particular category of people who just want to drink the best beer in any environment, this is probably worth your time as a novelty. (Added June 2023)

name: Samo Pivo
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
There's no doubt that this is the epicentre of craft beer in Serbia, with 2 dozen taps covering many styles and more in the fridge.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Set in an amusingly dilapidated/derelict arcade, you may be too terrified to walk up the broken steps past the broken escalator into the graffiti strewn surroundings covered in stagnant water and dirt, but if you want to come here, that's where you're going. Enter to find a repurposed retail unit with open plan room and far nicer terrace.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
So far so craft inside, but the beer signage and a nice courtyard helps elevate the atmosphere somewhat. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, outdoor seating, smoking permitted, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Considering you are in probably the most important beer destination in Belgrade, prices remain pretty fair.
description: Set in an amusingly dilapidated/derelict arcade, this is hardly many craft beer fans idea of the brushed aluminium industrial chic they are used to. You may be too terrified to walk up the broken steps past the broken escalator into the graffiti strewn surroundings covered in stagnant water and dirt, but if you want to come here, that's where you're going. Enter to find a repurposed retail unit with open plan room and far nicer terrace which comes alive later on. With 2 dozen taps and otherwise competent set up and surroundings, you can't look past Samo Pivo on your rounds across Belgrade, even if the experience isn't in line with the product. (added June 2023)

name: Riddle Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Bespoke cocktails that arrive after a conversation with the staff about what you like. Produced to a high standard.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An upstairs bar accessible with a door bell. On entry you'll find what looks like a cinema bar or 'backstage' type feel. A small sweeping red room with curtains and high tables.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An element of fun to the doorbell and decision making, and a nice clandestine feel - windowless and private. Not overly swanky either, though somewhere between casual and smart casual would be preferable to not feel uncomfortably out of place.
Amenities/Events: ❤️
Snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
For a cocktail bar of this variety and given the location, drinks are relatively reasonable.
description: The concept is that you won't know quite what you've ordered. The staff begin a conversation about what cocktails you like and try to pare it down so the waiter can mix you a bespoke drink. This naturally have varied results - reviews report people often don't get what they asked for, but like it anyway. The cocktails are nevertheless made to a good standard and a reasonable price overall, and the bar itself is on the 1st floor of a Skadarska city building, close to the epicentre of nightlife in the capital. You'll find the bar an engaging, atmospheric place with curtains and sweeping curved lines reminiscent of a cinema bar or some backstage private event. It's all put together pretty effectively and adds variety, flair and colour to your evening. (Added June 2023)

name: Кафе Шупа
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A decent selection covering everything from what you'd drink at 7 in the morning to...3 in the morning. Including Serbian craft beer, with some good spirits and home made juices too.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Colourful, hippy and rustic, there's a genteel bohemian sensibility to the main little ground floor room, with a basement hangout underneath that's a little scuzzier and alternative.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pleasant afternoon lounging with an established social scene of locals, certainly doesn't feel embedded in an urban city centre. Versatile enough to turn up the tempo later on.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, outdoor seating, smoking permitted, occasional live events, community initiatives
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Normal, acceptable prices. 
description: Kafe Supa, a welcoming, hippy, mis-fit café bar that does everything just that bit better than most. Truly alternative still, even in its twee way, it represents an audience that don't have much else in this area. Whether it's the colourful upstairs, slightly scuzzy downstairs or mini terrace, the ramshackle feel pervades, and you can enjoy it with anything from a home made fruit juice to a Serbian craft beer on tap to a shot of pelinkovac. It's up to you. Distinctive and worth a shot if it sounds like your kinda thing. (Added June 2023)

name: Verona
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Beer focused with the emphasis on domestic lagers, but a bigger selection than some, and a competent back bar.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Enjoyably unspoilt half basement interior with vaulted ceiling, beams, chunky tables, whitewashed walls and a throwback feel that is apparent almost instantly. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A popular local hangout and above all an authentic social meeting place which elevates the place even when lacking in some respects. A range of ages and classes here, fairly unusual these days.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, outdoor seating, smoking permitted - No WiFi though

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fine
description: Somewhat of a throwback, this popular boozer focuses on the core values of pubgoing - a cosy sense of community and welcome in a natural social, communal space. As the pub says, the only thing Italian about it is the name, but that much is already clear from peering at the menu and the interior. A half-step basement with vaulted ceiling, beams and smokey environment, this is about beer, cigs and chat, with a few meals emerging now and then. It isn't an intimidating 'old man' place and you'll find a true range of people enjoying the atmosphere. Happy to include this on the guide. (added June 2023)

name: Graffiti
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A competent, though unexciting bar range.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Wonderful, and unexpectedly showy, this bar has been turned into a boudoir of reds and golds, antique furniture and nik naks, unusual museum style display boards fitted to the ceiling. A one room bar with a terrace set on the porch of a housing block in the suburbs.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmospheric in all the best ways. Friendly, slightly clandestine, local and unaffected by tourism, vibrant and young yet still versatile enough to attract different groups. Social chat and banter enhanced by the darts played at the bar. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Darts, outdoor seating, smoking permitted, books, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
The going rate for the area, nothing scary.
description: After the nth nothingy cafe bar you'd be tempted to feel demotivated, to wonder if there actually are any truly epic bars in the Balkans which compete with other regions of Europe. Then, your cursor falls over the next icon with a coffee mug on it, filled with hope but not expectation, you find one. Graffiti, set outside Novi Sad old town in pleasant enough suburbs is easily reachable and well worth the trip - in fact if you are going anywhere near Novi Sad you should pay a visit. Its interior, a labour of love, carefully curated with rich reds, golds and unusual ceiling fittings with vintage photography. With a leafy terrace out front, this has some of the core ingredients for fantastically atmospheric evening bar going. This is enhanced further by its non-touristy location. Those here are acquaintances, familiar faces, and as they play darts by the bar, the chatter is real, local, and the feel is truly authentic. This is their place, and you are merely a welcome guest. Grab one of the little tables and soak up the rich surroundings, the likes of which you'll not be experiencing in the region very often. (Added June 2023)

name: Crni Ovan
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Considering the small size of the pub, bases are covered well here including some craft beer on tap and more in bottles. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beautiful fairylit courtyard in a precinct which appears to you from the dark and urban surroundings like a tiny window of paradise. The interior is microscopically small but has enough space for alt/goth artwork to your left, merchandise on your right and personalised - political - statements behind the bar. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Friendly staff and a nice atmosphere on the terrace, also dog friendly. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, outdoor seating, smoking permitted, merchandise
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair prices with nothing overly scary.
description: Crni Ovan - Black Ram was a find made on the day rather than researched in advance. Some of our best finds have happened this way and just shows you should never switch off, the next nice bar may be just around the corner! This is a lovely little place set in a precinct between two of the main squares in Novi Sad, and as you approach the fairylights and greenery will appear to you like an oasis of enjoyment of relaxation, not something to walk past, but dive into. The bar is a tiny, alternative-leaning place, dog-friendly, and fascist-unfriendly, with some pro-Yugoslavia stickers around the place. They sell merchandise but manage to do so in a non-annoying way (unlike, for example, BrewDog). Drinks are better than you'd expect from an alt place with Serbian craft beer on tap and bottles and some interesting wines and spirits too, pretty good considering the tiny place. Service is friendly and its a place you could imagine making your local if you lived here. (Added June 2023)

name: Foxtrot
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Not a strong point, you'll be provided with a largely last generation caffe bar type selection.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A superb interior that will make you rub your eyes to double check you're in Serbia. Wood fittings with pillars, ornate mirror frames and carvings, without at any point feeling like a theme bar, or Irish bar. The bar itself is at the centre of the room with table around the 3 sides and further table space at the back.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good character generated by the interior itself, but the atmosphere is elevated by the natural social surroundings of locals hanging out. Relatively smokey in here even by Serbian standards.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, smoking permitted, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Normal local prices but an extra point for actually fairly applying prices in accordance with drinks size, unlike many Serbian bars where a 0.3l beer costs 85% of the price of a 0.5l.
description: Here is another Novi Sad venue we found on our visit rather than in advance, hiding in plain sight. A little out of the centre but well worth the short walk, you'll find fully neighbourly local life in an interior that will take you aback in its unfamiliarity and distinction from virtually any other bar in hundreds of miles radius. This beautiful wood fit bar hosting smoky socialising conjures up images of everything from Florida keys rum joints, to London pubs of old to Dutch brown cafés. But it's here in Serbia. Drinks options are perfunctory but you will easily be able to surf on the novelty of the surroundings as an individual or come back again and again with friends. (Added June 2023)

name: Škripa Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Well stocked little bar with Serbian craft beer including its own label offering and a host of good looking wines and spirits too
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Striking exterior as you walk through to the courtyard of a grand old building to be greeted by a two storey premises with exposed 1st story, and a colourful downstairs with a partly covered extension. All slightly ad hoc and off at an angle. Furnishings and style veers towards twee but the overall effect remains balanced.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A staple of Novi Sad's nightlife, there is a sense of institution to the venue, familiarity and ease, some local fame to it. The atmosphere is friendly, perhaps on the gentler end of bohemian but still alternative enough to be distinctive. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, smoking permitted, outdoor seating, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably good value but not overall standing out versus others in the city.
description: An essential link to any chain in a bar crawl around Novi Sad, this venue deftly treads the balance between a welcoming afternoon family cafe and buzzing alternative evening venue. The premises is distinctive, with a grand entrance leading to dilapidated car park court yard and two storey bar with an exposed from so you can see the customers unshielded on the 1st level. Downstairs partly covered space has a hint of ruin bar aesthetic and this is supported by a superior range of beer, wine and spirits versus what would normally be laid on. While in each individual aspect there may be superior examples, this place ties everything together very nicely, and deserves credit for attracting a broad audience. (Added June 2023)

name: Rock Cafe Dramil
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Spartan selection of budget lager and spirits
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Pubby side-street bar festooned with vinyl records on the walls, simple wooden furniture and TV.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A survivor, characterful venue with long-standing and increasingly infirm owners, with an old-school charm that elevates matters a little. Where to go if you value lack of pretense and good conversational, social environment.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, TV, music, outdoor seating, smoking permitted
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Not only slightly cheaper than other Novi Sad bars but there are drinks available at less than half the price of the going rate. 
description: Smokey, classic rock bar that's a dog-eared survivor, much like the owners. This imbues a natural charm along with the mute, kindly service and old school prices that proves more than satisfactory. Yes, you won't find many airs and graces here but it squeaks onto our guide for its barnacle like existence, terrific value and overall contribution. (Added June 2023)

name: Bife Joca
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Simple cafe bar offerings positioned directly at its narrow audience.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Based in a high rise block, this looks like a reception that's been turned into a bar. Tiny venue with personalised interior, dart board and barely enough space to swing a cat. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Raw, authentic and entirely local, this is a bar with an intimidating selection of locals occupying the interior without much if any space to be alongside them. Banter thrown around the room along with the darts. No doubt this will appeal to some and sound utterly horrifying to others.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, darts, TV, smoking permitted
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Positioned for those on a budget, you can argue about the quality but not the price.
description: One variety of bar that deserves respect is one that, in its own way, is a glittering example of a very specific thing. With opening hours of 7am-8pm, this should give you some indication of what's in store. A tiny bar rammed with local men who proceed to play darts, shoot the breeze and bellow banter back and forward - this is all friendly enough, but you may find it near impossible to cleave a space for yourself inside. The service, by contrast, is a joy with friendly and jovial service both from the younger and older women who rule over the place. This is only for those of a hearty constitution or a few drinks under their belt to have lost the filter that signals, very strongly, do not go in here. Why is it on the guide? Simply because you will not find a better example of such a bar in the city or region. A living, breathing (for now) ethnographic museum. (Added June 2023)

name: Beertija Osijek
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very strong offering of Croatian craft beer with support from European classics in the fridge. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Pleasant modern but pubby surroundings, not something that will blow you away but has had some care and attention applied. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A reasonably nice social, informal atmosphere that can also change tempo later on.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, games, TV, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Not the cheapest, but this is more or less the going rate for the product in city centres around Croatia nowadays
description: Unlike their sister pub in Osijek's fortress complex, the interior of this craft beer bar has a more pubby feel, modern in design but social in layout, somewhere you could hang out in day or night. The product is very good and distinctive, focusing on Croatian craft beer ably supported by trusty European classics. There's no doubt that beer fans will be leaning on this place on their visit to the city and rightly so. (Added May 2023)

name: Csinos Presszó
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A fairly uninspired selection of beers but a fairly broad selection of alternatives, albeit mainly sticking solidly to the mainstream.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A strong suit, this colourful ruin-bar type venue is largely outside in a leafy partly covered courtyard with the typical rickety furniture, lighting and bare, partly ruined walls.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A relaxed afternoon chill-out spot that gains a little more pace in the evenings, with a slightly younger crowd.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, food, snacks, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
City centre prices, not outrageous nor especially notable.
description: Pécs' ruin bar attempt is a decent effort, one that would probably slot into the Budapest scene without a bat of an eyelid. Colourful with the familiar exposed ruined building next to a leafy partly covered courtyard with rickety furniture. Relaxed by day, vibrant at night, worth checking out while in the city. (added May 2023)

name: Cooltour Café
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A decent but not overly dramatic selection, though it is doubtful anyone but the most picky could object.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A colourful vintage café interior with a very pleasant rear garden with lighting festooned across mature trees and plenty of hideaway seats.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very pleasant afternoon/evening hangout spot with a relaxed atmosphere that becomes more vibrant as the night progresses.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, outdoor seating, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
City centre prices, nothing too outrageous
description: Not precisely a ruin-bar but something adjacent to one. Attractive 'Kert' (garden) to the rear which is the main event in summer, while in winter a vintage cafe awaits. Very relaxed with a more muted backing music than many of these venues, mature trees and lighting in the garden is a pleasant oasis in the city centre. One not to miss out on during your visit. (Added June 2023)

name: István Pince
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Poor beer selection, this Borozo focuses on wines, with some typical central European spirits such as Palinka available
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A relic. Wood-strip basement interior unchanged since the 1980s. A bar room with chunky communal tables and side room offering more than the same. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A pub-diner with canteen, you'll find old-timers here for an early drink, locals popping in to say hi, and a sense of authenticity that is unmistakeable, a throwback operating with a kind of snub-nosed defiance.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Food, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very good value for money for the product.
description: A Borozo is the wine equivalent to the Sorozo, but don't be thinking of any kind of fancy establishment. In Hungary these are battered, family-run old establishments, and Istvan Pince (cellar) is no different. With an unchanged, throwback appearance, a kitchen pumping out simple good value Hungarian cooking and an array of the most brutally utilitarian drinks, this is a defiantly unchanged boozer where you'll find authentic local life and a marked contrast to the modern venues on the main street. Come armed with basic Hungarian phrases, enjoy your plate of goulash and booze and do as the locals do. (Added June 2023)

name: Villányi Borozó
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Basic beers are a sideshow to local wines
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A tiny bar with wooden booths and antique photographs and clocks.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Entirely local, vibrant place with a core cast of middle-aged/elderly regulars and friendly service. Possibly intimidating but generally friendly.
Amenities/Events: ❤️
Snacks, limited outdoor space
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably fair value for money particularly for the wines
description: This tiny Borozo (a working class wine bar) is a drop in place with an element of faded class to its sweeping wooden bar and booth seats, antique decor and sense of institution full of local life - all middle aged or elderly. Local wine available for a snip and an atmosphere that is distinctive not only to Hungary but these kind of bars, one to look out for. (Added June 2023)

name: The Peach
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Café Bar style offerings but a little more modernised, the beer included with a few good options from smaller Czech brewers and a fridge of craft cans.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A gloomy courtyard leads to what is a ramshackle and deliberately ad hoc location with fish tank, a large room with deliberately scruffy/informal look.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A younger alternative audience mixing locals and the odd tourist finds a healthy balance. Social and informal, somewhere to go to hang out, not see and be seen.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, events, fishtank, books, games
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
City centre prices, not much different from anywhere else. 
description: Marketed as Bratislava's ruin bar, that is a bit of a push in terms of the decor, but a pleasantly shabby, ad-hoc feel pervades, this is not somewhere you go to impress strangers but to hang out in a casual environment where smoking is tolerated. With a Fish tank, a gloomy courtyard and and social events, this is a decent option to bear in mind and plays a role as key venue on the Bratislava roster. (added June 2023)

name: Chillton bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Surprisingly strong range of Serbian craft beer on tap and in bottles.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A downstairs and upstairs bar. The loft is ramshackle and deliberately 'vintage' with wood panels and apartment style warren of rooms. There is a downstairs courtyard and lower floor too, so plenty to check out.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Still genuinely alternative as opposed to some of the other areas of nightlife in Belgrade which have evolved into more mainstream entities. This is where to hang out without pretension. Smokey, chatty, casual and informal.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Pool table, snacks, cultural events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A reasonable price for what's on offer
description: Ignore the cruddy name, here is one of a handful of genuinely alternative places in the centre of Belgrade. This is a building taken over and repurposed across two floors with a clandestine loft bar and lower floor for hanging out, letting loose and worrying about appearances some other time. This is no basic bar though, as they stock Serbian craft beers from small independently owned brewers, arranging cultural events and attract a range of people are a result. A must-visit for quiet afternoon lounging or towards the end of an evening. (Added June 2023)

name: Pivski zabavnik
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Excellent selection (quality over quantity) of Serbian craft beer particularly given the size of the bar.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A retail unit in an alleyway/arcade turned into a bar. Well executed with a mezzanine level above the bar, and space in the courtyard in the evenings to socialise. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Surprisingly buzzing, this is a popular neighbourhood social spot. Fewer city boys and posers, not just beer monsters either. Very chatty and social inside and out.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Takeaway options, snacks, smoking permitted, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Still pretty good value all things considered.
description: Check opening times and don't be deterred if you visit and you can't find it - the bar occupies the central courtyard of an old shopping arcade next to a laundrette and a massage parlour at the back. It's a tiny little retail unit they've built a mezzanine area inside and put benches and barrels in the courtyard to expand it. The execution of this bar is very good and attracts a local, friendly and social crowd. This is where you could easily meet new friends and make connections, and benefits from being just far enough outside the centre to feel like it isn't trying to impress anyone. The beers are local, Serbian and craft in focus, meeting a high standard. All in all, if you enjoy beer without the hype and marketing b.s, this is an essential stop off in Belgrade. (Added June 2023)

name: 1516 Brewing Company
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Own brewed beers made on site, a regular roster with seasonal specials with perfunctory alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A reasonably pubby interior, curved bar with wood fittings with fairly generic signage and TV screens.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A local institution with a slight hint of backpacker feel to it, appealing to tourists more than locals.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Own beers, food, snacks, TV, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Not the best value, or the worst.
description: After our first visit a long way back in 2015, it took 8 years to return. This brewpub just squeaks onto the guide when assessing the general pubby feel and welcome of the place, its own beers which are an important contribution to a city that isn't awash with a great variety of beers. Lastly, there's friendly service. Yes it's fairly mainstream and a little geared towards backpackers and tourists but you can't knock it for versatility or convenience; a very handy one to have up your sleeve. Open every day until late and overall worth marking on the map. (Added May 2023)

name: Beehive
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A reasonable range - 3 or 4 cask lines with scope for more, decent fridge selection covering bases, and a few kegs lines beyond the norm.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An eye catching traditional interior with Victorian elements. Stained glass, fireplace, red upholstered seats, worn in and characterful and central bar spanning a few rooms.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Natural ambience inside, relaxed and pleasant when quite, and a good hubbub and social scene when busy. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Books, board games, outdoor seating, snacks, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Not the best value ever.
description: Reopened after Covid, a pleasant discovery. A pub dating to 1870 with classic town boozer features. Red upholstered bench seating, fireplaces, stained glass and an opened out but still traditional interior which a bar spans. Very good potential to be brought back to its former glory. (Added June 2023)

name: Les Couleurs Cafe
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Well stocked café bar selection. Perhaps missing some modern/more cutting edge options but a broad range that goes generally above standard fare.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Enter to a long bar room with red leather, theatre posters on the wall and a sweeping bar top. Hint of the 60s diner and Parisien cafe bleed into one another. There's a small smoking room (our favourite) to the right, and an attractive atrium extension to the rear.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A combination of lively bar area, surrounding decor, local life and bohemian social scene creates a terrific atmosphere, each elevating the place beyond the sum of its parts.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, light bites, outdoor seating, occasional events, smoking room
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing dramatic to report either way.
description: Based on Plac Nowy in the heart of Kazimierz, it feels like it's always open. Ticking over at 7 in the morning, and on weekends carrying on until the small hours of the morning. With a bohemian Parisien appearance, plastered with theatre posters and festooned with twee lighting across a classic 60s style diner fit, competent drinks selection covering everything from morning coffee to late night shots, it attracts everyone from hyper young locals, pseudy hipsters, grizzled old hippies and pretty much anyone else who happens to be passing by. A buzzing bar area, atmospheric smoking room and distinctive atrium area to the rear all have their appeal, and it's one you feel you'll be returning to over and over. Why did it take so long? (Added June 2023)

name: Propaganda Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A range based on utility rather than refinement, although some people may enjoy one or two oddities on tap and on the back wall.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Communist ephemera chewed and mangled, then worn in over decades to become something quite marvellous, a dive bar that's in its own way a living work of art.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Punk, fun, occasionally with an edge to it, but there's always something to engage with here.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, museum type pieces
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Given the change in the neighbourhood in the last 15 years, it maintains reasonably fair value, but no longer the cheap and cheerful dive it used to be.
description: The idea of the 'retro socialist' bar is now done to death, but this is one of the originals, in fact one of the older continuously running bars in Kraków's Kazimierz district. Both the incredible chewed mishmash of decor and the fact it is very, very well worn in creates an unholy, quite intense effect whether the bar is dead or packed with people. Fun, with an occasional punky edge to it, this is a truly excellent European dive bar. (Added June 2023)

name: Cafe Szafe
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A fairly standard range on tap and in the back bar with a few flourishes.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Corner bar with artsy, vivid paintwork across 3 small rooms including a larger hangout area and performance area at the rear.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A late bar with a core audience of youngster burning the candle at both ends. Friendly, sometimes unpredictable revelry.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Cultural events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing out of the ordinary for the area.
description: It feels like Café Szafe is always open. You walk past in the morning to find a colourful cafe serving coffee to its local audience and it's all too often the last port of call, especially if you're not based in Kazimierz, exiting for bed in the early hours of the morning. A long standing venue set off from the core bar areas, without a lot of nearby competition, the end result is it draws in a neighbourly, more local audience. Less chance of encountering middle aged Yanks or British backpackers. Later on the atmosphere descends into drunken revelry. Midsummer parties, table dancing and the bar staff, the nominal adults in the room leading the charge. At its best when busy but perfectly pleasant for a sedate afternoon, this is a very useful option to keep in your pocket, particularly if you're located anywhere near Stradom, Blonia or West of the old town. (Added June 2023)

name: The Artist Cocktail Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A concise menu of signature cocktails but a well stocked bar where requests and bespoke options can be requested.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An unusual but nonetheless alluring mixture of deco glam, historic vaulted ceilings and local art in a simple 'off the street' room.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
