Somewhere inbetween formal and informal, there is a casual atmosphere but fairly formal service. Atmosphere is calm and focusing on relaxation rather than partying.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Light bites, piano, local art
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard absolutely matches the price which is fair.
description: Falling between art deco and medieval allure, 'The Artist's angle is changing exhibitions of local art which occupy considerable wall space. A one room cocktail bar with piano by the entrance, this is about relaxed, slow-tempo enjoyment. Choose from a concise menu or ask the staff to whip you up something you desire. from a well-stocked back bar, then sit back on plush furniture and soak it in. A distinctive spot as reviews attest to. (Added June 2023)

name: Black Gallery Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A standard, fairly unexciting but stock range of options you'll find in virtually every Polish bar that isn't a specialist craft beer bar or cocktail bar.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
You can choose from a delightful leafy beer garden or later on an atmospheric, distinctive scuzzy basement.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very pleasant natural ambience in the garden and can be very lively downstairs later on too.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Occasional events, snacks, outdoor space
Value For Money: ❤️
Poor value for money with obvious gouging - the telltale Cash Only operation further invites suspicion.
description: A notorious venue with an ever-growing list of enemies, run by an erratic, opinionated loose cannon, with expensive drinks - cash only and a rather dubious gouging operation. So why recommend it? Well, most of the time you will not encounter the owner, the prices are absorbable if annoying, leaving the actual venue itself which is really good. A distinctive, leafy beer garden that is superb to hang out in day or night, and atmospheric basement pub that has a good identity too. We're not going to lie, it's a risk recommending this, but you might really get something out of it. (Added June 2023)

name: Biała Małpa
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Top quality Polish craft beer from small independent brewers including 4 cask lines, albeit 1 or 2 rarely used. Adequate alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Based in a courtyard with a craft bar on your left, Mexican restaurant on your right and terrace seating including a 2nd 'self-service' bar outside operated by a card you pick up at the main bar.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pleasant outside in the courtyard and overall a thoughtful, well-financed, modern but not dull or sterile place attracting a range including Poland's burgeoning middle class.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, self-serve beer, outdoor seating, events, cask ale
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
A little above the going rate on account of the central location and products on offer.
description: We're always willing to doff our cap and credit modern places who have executed their concept well, and here is one. In central Katowice only a few minutes walk from the station you'll find a courtyard with a craft bar and Mexican restaurant. The atmosphere is casual, you can come and go at your leisure. With quirks such as cask ales and self-serve beer adding appeal, this is a thoughtfully put together, well-financed venue that captures a range of people. While perhaps lacking the true wow factor it executes most of the rest so well it clearly deserves an inclusion (Added June 2023)

name: Absurdalna
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Don't be fooled by the bar at the entrance, as you'll find much healthier stock at the main bar further inside the building with 15-20 taps of Polish craft beer from small independent breweries and an adequate range of alternatives for a wide audience.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Anything with a name like this is setting itself up for a challenge. While it isn't exactly absurd, there are quirky touches like false windows, a bed, abstract murals and galleries from local artists across a multi-room venue.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Feels somewhere in between alternative and mainstream, clearly taking cues from the ruin bars and apartment bars in the region and neighbouring countries. Popular terrace and a sense that a range of people can mix in fairly well.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, outdoor seating, art gallery, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
A little higher than most on account of central location and the wares.
description: Absurd is pushing it, but this bar is colourful, quirky and vibrant with a gallery from local artists, false windows, piano, bed across a series of ground floor rooms. This is complimented by a large range of Polish craft beer on tap (go to the main bar, not the one in the entrance) and is very centrally located. As a result it attracts a range of people rather than a niche, mainly to its benefit, but losing a few points for alternative cred. Still, it comes comfortably recommended. (Added June 2023)

name: Jazz Club u Muniaka
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A cocktail range competently covering the classics and plenty more besides, more than its unassuming appearance would suggest.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Set off famous Florianska in the basement of a 14th century tenement house, you'll brick vaulted cellars tastefully lit and decorated, with one small rectangular performance room and a small adjacent bar area.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Lively with a range of people huddled together, though a reverence descends when performances begin.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live music, light bites
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A small cover charge for the music, and otherwise entirely fair given the location.
description: Named after musician Janusz Muniak who spent much of his life at the venue teaching and performing, this basement jazz club is set in the brick vaults of a 14th century cellar. Although the live performances which begin at 21:30 daily are no longer cutting edge on the scene, you'll find a mix of up and coming bands and highly competent circuit musicians. This is paid for with a small and entirely absorbable cover charge, after which drinks, including a good cocktail range can be acquired at a reasonable rate. A huddled, excitable atmosphere in an intimate space, a reverential hush descends when the jazz starts. Service is apparently notoriously brusque, although we didn't personally find that (quite the opposite). If you enjoy this sort of thing you can't look past it. (Added June 2023)

name: Pizzini
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Almost no right to have 3 excellent Franconian beers on tap until you check where you are, and it becomes entirely normal. This is not the average city on that front. A competent back bar covering most bases in a functional manner.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Described as a 'Weinstube' on the sign, enter to find that the purpose of the place has somewhat morphed over the years. Any original refinement has been replaced by a bohemian setting of characterfully faded wood fittings, off-centre artwork, nooks and crannies and old musical instruments not unlike a brown café, later bar in Berlin or Kazimierz bar.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Superb 'place to be' verve and vibrance which is notoriously difficult to drum up, some bars have it, some don't, and this one really, really does.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live music, snacks, limited outdoor seating, games
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair prices, nothing overly stellar value either.
description: It seems a little off-kilter to describe a wine bar on the main old town street in Bamberg as an 'insider tip', but there's a feeling that many visitors to the city simply would not think of going here, instead defaulting to the many beer halls and brewery pubs. Secondly, as it opens at 7pm by which time many day trippers are already setting out to leave. All cities need - and deserve an informal bolthole to let your hair down and have fun, particularly Bamberg with its arch-traditional Wirtshauses. Pizzini darts in like a bolt from the blue with its ramshackle layout and atmosphere more akin to a brown café, Kazimierz bar or Berlin kneipe, a late opening operation servicing people who want to carry on their socialising until the early hours. Truly informal with a particular feeling of verve and vibrance that is very difficult to force. Being Franconia there are of course superb beer options alongside a decent enough suite of alternatives, meaning the product and experience ticks the right boxes. Find a preferred nook among the aging wood fittings, artwork, musical instruments and battered furniture and chat, plot and party until home time. What a bar! (Added August 2023)

name: Rotenschild
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.4
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good range all-round covering cocktails, aperitivo, mixers, shots and schnapps and - yes - beer, a couple of more unusual offerings alongside Franconia's great lagers.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Upstairs in a historic timber building that is also a complex of bars. A creaky staircase leads to a 1st floor bar with a young crowd, but sat among what appears to be a 19th century Medieval revivalist interior with ornate wood fit ceiling, frescos and all-round sense of centuries past.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very characterful due to the decor, with an excited, surprisingly young crowd
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Table football, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.
description: Upstairs in a historic timber building that is also a complex of bars is the unusual Rotenschild. A creaky staircase leads to a 1st floor bar with a young crowd, but sat among what appears to be a 19th century Medieval revivalist interior with ornate wood fit ceiling, frescos and all-round sense of centuries past. Hardly what you'd expect the generation to find appealing, but further evidence that people who deride traditional decor as unpopular in that age category haven't got a clue. The bar sells good Franconian beers along with cocktails, shots and aperitivo all at a reasonable rate. Looking out over Bamberg's most famous thoroughfare and enjoying the incredible surroundings makes for an atmospheric evening. (Added August 2023)

name: Catwheezle’s Castle
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A strong selection of high quality Franconian beer including Spezial on tap, but decent back bar offerings befitting its late opening hours.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A former nursery and stables until the 1970s, and on foundations dating to 1345, this bar - according to the owner - sprang up on a whim in the early 90s during a renovation, intended to be an apartment, then converted to a bar. You'll find a hallway on entry with dartboard and beer garden to the back, with the bar room to the right which has a mezzanine level and cafe bar tables, but mainly wood fittings. There are a lot of plants decorating the windows and musical instruments and ephemera fixed to the walls. Intimate in size and unique in shape.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Nothing less than a local institution. You won't find many if any tourists here, most of whom flock to the beer halls of the centre. But this has carved its own space in the city's history the past 30 years. Coming to life later in the evening, with a friendly crowd, there is a surprisingly pubby feel, one of the few German venues which fall between the Gaststatte and Kiezkneipe type setups.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Music, darts, outdoor seating, snacks, community events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Entirely fair prices
description: Nothing less than a local institution. You won't find many if any tourists here, most of whom flock to the beer halls of the centre. But this has carved its own space in the city's history the past 30 years. Coming to life later in the evening, with a friendly crowd, there is a surprisingly pubby feel, one of the few German venues which fall between the Gaststatte and Kiezkneipe type setups. Music, darts, outdoor seating, snacks, community events and fair prices are a major draw. A former nursery and stables until the 1970s, and on foundations dating to 1345, this bar - according to the owner - sprang up on a whim in the early 90s during a renovation, intended to be an apartment, then converted to a bar. You'll find a hallway on entry with dartboard and beer garden to the back, with the bar room to the right which has a mezzanine level and cafe bar tables, but mainly wood fittings. There are a lot of plants decorating the windows and musical instruments and ephemera fixed to the walls. Intimate in size and unique in shape, this isn't one you'll find listed in the beer focused guide books, yet it does offer some of the best Franconian beer on tap, with 3 of the best including Spezial available. Service is friendly, the atmosphere is lively and convivial. Why would you look past this place? (Added August 2023)

name: Brauhaus Zum Sternla
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A concise well executed core range with occasional seasonal specials. Not reaching for the stars but sensibly making sure the basics are good.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A historic Inn turned into a brewpub, with small, intimate bar room with low black-beamed ceilings and chunky tables, then a larger dining area and garden to the rear.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Lunch service can make it a bit more family oriented than is ideal, however outside of this you can still enjoy a pretty pubby environment.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing out of the ordinary for the city.
description: A relatively recent brewery (2019) but a long standing Bamberg Gaststatte brought back to life. You'll find an intimate low ceilinged Bierstube with an attractive retro bar area. The usual black beams and chunky tables are in evidence, but take a look to the rear to find considerably more space than it first suggests. The beer offerings are straight forward and well executed, the food is good and the atmosphere is suitably pubby. We're interested to return in winter too.(Added August 2023)

name: Hopfengarten Bamberg
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Creative minibrewery which has a range of traditional and creative brews from eucalyptus beer to brown ales. Most are decent efforts. They also have several gins.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A garden centre with graffiti design in the alleyway and yards, leading to greenhouses, and a back yard with communal tables, sand pit and of course hop fields.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Naturally quirky venue with everything going on. This along with the outdoor areas compensates for the function room type feel to the bar.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Greenhouse, sandpit, function room, street food, snacks, live events, garden centre, takeaways
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Moving closer to a 'craft beer' pitch, but still reasonably good value considering everything. 
description: Easily Bamberg's most unusual brewery of the dozen plus that are based in the city, this place is a garden centre with a nano brewery, so enter through a graffitied covered drive to find a series of greenhouses, the operations growing their own vegetables and ingredients for making beer. The beers are varied from eucalyptus to brown ale to plain old Helles lager and can be bought on a taster tray (a rather expensive one) if you want to rattle through them. It doesn't stop there with a sandpit, hop fields to wander through and large outdoor area for dry, sunny days which unfortunately was not the case on our visit. The main bar feels like a bit of a wedding function place but that is really the only shortcomings of an otherwise distinctive venue. (Added August 2023)

name: Brauerei Greifenklau - Bamberg
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The brewery's own beers which include a lager, bockbier and smoked effort, and the typical German alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brown low ceilinged 1970s era Bierstube with a Wirtshaus room opposite and leafy beer garden to the rear. Set at the top of a long drag out of town.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A popular local place that feels like a neighbourhood rather than a city pub overall. Regulars in the main pub room, and a sense of space for everyone.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, board games, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Entirely fair, if unremarkable
description: Up a long drag out of town is a brewery that has been celebrated after years of understated service. You'll find Franconian lager in a most traditional setting, with both Bierstube and Garden offering a charming setting to socialise in. The former is a real pub, like a cigar case with old fogeys playing cards, cross-chat around the room and beers going back and forth. The Garden with handsome views and leafy overhangs is lovely too. Somewhat stuck in time but that will only make it ever more charming as years pass.

name: Beim Käck´n
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of the best Zoiglbiers around, a dry bitter unfiltered Kellerbier that is almost touching over in flavour and character with unfiltered Czech svetly lezak. Everything else is an afterthought, however it must be said there are local wines and an array of brandies/schnapps from interests fruits and plants too.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A large venue up near the top of town, enter via garage doors then down a slope to a beer garden, long and rectangular leading to further seating in a garage/warehouse. Inside there's a large, low ceilinged kitchen type setup with pub tables.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
True hospitality in a natural, easy, non-commercial feeling space. Neighbourly and community oriented, enjoyment and fun abounds. This is the life.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, meals, snacks, occasional events, live music
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of the best price:performance ratios in Germany, well above average for the wares in terms of quality and quantity. Close to astonishing.
description: One of the Oberpfalz' Zoigl pubs, a culture that is unique, alien even, but fascinating. A tiny few families in the region share a communal brewery, making their own creations then open their doors on rotation a few days a month..

Here at Neuhaus, the adjoined town to Windischeschenbach, the entire high street seems to be Zoigl pubs. At Kack'n you'll find one of the best around. 

The garden itself is what will greet you through what seems to be a garage driveway, extending down the row of tables and canopy to a converted garage/warehouse accommodating tables. On summer evenings the atmosphere is alive with enjoyment and hospitality, as well as different age groups and neighbours. It really is an almost idyllic image of social pubgoing.

This extends to the interior which again despite the size feels homely and like being in someone's house, or at least guest house rather than a commercial entity.

This is accentuated by meeting and speaking to the owner and brewer himself, a jolly moustachioed chap who in all ways seems to be loving life, and why not with this reward for your hard work?

I would say this was the one non-negotiable Zoigl venue of our 2023 visit.

http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if it'll be open before you go, as Zoigl pubs are only ever open a few days each month.

(Added August 2023)

name: Zoiglstube Beim Binner
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Unique zoigl bier and a distillery operation, with a selection of brandies, gins and schnapps
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Multi-room pub which spills out onto the drive way. A last Gasthaus feel with light wood and study communal tables.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Neighbourly and communal feel accentuated by the owner's children helping with the daily operations.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Distillery, meals, snacks, outdoor seating, occasional events + music
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A touch higher than some other Zoigl places but really drastically below what could be expected in Germany these days.
description: One of the Oberpfalz' Zoigl pubs, a culture that is unique, alien even, but fascinating. A tiny few families in the region share a communal brewery, making their own creations then open their doors on rotation a few days a month..

Beim Binner has a feel of a well oiled operation which runs its own distillery as well as the Zoiglstube and the brewing operation. It feels professional right up until the point you see their young son and daughters doing the serving and pouring, when some of that old country-style hospitality comes flooding back.

A multi-roomed house with a Gaststatte feel, perhaps not the most ad hoc feeling Zoigl place but still a popular, busy fixture with a strong neighbourly feel.

http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if it'll be open before you go, as Zoigl pubs are only ever open a few days each month.

(Added August 2023)

name: Zoiglstube Wolfladl
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brewed at the communal brewery (Kommunbrahaus) and available only a few days each month, this is a family operation and beer you will not find elsewhere. Unique. Some limited alternatives of wine and soft drinks.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A house on the corner of a slop with seating on the terrace. Inside you'll find a multi-room pub with a bar opposite the entrance and ground floor nooks, with upper level seating too. This is largely used in winter and evenings. The decor is typically traditional but fairly newly fit and lighter wood.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Characterful family operation, it is true hospitality, like being welcomed into a home. The owners are informal, friendly people and without airs and graces.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Occasional live events, popular with local bikers, meals, snacks, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
As with typical Zoigl pubs, you will not find cheaper beer on tap in Germany, but it isn't just about the price, it's the combination of its unique creation, quality and scarcity that makes it truly one of the best value pints on earth. 
description: One of the Oberpfalz' Zoigl pubs, a culture that is unique, alien even, but fascinating. A tiny few families in the region share a communal brewery, making their own creations then open their doors on rotation a few days a month. Here at Wolfladl it is very much an informal family affair with a warm welcome, good hospitality but without airs and graces. A core of locals and some nearby travellers sit out on the terrace in summer, while the winter months get lively inside its warren of nooks. 

http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if it'll be open before setting off here, as it's a long way to anywhere via public transport.

(Added August 2023)

name: Kramer Zoigl
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Home brewed Zoiglbier created by the owner at a communal brewery. For sale only a few days every month. Unique. Limited alternatives including local wine.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The Zoiglstube downstairs is simple and modest with mid-brown wood in a square with a 1970s style characterful tiled bar. Upstairs is a big surprise, an enormous barn line structure more like a beer hall/event space with rustic decor which indicates what the place is like on special occasions or in winter.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Characterful local life with a charismatic owner, hospitality focused. Yes, German will be expected and don't mind a few bantery comments, it's all in good nature. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, outdoor seating, event space, live music
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of the cheapest pints of beer you will find anywhere in Germany, and one of the rarer kinds took, the unfiltered kellerbier made for the Zoigl taverns. Food also very good for the price. Honest all-round.
description: Zoigl is a culture - beer brewed in a communal brewery on rotation, then served in a real family run pub which opens only a few days each month. It's a fast-dying tradition but maintained in the Oberpfalz region.
http://zoiglbier.de/zoigltermine/ Check if it'll be open before you go.
Kramer is really two pubs in one - a characterful ground floor Stube (room) and a huge barn/rustic event space upstairs. This ensures whether busy or quiet there is some sense of community and camaraderie going on. Local character is clear from the genial hospitality and guests to the simple rhythm and patter of service. As per usual with these places, the value is extraordinarily good too. Your best best to reach Falkenberg is to dedicate a hike from the other Zoigl town Windischeschenbach along the pretty Waldnaab river, then arrange a taxi back, as public transport is very limited. 

Alternatively a train to Wiesau then a 1 hour hike to Falkenberg, then a 3 hour hike through the Waldnaabtal trail to Neuhaus. This is doable, but a long trail. 

We returned after the 2023 visit to find the place just as enjoyable and possibly busier in October 2024.

(First assessed July 2023, latest update October 2024)

name: Pivnice Simona - Dobiš Zlatko
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Krusovice range, which normally wouldn't excite me, but a few unusual ones and served immaculately.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A true pajzl that may look rather intimidating inside and out. Unusually there are two taprooms to the left and to the right of the entrance, with a Vycep and a lounge room, both of which are pleasingly knackered and gloomy.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Characterful and entirely local, but a welcome is offered by the young tapster who is both friendly and competent, as other rave reviews attest to. This is a true local's local, if you like, where you can absorb an authentic, unspoilt Czech hospoda in situ. Probably not going to be everyone's cup of tea.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
TV, outdoor seating, snacks, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Great value for money across the range.
description: Both outward and inward appearances may scare off some from entering, but this working class pub in the entirely untouristy district of Drahovice is an antidote to the German pensioners, Russian millionaires and void of pub culture down the thermal springs of Karlovy Vary's centre. Unvarnished and unspoilt, this is all about a knackered place surviving warts and all. But that doesn't make it hostile, in fact far from it. Brush up on the usual Czech pleasantries and you can enjoy a friendly welcome from the young tapster getting rave reviews (and awards, it would seem) and sit among people just having a chat and getting on with their social connections. Very rarely do you encounter trouble in these sorts of places, but of course try to be respectful. The Krusovice (never a favourite of ours) is available across the range for a very good price, and immaculately poured. There was all reason to stay there and have more beers, whether in the intimate, clandestine taproom or the lounge which oozes with age and character (and a giant projector screen, it must be said). A quirky, loveable option that a portion of our readers will love, and many will either detest or be too scared to try. (Added August 2023)

name: Krkonošská hospůdka
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
The Krakonos range of beers kept and poured very well, complimented by a rotating offer from small independent brewers and craft cans in the fridge. Typical Czech back bar options.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Half-step Czech pub, a small space with curved ceilings and chunky light wood furniture. An airy but still intimate social environment.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pleasingly untouristy, but better still, actually feels like a community pub in what is still a built up urban area right by a major interchange. A true range of people helps give it that feel, it isn't simply the usual pub faces, nor is it skewed to a particular age range.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, outdoor seating, occasional live music/events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for money for the basic range, certainly competitive in Prague.
description: A venue we'd been meaning to seek out for years, this low key hospoda set in a half-step basement is an effective, typical example of Czech pub culture. Small with curved ceilings and communal furniture, the space is set for socialising with a neighbourly communal feel. Basic lagers from Krakonos are complimented by some rotating offers from small independent brewers and a fridge of cans, making it appealing to young and old. This is where to go to find out about local events, meet people and make new friends, exactly what a pub should be about. Careful of those opening hours though. (Added August 2023)

name: NAPA bar and gallery
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A broad range of cocktails, aperitivo, beers and spirits albeit mainly unremarkable.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Based in one of Mala Strana's historic buildings with typical curved ceilings and warren of rooms decorated with retro signage and artwork for sale (hence gallery).
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Lively audience, a mix of tourists, ex-pats and locals, can be loud in some corners of the pub too.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Piano, art gallery, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Not unreasonable for Mala Strana but possibly above average for Prague in general.
description: This bar and art gallery comes alive in the evenings with a vibrant younger crowd. It's not a see-and-be-seen kind of place, more an informal hangout adorned with work from local artists. Under the classic intimate curved ceilings you can enjoy cocktails, play piano, sit in a corner and socialise. While it doesn't hit all the right notes, and can be at times overly loud with its poor acoustics, there's plenty to like about it too. For a step away from the traditional pivnices NAPA is well worth a shout in this district of the city. (Added August 2023)

name: Klub Újezd
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pilsner Urquell beer but the focus is really on mixers, aperitivo and cocktails which are made - let's say passionately, rather than meticulously.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Interesting interior decor with sinister black creatures fixed to the ceiling and textured brown/yellow mottled walls. A small two room joint with limited outdoor space.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Busy and buzzy, this is one of the few real bars in between Mala Strana and Andel and they know it. Facing a busy street, there is a nice atmosphere and feeling of relevance. Inside service is friendly to tourists and locals, it stays open late too.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Late opening, snacks, limited outdoor seating.
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fair prices and one or two bargains to be found on the drinks menu which you will begin to notice as you visit other establishments in the city.
description: One of Újezd's few actual drinking focused pub/bars and it's pretty good with curved ceiling, personal character, sinister ceiling reatures and affordable cocktails, something a little extra to the average Pivnice. Stays open late every day. (added August 2023)

name: Restaurace U Šumavy
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A core range from an independent brewery outside Prague complimented by a rotating offer from regional brewers.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
1st Republic revivalism and genteel rustic charm is the theme in a typical, fairly upright 'Hostinec'. A taproom on entrance leads to a seating hall with high ceilings and twee wallpaper and surroundings.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Already an institution, but there is a hint of maintaining a tradition too, which pervades every inch of the place. Chatty lunch fare or evening socialising, albeit not as communally as some pubs.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Meals, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably good value for money for beer and the daily menu for food.
description: Revivalist genteel First Republic era pub-restaurant twinned with U Slovanske Lipy and the now closed U Vodoucha, but this is the first and best known. A terrific sense of institution and history pervades somewhere that actually has not been a centuries old fixture, testament to the tasteful decoration and setup. The format is independently brewed beers of different styles offered alongside classic Czech cooking which has a bit of flair and creativity too. While not as communal or intimate a setup, there is still a pleasant sense of institution to the place to compensate, and if you're in the area it's difficult to look past this pub. (Added August 2023)

name: Mrtvá Ryba
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good range of beer and wines from independent producers/brewers and competent back bar.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Initially plain then slowly rather intriguing. Enter through a hallway to a bar with small pub room to the right. Plain, genteel decor but on closer inspection reveals diagrams of plants and organisms, a 'life sciences' feel by virtue of its connection to the university department. Check out the insect house at the entrance too.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Friendly, young, local but with an international/collegiate welcome is the best way to describe it.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, cargo net, bbq, garden, food, snacks, events, insect house
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Entirely fair prices for food and drinks
description: A peculiar appeal which doesn't quite come through on images of the place but certainly does when you're there. A student base next to Prague's institute for life sciences, a young friendly crowd enjoy a pub decorated with diagrams of bugs and plants, with an insect house as you walk in. The garden is pleasingly verdant with some knackered chunky furniture and a cargo net to hang around it. Drinks are from independent brewers and winemakers and food is limited but good quality and all at a good price. The positives just keep on piling up. Give it a try! (added August 2023)

name: Bukowski's Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cocktail focus with a fairly broad range hammered out to a good standard. Limited beer range (and only small services) but a well-stocked back bar.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Gloomy with muted lighting, enter to find a bar straight ahead and seating either side. Candlelight and circular tables.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A famous Zizkov bar with a big tourist/ex-pat crowd, though not totally shorn of locals. Buzzy and clandestine, there's a sense of shared experience that's of value.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
A little higher for cocktails and beers than some competition, though without reaching any sort of rip off level.
description: Famous Bukowskis is never far away from the institution guide book recommendations, blogs or search engine optimised travel sites and newspaper articles, so don't be surprised to see the tourist/ex-pat crowd on most of the tables. While the hype is certainly too big for the bar to ever justify, park the slightly underwhelming feeling aside and you can objectively see why people like the place. Clandestinely lit, friendly service and a buzz to the place that deserves acknowledging. Cocktails are good and the house beer is a good one too, if a little higher priced than average. Overall you should keep this venue up your sleeve if partying late night in Zizkov. If it's too towny or touristy for you simply hop straight over the road for the opposite experience at Nad Viktorkou! (Added August 2023)

name: Gasthaus Isarthor
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of the few still serving Augustiner Helles exclusively from a wooden barrel, its quality and condition, impeccable pouring distinctly a notch above most. A compact, old-school back bar of alternatives including regional wines.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A wedge shaped pub with high ceilings, dark wood fittings, candelabras and patina of years past on the walls (or the appearance of). A large long bar at the back of the room with an oil painting hung behind.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
More of a locals enclave than others, but not hostile or unfamiliar with tourists. A clear pubby, social scene despite the Wirtshaus set up.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, limited outdoor seating.
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Not unreasonable, in fact pointedly reasonable given a near central location.
description: An Old fashioned Wirthaus and one of the few still serving Augustiner Helles exclusively from a wooden barrel, its quality and condition, impeccable pouring distinctly notable once you have had a chance to settle and enjoy your surroundings. This pub is an unspoilt 'in-the-know alternative to the big corporate beer halls of the centre. Hardly obscure but enough off the main thoroughfare to not feel the need to cater to tourists, instead offering a social space for locals while picking up the occasional more intrepid traveller. A wedge shaped pub with high ceilings, dark wood fittings, candelabras and patina of years past on the walls (or the appearance of). A large long bar at the back of the room with an oil painting hung behind. Service is a little patrician, but not hostile, while the pub itself has the feel of a place you'd like to spend a long time in, which is really the principle quality of any establishment. (Added August 2023)

name: Augustiner Stammhaus
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Augustiner Helles, Edelstoff and Dunkel on tap with the wooden barrel stuff being tapped later in the day. A shame they couldn't do it all day every day like Cologne's beer halls really.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A monumentally impressive large beer hall some of which dates back 200 years, with cavernous entrance with low-slung anterooms, giant tables and blackened fixtures complimented with warm wooden hues. A huge  Schäfflerwagenkranz, ceiling lamp catches the eye as you walk nearer to the tap. This drama extends to art nouveau arcades and fittings in the beer garden, along with other areas such as the 'Seashell', 'White Hall'. It really is one of those rare venues that astonishes.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
The huge space means there is nearly always an available table. A giant operation in which you are invited to be surrounded by social merriment. On the downside, the size and the fact you can only be in one place at any time means a singular visit can never quite fulfil.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, garden, outdoor seating, library, shop
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Not as good value as the Braustuberl itself west of the city centre, but nothing that will break the bank. A half litre of beer in such an establishment in such a city priced at under 4 euros in 2023 is pretty good.
description: An astonishing venue that will take several visits to truly explore and get a picture of. From its cavernous interior to the arcades and nouvea fittings of the gardens and anterooms, this 200 year old venue is unmissable for those who are seeking the beer hall experience, and have an eye for the aesthetic. Augustiner beer is pretty good too of course, and if the price of admission is a half litre, that's well worth paying. Be sure to explore in order to find your preferred place. The typical tourist caveats apply - service can be slow, food can be average and sometimes the experience can feel a bit churny and too family oriented, but those are pitfalls all such venues struggle to deal with. We recommend going for a beer and to socialise. As a venue it can't be overlooked. (Added August 2023)

name: Marpek Whisky
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A shelf dedicated to the best whiskies on earth. This is a specialism so don't go looking for many, if any alternatives despite the cask ale pumps decorating the bar top.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A tiny basement pub with wood fittings which immediately feel redolent of British pub rooms. Dark wood, empty whisky cases and shelving with limited seating around barrels and tables.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
There is something clandestine and fun to the experience, especially its off-beat and characterful approach twinned with a rather old school host and surroundings, though you may find the atmosphere erratic due to the small space (ie. if a group of Americans turn up and begin being loud).
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, whisky library, water as standard. Occasional events.
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
On the face of it, typical whisky prices abroad (ie. high) until the bill arrives. Really not bad at all for what you get.
description: Too good to ignore, this whisky bar offers exceptional choice and service for ludicrously good prices for its wares in a tiny wooden cave with clear British pub influences. A tasting room with a personal touch.  (added August 2023)

name: Kloster
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Franconian kellerbier in bottles, and a bases covered range of alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A small bar facing the street with quirky design. Ceiling fresco, huge mirrors, coffin secured above the door and a few macabre pieces as it dances between gothic and religious iconography

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Popular with a young audience and vaguely alternative crowd, though not exclusively, lively inside and on the benches out front.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, limited outdoor seating, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for food and drinks.
description: It has taken maybe 8 visits but we are finally convinced by this place as a firm guide addition. A tiny bar with an alternative leaning, you won't find much else in the city centre that offers similar, but it isn't simply 'best of the rest', there is a quirky design with ceiling fresco, huge mirrors, coffin secured above the door and a few macabre pieces as it dances between gothic and religious iconography. The crowd is mainly local, the drinks are pretty cheap and their new vegan kitchen is simple and affordable. Perhaps it would be nice to have more proper seating and less high tables, but that's a minor gripe. (Added August 2023

name: Bar Tante Betty
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cocktails made to a good standard, aperitivo, mixers, shots and..what's that? Quality Franconian beers.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A small bar facing the street, inside a corner stage with rich reds and golds, a tad sleazy and alternative.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A friendly, young hangout spot when gigs aren't on, but the atmosphere takes on a wider tack of institution during its live concerts.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live music performances, snacks, limited outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing overly notable for the city.
description: Jazz & Blues bar that's a cult venue in the city. Deep rich reds and sleazy speakeasy feel (particularly in winter) with a friendly, welcoming approach and largely young feel. Cocktails and aperitivo are the order of the day, but being Franconia there are of course several quality beers to go at if you simply refuse to budge. An easy walk around from the back of the castle and near the U-Bahn and tram lines, so there is really no excuse, even if it did take us 7 years to finally visit! (Added August 2023)

name: Café Wanderer & Bieramt
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good range of Franconian beers from small independent brewers and a reasonably well equipped back bar and cafe selection for alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A distinctive set up, 2 segregated huts strapped to the city walls offer a cafe with faux-medieval painted timber ceilings and an ausschank/taproom where you collect your drinks to sit on the sloped cobbles of Nuremberg's iconic old town with the castle, old wall and tall Fachwerk houses surrounding you.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of Nuremberg's popular spots in summer, there is always a buzz around the square which of course is lifted by the ability to buy booze and sit in and around this place.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, cafe, events.
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Given the location, pretty reasonable value for beers.
description: A most unusual business with two bars - a cafe and a taproom built along the city walls, with most drinking happening out on the cobbles outside of winter. You pay a deposit so the glasses don't go missing. There is some medieval style to the interiors but missing some key indoor hangout area. Nevertheless it is a hugely popular and atmospheric corner of the old town and prices are pretty reasonable considering that. (Added August 2023)

name: Brauerei Eichhorn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
The brewery's own wares, a compact but high quality range, along with a good selection of schnapps. Limited alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A sizeable, renovated Gaststatte with open plan Bierstube and a courtyard for sunny days. Decorated traditionally, execution in a slick way, but lacking much quirk or flair.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Local life and occasional travellers stopping off, a sense of direct hospitality from the tapster and a family feel even with what is not exactly an ad hoc operation. Lacking character when quiet.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, merchandise
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for food and drink
description: An excellent brewery a short bus ride from Bamberg offering a Bierstube and courtyard for drinks. The beers are standout examples of their styles for the area and delivered in an authentic manner in pristine condition. The surroundings are pleasant but undramatic, meaning the atmosphere may be a bit short on quiet days, but there is an inescapable homespun charm to it, even for an operation which has its own merchandise. Good produce, good hospitality and good prices in a pleasant environment. (Added August 2023)

name: The Drop Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Permanent range of Ossett beers on cask providing a broader selection than most. Competent, if typical back bar alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Backstreet multi-room ale house with flagstone floors, communal seating and low ceilings decorated with breweriana and fin de siecle posters.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Characterful and sympathetically decorated stone house that has a natural ambience even when quiet, with local, neighbourly life to enjoy when it gets busier.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Pub quiz, beer garden, fireplace, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for money
description: Formerly 'Oddfellows' the rather turgid name of 'Drop Inn' for this pub is probably the worst thing about it, as it's all positive after that. Ossett have done their typically tasteful refurbishment maintaining original features with sympathetic traditional decoration and maintaining a strong range of cask ales. A multiroom pub with low ceilings, there is a natural ambience to the place, which is complimented when neighbourly life pays a visit. Focusing on drinks with only pies and snacks as alternatives, this suits the format down to the ground. While it is tucked away, the pub is actually easy to reach by bus in between Halifax and Huddersfield, with the stop only 2 minutes down the street. (Added August 2023)

name: Bridge Beers
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Their own brewery available gravity poured from casks directly behind the bar. Shelves opposite the bar of bottle options. Limited alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A very tasteful and well-curated micropub with a row of stools at the bar and a wood-fit front cafe area with vintage furniture and heritage collection.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Natural ambience to the place which is enhanced by local regulars, neighbourhood gossip etc.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Old fashioned pub games, snacks, bottle shop
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value
description: A surprise find, sometimes we go to micropubs to kill time or to try some different beers but this offers more than that. With its own beers delivered direct from casks hoisted behind the bar, a bottle shop and wonderfully well curated wood-fit room, there is plenty of natural ambience to the place that makes it a nice environment to be in. Old fashioned pub games and local life add to the mixture, this wasn't just a case of exceeding modest expectations but trouncing them. A bona fide good pub. Be warned it is very small and opening hours variable, mainly early closing (Added August 2023)

name: Stalybridge Buffet Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer focus with 8 cask lines and 6 keg covering bases from traditional to modern, with some decent bottles and cans behind in the fridge. A reasonably well stocked back bar for alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
While the interior is less spectacular than online images may suggest, it remains a standout. Dating from 1885 the bar retains its original marble-topped bar, back bar fittings and fireplace. Decorated with all things railway heritage based, as you would hope and expect.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A true station bar with transient coming and goings but a cast of regulars too. The main bar has a particularly enduring charm.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Surprisingly strong - outdoor seating, fireplace, pies & snacks, quiz, community events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
On the high side for any traditional pub across the North of England.
description: One of the few surviving 'Buffet Bars' of the Victorian era, now transitioned fully into a pub, this famous venue kept alive the spirit of the 'station bar' for a century with periods where the concept was truly in the doldrums. These days it is among a cast of plenty, particularly in the North of England, and leans into its railway heritage in respect of its decor. With some original features and a broad range of real ales, there are strong raw materials here. The rises and lulls and sense of tenuous connection to the comings and goings on the rails gives it that particular station pub feel. A few points knocked off for a lack of budget beer options, and perhaps it isn't the national showstopper it is advertised, as, but leaving those aside, this remains one of the best pubs in the region and an iconic station bar for the entire country. (Added August 2023)

name: Blind Tyger
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️
description: 1st floor little cocktail bar with brooding environment and dusky setting. Unique cocktails are excellent - but not cheap! A pleasant special occasion venue to return to for cocktail lovers. (Added 2017)

name: The Boat House Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good blend of traditional cask and modern keg with some fridge options, perhaps good lagers the only glaring shortcoming on the beer front. A perfunctory back bar. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Dock side pub which leads directly out onto the canal lock with its rows of tourist barges and holiday barges. The theme continues inside in a small curved interior, with seating out on the front.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Always busy and social with a good range of locals and daytrippers.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks, books, games
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for a free house with some explicitly cheaper options available.
description: After a few visits we're convinced to add this dock side bar to our guide. A distinctive location on the corner of a canal dock with rows of barges and waterside views both inside and out. A small venue inside, flinging its windows open in summer with terrace seating, there is a very pleasant atmosphere with a blend of locals and daytrippers enjoying the surroundings in a natural social setting. The beer options are pretty good on cask and keg, and in the fridge, perhaps missing a couple of lagers of better standard to complete the set. (Added August 2023)

name: Pravda Beer Theatre
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Iconic brewery and beer hall with Ukrainian craft beers, oompah band performances and galleries of tables. (Added 2018)

name: Blandy's Wine Lodge (former Adegas de São Francisco)
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Reputed Madeira and wines
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A complex to explore with barrels stored in the roof to aid evaporation, and a series of tasting rooms downstairs. Blackened beams, exposed stone, frescos and large shelves of old bottles create a characterful, if well-financed scene. The most character room is arguably the Fresqueira vintage room.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
An island institution and big name with throngs of tour groups and visitors. Not a place with many regulars, as such. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Restaurant, gift shop, tours, outdoor seating, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Undeniably premium prices but corresponding to the quality.
description: According to Blandy's website, the premises have a unique micro-climate due to its solar exposure, brick roofs, thick stone walls and wooden floor.

We would agree with them that each one of the Lodge’s rooms has its own character. The eastern warehouse holds wine dating back to 1920 and the family’s private vintage collection is held within thick stone walls. 

Due to the differing temperatures and humidity, their Madeira wines all have differing ageing profiles based on their location.

You can take a tour or even just wander around the premises with various tasting parlours, which have kept their character well. A central courtyard provides a distinctive identity. While you will not find many regulars, there is nevertheless much to get stuck into at this storied complex.

(added 2023)

name: Madeira Rum House
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Rum specialists (who would have thought it) but there is a perfunctory range of alternatives and one tap beer. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Attractive interior of wooden cabinets cabinets, upturned tables and a worn in bar area. Rectangular room which spills out onto the street with patio furniture.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Terrace style atmosphere with the sounds of the street and personal service from the staff.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Small plates, snacks, shop, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Pretty average/city prices overall.
description: According to the owner, the idea of Madeira Rum House came from his mentor Roberto Andrade, who, due to his life experience, decided to create a place where anyone can taste the delicious agricole rum, while also sharing the history of the production on the Island and in Portugal. This informs the experience here which blends knowledge with hospitality. There is a shop selling rums and cigars, but it operates entirely in balance with the bar. Rum, and Madeira's famous drink Poncha are at the forefront of the drinks offerings, but they make cocktails and have a tap for the generic lager too. A fairly characterful interior of wooden cabinets, upturned barrels and classical, charmingly worn design isn't the worst, but the terrace is where you'll find people most days of the year, with the natural sounds of a busy street of restaurants, live music and a personal touch from the staff. Among the better places to end up in Funchal. (added 2023)

name: Pavilhão Chinês
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An extensive cocktail menu which is the focus. The cocktails are mainly classical right down to the glacé cherries, but competent. For alternatives, this is a well stocked bar which only really falls short in terms of its beer selection which could use an update.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
The reason to visit. 5 large rooms with a high ceiling are given over to a private collection of a single individual, Luis Pinto Coelho. A former grocery store dating back to 1901, the place was reimagined in the 1980s to a museum/bar. A faux-Chinese entrance with a locked door leads to a large room with rows of glass fronted cabinets up the walls, then the bar itself with enormous backlit ceiling piece and grand bar, a side room of WWII memorabilia, and back corridor leading to a large billiards room, similarly decorated, where a second bar and private events are held.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A series of waistcoated servers, one who will greet you at the door keep the place feeling fairly formal, at odds with the curiosities and whimsy of the bar itself, but are probably necessary to maintain order. There is a sense of being among something unique and special, hushed tones of people pointing at the next item that catches their eye. This becomes a little more informal with live music and billiards in the backroom. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Billiards, live music, snacks, occasional events.
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Undeniably a little higher than normal Lisbon prices, but in line with the overall experience and nothing to frighten western wallets.
description: Ah, the experience of stepping into the Chinese Pavilion for the first time, like wandering into an old fashioned collection, then a grand bar with further rooms to the side and rear. Don't leave here without having a good look around, even if the stiff service makes you feel like you should be pinned in your seat, it's definitely not the case. Such a collection is not easily copied or repeated, neither is it integrated into a bar with such ease. It is simply one of the standout venues in Europe to attempt something like this. WWII memorabilia, belle epoque cocktail menus, grotesque giant busts, model train sets, large oil paintings, billiard tables and much more besides provide an experience that is as distracting as it is intense, more still when their old fashioned cocktails slip down. A must-do experience in Lisbon, in Portugal, in Europe...in the world. (Added September 2023)

name: Procópio bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Mixers, cocktails, limited beers and ciders but a broad, reasonably good range overall.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Early 70s build taking cues from Art Nouveau and the turn of the 20th century. A one room bar in a building set apart from its neighbours by a park. Inside, wood strip with hues of reds, golds and brown with seating around a series of carefully plotted out boots to maximise space. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
An innate natural ambience, accentuated by reds, golds and wood fittings provides a superb setting for socialising. Despite the special venue the character remains largely local and neighbourly with groups of friends, local couples and people who seem to know and love the place. Jazz & Blues plays, though not exclusively.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Tostadas, snacks, popcorn with drinks, private events, TV
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Though not great value, certainly fair, and drinks do include popcorn, for what that's worth.
description: The early 70s build of this fantastic bar explains its unusual fixtures, fittings and layout. It isn't something that would be made these days, nor could its natural character be produced from scratch, at least not without considerable care and even more money. Located by attractive Amoreiras garden, the approach passing a spotlit fountain feels immediately appealing, further still on entry. One room only, but a well fitted room provides plenty of space to sit, whether you're flying solo or in a big group. An innate natural ambience, accentuated by reds, golds and wood fittings provides a superb setting for socialising. Despite the special venue the character remains largely local and neighbourly with groups of friends, local couples and people who seem to know and love the place. Procopio benefits from being set enough out of the centre to deter the tourists partying in the Bairro Alto but still relevant and cosmopolitan enough to catch and welcome some side business. A 5th generation family operation which remains in the Coelho family name, also connected to bars such as Pavilhao Chines and Foxtrot.

Drinks are largely focused on mixers and cocktails, though there are some beers and ciders including a couple of craft options. It is simply an unmissable venue when in Lisbon. (Added September 2023)

name: Foxtrot
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cocktails take up the forefront of the menu, however there
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Art Deco frontage including a sign on the mosaic pavement tiles. This leads to a far more eclectic, though still carefully curated interior. The bar area itself is characterful with its hive of bottles, fireplace and wood-strip ceiling. Everything looks just that slight bit different to anything you've seen before, and that's deliberate. The bar plunges through to further rooms including a very cosy baroque side-room and back room with pool table.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A highly distinctive character which you'd expect from its 50 years of service, enjoyable ambience whether busy or quiet.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, fireplaces, pool table
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Cocktails and food are available for a reasonably fair price. 
description: Opening in the 1970s alongside sister bar Procopio, but maintained in appearance since then, to great effect. You can tell this hasn't been invented last week because it simply wouldn't. Combining the lounge environments and casual feel of a pub with some of the intimacy and personal service of a cocktail bar, you get the best of both worlds here. Ring for entry, but after that you'll find service relaxed and chatty. The bar area itself is characterful with its hive of bottles, fireplace and wood-strip ceiling. Everything looks just that slight bit different to anything you've seen before, and that's deliberate. The bar plunges through to further rooms including a very cosy baroque side-room and back room with pool table. If you can handle the initial formality there's no reason why this wouldn't be a regular fixture for your Lisbon night out. (Added September 2023)

name: Associação Loucos e Sonhadores
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Basic drinks focused on covering basics affordably rather than catering for epicureans. Beer, cocktails, mixers, spirits and most in between.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Bairro Alto's more offbeat choice, a pleasingly personalised venue of eclectric decor and ornaments. A front room with instruments, small bar, and seated corridor leading to a conservatory area. Warm hued and distinctly unlike any of the cookie cutter bars you'll be normally used to hanging out it.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A truly mixed crowd where excited young groups mix with sunbaked dropouts, with all kinds of pseuds, betas, nice guys and arty folk, creating a real sense of community that does justice to the name.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, limited outdoor space, live music
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A standout for good honest value in the district both for their drinks and the array of basic food. 
description: The Association of Fools and Dreamers? No prizes for guessing what crowd they are aiming for at this bar! Formerly at Travessa do Conde de Soure, they have moved to more spacious environs. With a wonderfully welcoming frontage they may attract a wider catchment of people than they advertise. As you enter you'll see instruments to your left and a small bar, while the venue extends through to a longer conservatory area looking out onto a small leafy yard with pot plants. Distinctive, personalised and great value too. Everything about it draws you in. (Added September 2023)

name: A Ginjinha
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Espinheira Ginjinha - sour cherry liqueur is the main event and what you will see everyone having. However they do have a menu card with some alternatives - or accompaniments, as it ought to be. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A classic hole in the wall that resembled a shrine in a niche every bit as it does a bar. Colourful signage while underneath there is a counter surrounded by glass cabinets of Ginja. The counter is engraved with recognition of its historic medal-winning exploits. By the bar is a spitoon for expelling the cherry pips, a sink, and a bin.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
All about the ritual. Join in the fun, do as the locals do, enjoy the novelty. Here for a good time not a long time.
Amenities/Events: ❤️
A sink? A bin? There isn't even a toilet. It does sell the booze by the bottle for tourists. 
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
description: Opened in 1840 and run by the same family for 5 generations, there is an argument to be made that A Ginjinha is little more than a kiosk. However, a visit at busier times will dispel that notion. Little more than a hole in the wall, 1 or 2 old guys man the bar, decanting Ginjinha (or Ginja for short), serving them by the measure either 'com' (with cherries) or 'sem' without. Not specifying will usually result in you receiving the cherries which have been sat in the boozy soup both imparting flavour and soaking it up. Take your shot onto the street and mingle with the crowd. You may desire something to chase it down with - they do sell small beers and some other drinks alongside the main event. All about the ritual. Join in the fun, do as the locals do, enjoy the novelty. Here for a good time not a long time. (Added September 2023)

name: LX Brewery
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beers brewed and served on site, limited soft drink alternatives and some cider.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pleasingly low key and unshowy, a garage converted to a brewery with chunky furniture and a thoroughly unpretentious approach. Hidden away in an alley on a hilltop, it also feels like a nice hideaway in the city. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A friendly, characterful spot, you'll note the brewery owners themselves milling about and setting up bits and pieces. Community events and an atmosphere of calm and friendliness and unpretentiousness is everything you're looking for from a backstreet brewpub.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Own brewed beers, off-sales, brewing shop, live events, music, snacks, board games, books, computer games
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Pretty standard fare, maybe a touch cheaper than the central craft beer bars. 
description: It's always refreshing when rocking up to the next brewpub to come away with a feeling not only of a distinctive venue but distinctly different people too. Out with the pretension and petty megalomania, and in with making nice beer and fostering a community of people. With a clear collegiate, international flavour without losing  any of its Lisboa character, you'll find a garage on a hill, tucked away, which feels like a hidey hole from the hustle of the city. Inside anything will be going on from brewing, live music, projected live events, board games, books, computer games or off-sales of brewing equipment and materials. Very likeable as a result. (Added September 2023)

name: Casa Independente
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A competent but not standout array of options that almost feels like they're annoyed at having to cater for people rather than being proud of it in any way.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Art gallery and apartment complex turned bar, you may find some exhibits even in the entranceway - on our visit we had to climb through one! On the first floor a bar and colourful roof terrace with DJ set acts as a stylish, but not overdone location. During the evenings further rooms are opened for hangouts and cultural events.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A calm early evening venue, but this is mainly about art and music, which you'll be better off exploring as a group as the evening progresses
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Art gallery, exhibitions, live music, snacks, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Not especially notable.
description: The venue that put the Intendente district on the map, so they say. Notable for being a primary venue for Zouk Bass, the offerings have since expanded outwards. An apartment bar with art installations throughout and clearly rotating offer of music and art. On the 1st floor a colourful terrace strikes just the right line of being casual and bohemian, rather than a more angular, mainstream see and be seen crowd. It is an arty place though, so expect some pretension leanings here and there. The bar offerings are perfunctory rather than notable, but do the job adequately as you sashay around the various rooms enjoying the buzz, the art and culture. One to try. (Added September 2023)

name: Janela da Atalaia
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
House special cocktails from an intriguing list, limited but decent craft beer options and a well stocked back bar. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Corner bar that has a quietly unshowy style to it. A one-room affair, a mixture of strategic lighting around the bar, natural exposed walls and candlelight. There's an original inset sink from the venue's previous function.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Stylish yet casual, cool yet welcoming, that's what you're seeking from such a place. A low key but very much relevant feeling destination.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
TV, snacks and small plates, very limited outdoor seating. 

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: Another Lisbon cocktail bar that feels far more informal, unshowy and 'all-rounder' than most around Europe. Run by Fred Gonçalves, this corner bar has clearly enjoyed a previous life as a shop. One of those cool yet casual places where there is no jarring conflict at all between a small tv on the wall showing football, and the oozing candlelit cool of exposed brick and cocktails. That speaks to good curations and good management. One of Bairro Alto's best. (Added September 2023)

name: Alfredo Portista
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Basic budget range of working class drinks.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Highly distinctive blue colour scheme from the shutter doors, to the tiling to the FC Porto memorabilia on the walls. It's a tiny bar, virtually a corridor with a long aluminium counter, basic seats and some leaning posts near the back
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
As close as you will get to working class pub culture near the centre of Porto. Regulars familiar with each other, a pattern and rhythm to the day, ritual of service, carried out quite separate from tourism going on around it.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Petiscos (snack food) nibbles, TV
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of the cheapest central bars in the city, some of the prices will make you quadruple-take.
description: 60+ years young, this narrow 'tasca' has been curated into a near-shrine to FC Porto, however for several reasons that is not among the most interesting things about it. For a start, we are very central in Porto at this point, an area in the city where wholesome working class businesses are dying out fast following inundations of tourists and fly-by-night Americans coming to work remotely. The prospect of finding such a place these days without venturing further out is becoming remote. Then the prices - rub your eyes, rub them again. Yes, in 2023 the sight of a sign advertising a litre of wine for 2 euros, whatever the wine may be, is certainly eye catching. A beer for a Euro, a Ginja for 50 cents? Really. Alfredo Portista serves petiscos (snacks) as well as full meals, petinga ( tiny sardines) or bacalhau with arroz de couve ( cabbage rice) or rojões (fried pork with potatoes). Snacks include Bifana, a famous Portuguese fast food dish - flash fried steak in a bun. Mingling among the locals, soaking up the rhythm and atmosphere of an unspoilt pub with a firm identity and a sense that it's going nowhere anytime soon. Let's hope that stays the case. (Added September 2023)


Added 2023

name: CLUB port rugby
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Well-stocked with a good range of beer, including Belgian bottles and a competent back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Strange to say about a sports bar, but the décor really is a standout with its engraved wooden panels, ceiling embellishments, chandeliers and roman columns. These are inherited from the 19th century private members club whose basement they inhabit. A bar to the left of the entrance with main pub room and rear games room straight ahead.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Falling between houses, not quite a fully fledged sports club, nor theme pub, nor function room, but pleasant usually, even during quieter times.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Televised sport, pool tables, food, snacks, community events, DJ nights
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair with some occasional discounts on offer too.
description: Operating in the basement of the oldest private members club in Porto (1869), a sports club is not the sort of place most culture vultures would think of seeking out, yet it quickly, calmly sets out a compelling argument. The club aspect is maintained with a bell at the door. You will be greeted then ushered in. The bar is to your left, well stocked with a good range of beer, including Belgian bottles and a competent back bar. Move through to a large seating area with eye catching engraved wainscotting, wooden panels on the ceiling and chandeliers, the walls festooned with sporting memorabilia. There is a typically high Victorian romance too with its Roman columns, all a bit more than you'd expect. The sporting aspect is maintained with scheduled events displayed on a projector and a series of pool tables to the rear of the room. They host gatherings from various community groups and have an attendant DJ on some nights too. In the end they achieve something for everyone without making the offering too jarring or too diluted, which is to its credit. (Added September 2023)

name: Baobab - craft beer bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer specialists. 6 tap options covering Portuguese craft beer usually with 1 or 2 options from further afield. This is complimented by 2 large fridges. Perfunctory alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A café bar feel, one room with light furnishings and plants

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A busy room with a social hubbub, the product attracts the people and the people give the place the atmosphere rather than the venue.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, occasional events, limited outdoor seating.
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Expensive, though in line with other craft beer bars in the city.
description: With Slovenian owners, this explained a hint of the Slavic touch to the place. It's a light wood café, the whiteness mercifully compensated for with some plants and decoration. Small venue with a handful of tables, but well worth venturing all the way inside as there can be space at the back. Concentrating on Portuguese craft beer, though not exclusively, you can be sure both of a well-curated range and help and advice at the bar. A large fridge selection compliments that further. As well as the product, it's a nice place to hangout. Sure, the environment leans more towards bland/safe, but the social atmosphere when busy compensates to the extent that we're happy to include it on our guide. (Added September 2023)

name: Pub Bonaparte Foz
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Last-gen options, but we can still be glad of them, with wheatbeer on tap and some good Belgian bottles in the fridge.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Eclectic ornaments in a two storey pub that manages to escape the trappings of Irish pub décor while still feeling distinctly pubby. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The surroundings help create an informality and pub atmosphere similar to England, with different groups and backgrounds mixing together. Lively, buzzy and noisy at times.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, TV, live events, limited outdoor space
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Neither overpriced nor particularly cheap.
description: Among true 'all rounders' on our guide, Bonaparte Foz, as well as its central Porto sister pub 'Bonaparte Downtown' have pitched the offering on a narrow overlap of complimentary interests. Yes, beer specialists are covered here by a few items in the bottle range, while those interested in the interior will note the venue manages to subtly remain eclectic and pubby without falling intro Irish pub tropes or derivative ideas. The atmosphere is collegiate - you'll be as likely to find excitable groups of young women as you will middle aged businessmen, as you will young couples, giving it a similar atmosphere to a superior English pub overall. This is all achieved while offering food, sport on TV, occasional live music and views of the Atlantic from the top floor. Kudos. (Added September 2023)

name: Tejo Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Basic options covering the bases adequately, with some very passable house wine a bonus.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Tiny Alfama bar overlooking a small square and play area, with a cobble slope out of the front step. Inside a wall of musical instruments and colourful artwork. Perhaps a maximum capacity of 30 people.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live music venue bringing in everyone from buskers to famous faces, this is not a polished Fado restaurant but an international open-minded gritty folk club which even welcomes performances from guests in an open mic style. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, house guitar, limited outdoor space
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value.
description: Brazilian Mané do Café (nickname), is an artist, novelist and poet, and presides over daily readings, occasionally bursting forth with a frenzied accordion performance. In between he manages the service while his partner manages the bar. A friendly, ramshackle and dynamic venue where you can feel electricity in their air some nights - chance meetings, new friendships and the clubbing together of musicians. An absolutely tiny bar, you'll do well to cleave a spot for yourself let alone your friends. The bar keeps almost nocturnal rhythms, often carrying on until dawn. Currents fees (2023) are 5 euros to cover the musicians and the food and drink is inoffensively priced (although not really genuinely cheap either). The raw authenticity has inevitably travelled via word of mouth to the point where it has attracted some famous faces, but it works best as the gritty, no-names all passion bar it started off as and ought to remain. (Added September 2023)

name: Southampton Arms
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Boasting to be the only London pub solely serving beer from independent breweries with 10 cask handpulled ales with a keg selection and ciders to match. An impressive offering competing in this category with anything in London.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
